loans.name: Martha De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Martha Gonzales es una persona muy trabajadora que tiene su propio negocio de pulpería habiéndolo iniciado desde hace cuatro años y hoy en día se ha ido desarrollando porque ella ha invertido en dicha pulpería. 
Ella es madre de tres hijos pero ya no viven con ella por lo que le toca a ella mima velar por el bienestar de su negocio. Por ello es que solicita un crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería entre los que se encuentran galletas, golosinas, papel higiénico y también para la compra de ropa para niños y niñas con el fin de comercializarlas en su pulpería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Gonzalez is a very hard working person and has her own convenience store and has had it for 4 years, it has grown because she has invested a lot in it.

She is a mother to 3 children but they no longer live with her, and it is up to her to take care of her business. She needs a loan to buy products for her store such as cookies, candy, toilet paper, and also to buy children’s clothing to sell them in her convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize for her convenience store.

loans.name: Alie A.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured are teachers from a primary school in Masomgbo village, one of the villages surrounding Makeni City. This school was established in 1950 to train children of the Masomgbo community, and villages close to it, as future leaders. Over the years, the school has produced a great number of lecturers, teachers, and other professionals in different walks of life. Currently, the school has 488 pupils and a staff of 13 teachers.

This is the second loan these teachers are accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-seven-year-old Alie A. S. (left) is the headmaster at the school and has been a teacher for 36 years. He was born in Masomgbo village, and is married with ten children; some of his children are in primary school, some in secondary school, and others are in college. Alie will use his loan to pay his children's school fees. (Attached on the photo is a snapshot of 2 staff members who were not present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children

loans.name: Angelica Isabel

texts.es: Angelica tiene 20 años es soltera, estudio hasta el 5o grado y lleva 5 años dedicada a la produccion de calzado junto con su madre y sus hermanos. Ahora ha acudido a ASDIR para solicitar un credito para poder comprar dos herramientas para la fabricacion de zapato. Con esta actividad ella y su familia han logrado estabilizarse economicamente.
texts.en:
Angelica is 20 years old and single. She went to school until the fifth grade. She has been making footwear with her mother and her siblings for five years. She has now come to ASDIR to request a loan to be able to buy two tools for making shoes. She and her family have been able to stabilize themselves economically through this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for making shoes

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña Maria Teresa es habitante de la colonia Puerto Principe de Nueva Guinea, es casada con el productor Wilfredo Cruz, tiene 6 hijos, los cuales le ayudan al trabajo que desarrolla en las actividades del campo estableciendo cultivos de raices y tuberculos, ordeño y el cuido del hato ganadero, donde obtiene sus ingresos económico, su finca presenta buenas condiciones técnica.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito para compra de terneros para cuidarlos y desarrollarlos, es decir engordarlos para que obtengan un buen peso que al venderlos le permita obtener buenas ganancias que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Doña Teresa es una mujer emprendedora en su que hacer de la finca, honesta y de buenas costumbres, sus deseo en el futuro es de incrementar su inventario ganadero, asì tener mejores condiciones para sus hijos, pues es la herencia que podra darles cuando les falte.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Teresa is a resident of the Puerto Principe subdivision of Nueva Guinea. She is married to Wilfredo Cruz, who is an agricultural producer. They have six children who help with the farm activities such as cultivating their root and tuber crops, and nursing and taking care of their cattle herd. Her farm has suitable conditions which help them generate income.

She is requesting her second loan to buy calves to care for and raise. The calves will be fattened to achieve a good weight for resale, which will help them obtain good earnings and help improve the family’s living conditions. Doña Teresa is an enterprising woman who has established her farm through honest work and great discipline. Her wish for the future is to increase her herd so that she can provide her children with better conditions and leave them an inheritance so that they lack nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur  Ibrahima D. est un jeune garçon  ambitieux de 24 ans qui vit à Ouakam et est membre de la caisse depuis quelques années. Il a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur  au sein de l’institution. Il a une activité très diversifiée  de commerce car il vend en même  temps des vaisselles, des matelas, des lits, des armoires et des produits de quincaillerie. Il a une expérience  de 10 ans dans  le commerce. Et c’est par le biais de son père qu’il exerce aujourd’hui cette activité. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des lits et armoires destines a la vente. Les prêts  l’aident a acquérir  d’autres biens.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima D. is a 24-year old young man who lives in Ouakam. He has been a member of the credit association for a few years. He has already received previous loans from the institution. He has a very diversified retail activity. He sells dishes, mattresses, beds, cupboards, and hardware items. He has a ten-year experience in the business. He learned the business he is practicing today through his father. He is requesting a loan of 500, 000 Francs [XOF] ] in order to buy beds and cupboards for resale. The loans help him acquire other items.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengtening capital

loans.name: Omolade

texts.en: To earn a living in Ogbomosho, Omolade sells colorful sarongs and items made of lace. Her customers are mostly young ladies and married women. She hopes to own a boutique in the future, but for now has applied for a loan for N80,000 to buy more sarongs and lace items to sell at her current location. She is 34 years old, married and has four children. She takes great joy in the fact that they are excelling in school. Omolade and her husband, who also works hard, extend their sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs and lace items to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 32 years old and married with one child who is three years old. He grows vegetables and cereals on his farm to earn a living. He has been in the business for thirteen years and has three employees.

Moses saves his money on a weekly basis with his group in Faulu Kenya which enables him to access loans which the group guarantees. He has previously taken out two loans from Faulu Kenya of Kes 60,000 which he used to expand his business and which he successfully repaid.

Moses hopes to grow his business to large-scale farming and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy farm inputs and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and seedlings

loans.name: Corazon's Group

texts.en:
Corazon B. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 45 years old. Corazon is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is B.'s Group.

Corazon is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP average a month for these activities.

In 2007, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Corazon from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S. prepares cassava dough and bags of water for sale at Takoradi. She is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Victoria uses her income to help her husband provide food, clothing and shelter for the family. Victoria will use the loan to purchase more cassava to prepare cassava dough for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Victoria plans to support her home.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Budumbuli East Development Group, Jinja

texts.en:
38-year-old K. Glades is a sturdy, evergreen and down-to-earth married woman. For a decade now she has been plying a roaring trade in her restaurant business in Bugembe, Jinja. The fact that she has been doing great business all this while goes without saying. Of paramount importance to her in establishing a firm niche in the minds of her customers and on the market has been the embracing of good customer care skills. This in many respects worked in her favor.

Glades began with a pancake-selling business before she nurtured the whole idea of setting up this restaurant business. To manifest that she and her family can live within the means provided by this business, all her five children are attending good schools and she has bought a commercial taxi.

In the course of time, Glades has reached a satisfactory profit-maximizing point in her business. In a week, she makes profits to the tune of 120,000 shillings and she is anticipating even better prospects with the acquisition of this loan. She also ekes out supplementary profits from her taxi business. The purchase of substantial amounts of foodstuffs for her restaurant is what is in the offing for her.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant business

loans.name: Citali Group

texts.es:
ESTE  GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA CITLALI Y SIGNIFICA LUCERO ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN, MORELOS, MEXICO, ESTA FORMADO POR 6 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN Y SON VECINO LOS INVITO LA SRA. EMELIA  Y ESTUBIERON DE ACUERDO EN SOLICITAR EL CREDITO NO. 1 CON FUNDACION REALIDAD.

EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES LA SEÑORA ADELA B. R., TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 3º. GRADO DE SUCUNDARIA Y TIENE 4 HIJOS, 3 HOMBRES Y 1 MUJER, CESAR TIENE 19 AÑOS, SOLEDAD 14 AÑOS, FRANCISCO 12 Y ALEXIS TIENE 6 AÑOS. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA VENTA DE BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS, SU CREDITO LO QUIERE PARA COMPRAR BLUSAS Y SERVILLETA, INICIO ESTE NEGOCIO HACE 6 AÑOS POR NECECIDADES ECONOMICAS Y PARA QUE SUS NIÑOS FUERAN A LA ESCUELA, SU TIO LE HACE LAS BLUSAS TEJIDAS A GANCHO DE ESTAMBRE Y LAS SERVILLETA, VENDE LA MERCANCIA EN SU COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN LAS VA OFRECIENDO DE CASA EN CASA Y SI LAS TERMINA, SU HIJA LE AYUDA A COBRARLES A LOS CLIENTES QUE LE QUEDAN A DEBER. EL NEGOCIO HA AYUDADO A SU FAMILIA EN LA ALIMENTACION Y GASTOS DE LA ESCUELA DE SUS HIJOS, CON LAS GANACIAS COMPRA MAS BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS. ELLA DESEA HACER SU COCINA YA QUE TIENE UNA PROVISIONAL SOLO CON UN TECHO ESPERA LOGRARLO VENDINDO MAS BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS. 
EN SU COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN EL CLIMA ES FRESCO, HAY MUCHAS FRUTAS PERAS, CAPULINES, DURAZNOS, CIRUELA, HAY MUCHA VEGETACION, ÁRBOLES, PINOS Y FLORES MUY BONITAS, TAMBIEN HAY MUCHOS ANIMALES BORREGOS, CHIVOS, ETC. 
LA SRA. ADELA B. R. LES DA LAS GRACIAS A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD POR ABERME PRESTADO Y CONFIARON EN MI, ESPERO NO QUEDAR MAL.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Citali" (meaning "Bright Star") and is located in the community of Hueyapan, Morelos, Mexico. The group is made up of six members who know one another and are neighbors. Ms. Emelia invited them to get together and they agreed to request their first loan from Fundacion Realidad. The representative of this group is Ms. Adela B. R.. She is 40 years old and educated through the third year of secondary school. She has four children (three boys and one girl). Cesar is 19, Soledad is 14, Francisco is 12, and Alexis is 6 years old. Adela sells shirts and napkins. She is requesting this loan to buy shirts and napkins. She started this business six years ago out of economic necessity and in order to send her children to school. Her uncle makes crocheted tops and napkins from yarn. She sells the merchandise in her community of Hueyapan by going from house to house offering her goods. Her daughter helps her to collect payment from customers who owe her money. The business has helped to feed her family and to pay her children's school expenses. With her earnings, she buys more tops and napkins. She would like to improve her kitchen, as she currently has only a provisional kitchen with just a roof. She hopes to achieve this by selling more shirts and napkins. In her community of Hueyapan, the climate is cool and there are many fruits, such as pears, chokecherries, peaches, and plums. There is a lot of vegetation like trees, pine trees, and very beautiful flowers. There are also many animals, like lambs, goats, etc. Ms. Adela B. R. thanks Kiva and Fundacion Realidad for lending to her and for having confidence in her. She hopes she will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses and napkins

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, V. Marthe vit dans ce quartier depuis sa naissance. Marthe est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé, mais Marthe ne vit plus avec son mari. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Marthe assure les charges de son enfant. Marthe n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Ayant abandonné l’école, Marthe a appris ensuite la coiffure et l’exerce depuis treize ans environs. De façon secondaire, Marthe vend dans son atelier de coiffure, des mèches, des produits pour cheveux et aussi des tissus. Marthe achète ses produits au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Marthe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et d’accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Marthe V. has lived in the Ekpè neighborhood of the commune of Sèmè-Podji since her birth there in 1974. She has one child who has been to school, but no longer lives with her husband. With the income from her business, Marthe can take care of her child's needs. Marthe went to primary school, then dropped out. She learned how to be a hairdresser, and has worked at her trade about 13 years. Additionally, she sells hairpieces and other hair products, and cloth. She buys her stock at Ouando market in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She is asking for her first loan from ALIDé so as to build her inventory and attract more customers.,

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair products

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria es casa con Jose tiene 2 hijos los cuales aun son D. edad escolar. doña Maria venD. D. casa en casa Ropa tipica y en sus tiempos libres borda Servilletas y también las venD.. Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar mas mercaderia para poder ofrecerles a sus clientas mas variedad. Ella sueña con tener su propio local y asi tener mas variedad y mas clientela.
texts.en:
Maria is married to Jose. They have two children who are of school age. Doña Maria sell traditional clothing door to door. In her spare time, she makes embroidered napkins that she also sells.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can offer her customers more variety. Her dream is to have her own store where she can maintain a wider inventory and accommodate more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing

loans.name: Salinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Salinas lo conforman tres jóvenes mujeres, luchadoras, emprendedoras y decididas a salir siempre adelante. Reyna Isabel Román F. de 29 años es la coordinadora de éste grupo se dedica a la venta de ropa en los alrededores de su casa de habitación y en la comunidad de Tisma desde hace tres años, ella tiene dos hijos los cuales son su fuente de inspiración para su lucha día a día.

Raquel del Socorro S. Pérez de 33 años se dedica a la venta de leche, cuajada y queso de modo ambulante en el departamento de Managua y Angélica María C. R. de 21 años a la venta de pescado, también de modo ambulante en Tisma. Ellas destinarán el dinero prestado a la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en:
The Salinas group is comprised of three enterprising young women who are dedicated to coming out on top. Reyna Isabel Román F., 29-years-old, is the coordinator of this group. For three years she has sold clothes in the area around her house and in the community of Tisma. She has two children who are the inspiration for her daily struggle. Raquel del Socorro S. Pérez, 33-years-old, travels around selling milk, curds, and cheese in the department of Managua. Angélica María C. R., 21-years-old, travels around selling fish in Tisma. They will invest the loan money in the purchase of more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old divorced woman living alone. In 2005, she started working as a housekeeper to earn income. She works hard to be able to satisfy her needs.  Her work is very hard and it needs physical strength.  Her story illustrates day-to-day challenges in trying to meet the heavy demands of her life's conditions.  She works upon request of the clients wanting her to clean their homes. 

Today, she is asking to borrow $800 to purchase a cleaning machine because she is planning to start cleaning companies.  She needs to have a bigger machine for this purpose. She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to take on more projects.

loans.use: purchase a cleaning machine

loans.name: Siyet

texts.en:
Mrs. Siyet T., 47 years old, and her husband, Mr. Pov Yan, 49 years old, have been married since 1986 and have six children:  two sons and four daughters. One sells beauty products, three attend school, one is a garment factory worker and another is a traditional musician. They live with their parents about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Siyet has been running a grocery store at home for ten years. Her husband has full-time employment. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase beauty products and grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and grocery items for resale

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 9 años que estudia, Berta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy y solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de frutas.
Los sueños de Berta son comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Berta has a live-in partner and one 9-year-old son who is in school. Berta has a post in the 12 de abril marketplace where she sells a variety of fruits. She tends to her business every day from 6 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. 

Berta is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank and is seeking a loan of 1,000 soles for the purchase of fruit. Her dreams are to buy a car so that her partner may work and to have her children educated.

loans.use: To purchase fruits

loans.name: Women In Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Women In Unity” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 3,600,000 in order to expand the size and quality of their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is Fudia K., pictured on the left. Fudia is age 56. She was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are no longer attending school. Fudia has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells firewood and she will use her share of this loan to buy firewood in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy firewood in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Khaled

texts.ar: خالد عمره 44 سنة لديه اربعة اولاد وزوجة يعمل في بيع القهوة والاكسبرس وايضا في مجال بيع السكاكر والزيوت والحبوب لديه رغبة في تحسين وضعه الاجتماعي  ووضع اولاده من خلال تأمين عيش افضل وتامين القوت اليومي لهم وهذا من خلال اخذ قرض من المجموعة لشراء مكنة اكسبرس قهوة وايضا مكنة ايس كريم لديه محبة من جميع محيطه وله زبائنه الخاصين ولديه تاريخ مشرف مع المجموعة انه ملتزم جدا وهو يرغب في فتح مصلحه خاصة له وتطوير نفسه .

loans.use: To buy a coffee machine

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
El Comité Juntas Podemos es un excelente  comité conformado el 08 de Enero del 2010, integrado por 20 mujeres.
Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Amancia A. que  se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 3° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Es uno de los mejores grupos que se encuentra trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya, ya que la mayoría de las integrantes del grupo siguen activas desde el primer préstamo y con eso demuestran solidaridad y compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Amancia  quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella es una mujer que procura diariamente por su familia. 
Y con la ayuda que recibe de parte de sus amigas del comité han está logrando mejorar su negocio renovando sus mercaderías, y recurriendo a otras técnicas de ventas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías (ropas como: remeras, camisas, pantalones, shorts, y otros) para su negocio ya que la temporada de mucha venta con la época festiva siempre llega, y desea satisfacer todos los pedidos de los clientes.
texts.en:
The excellent Juntas Podemos (Together We Can) group was formed on January 8th, 2010, and is composed of twenty women. It was formed thanks to the efforts of Sra. Amancia A. who approached the advisor at a credit renewal meeting she was holding in the area regarding the program for working women. The advisor was very enthusiastic and wanted to work with the group. Now they have been happily working together for three loan cycles.

The group is one of the best working with Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya as the majority of the women in the group have been doing the same work since the time of the first loan, thus demonstrating their commitment and friendship.

One of the members is Sra. Amancia who earns her living by selling clothing on a daily basis to support her family. With the help of her friends in the group, she has succeeded in improving her business, updating her stock, and using other sales techniques. 

Amancia is seeking a loan to buy more clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, shorts etc. for her business as the high season for sales is approaching, and she wants to be able to fulfill all her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, shorts, blouses etc.

loans.name: Yesenia De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Yesenia es un clienta nueva en la institución, la actividad de la cliente es la venta de mercadería en general, la señora Yesenia sale todos los días para ofrecer los diferentes productos. Con el paso del tiempo ella decidió buscar este trabajo y así  iniciar su trabajo de venta de estos productos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes, ropa interior entre otras. Ella junto a su pareja actualmente tienen dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Por lo que quiere aprovechar este crédito por la temporada que se acerca.
texts.en: Yesenia is a new client of this microfinance institution. She and her partner have two small children. She sells general merchandise.  Every day she goes out selling different products.  Some time ago, she decided to seek out this work and began selling these products.  The loan will be used to buy lipstick, cremes, perfumes, underwear, and so on. She wants to use this credit to take advantage of the holiday season.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Yasmina

texts.es: Yasmina tiene su negocio que es una pulpería, hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio esta actividad ubicada en su vivienda a pesar de no ofrecer muchos productos al menos vende lo más básicos para sus clientes. Yasmina tiene 1 hijo de 6 años que le enseña cómo ganarse la vida pues ella le enseña a atender a sus clientes con el paso del tiempo ha logrado adquirir experiencia con sus diferentes clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Yasmina owns a small grocery store.  She has had this business for more than 3 years.  She started this business, which is located in her home, in spite of the fact that she didn't have much to offer her customers except the most basic products.  Yasmina has one 6 year-old child and she teaches him how to earn a living as she teaches him how to serve the customers.  Over time, she has managed to acquire experience with her different customers.  Yasmina would like a loan to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MINKA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Arturo; el socio tiene 74 años de edad, el socio es casado y tiene 5 hijos, el socio es cesante del ministerio de economía y minas, el trabajo en dicha institución y ahora goza de sus mensualidades de ser jubilado pero siempre ha estado en este grupo y le gusta como se organizan y crecen con las actividades que hacen internamente, el socio indica que esta vez desea el crédito para apoyar a uno de sus hijos menores en pagar una última mensualidad de su carrera profesional de economía. El socio solicita el  préstamo para invertir en el pago de la última mensualidad del menor de sus hijos.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the community bank named "Minka". It is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and region of Cusco.

His name is Arturo. He is 74 years old, he is married and he has 5 children. He is a retiree from the Ministry of Finance and Mines. From his work in that organization he is able to enjoy a monthly pension.  He has always been part of the group and he likes the way it is organized and the activities that take place internally. He wants a loan to be able to help his youngest son to pay for the last semester of tuition in his university career in Economics. He requests a loan to invest in the payment the tuition for his youngest son.

He is very happy with the loan that is granted and he is committed to the established payment terms of his loan.

loans.use: To pay his son's final semester in university.

loans.name: Flores Del Tepeyac Group

texts.es: Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Puebla, México; en una pequeña colonia  que se encuentra conurbada a la ciudad de Puebla, es por eso que cuenta con buena afluencia comercial; este grupo está integrado por 10 mujeres, trabajadoras, honestas y emprendedoras, que decidieron llamarse FLORES DEL TEPEYAC en alusión al nombre de su colonia y de las flores del milagro de la virgen de guadalupe. La Señora Alma Margarita fue electa la Tesorera del grupo por tratarse de una persona responsable y honesta como el resto del grupo, ademas de ser muy entusiasta y manejar muy bien la contabilidad; ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida a todos los conductores de una ruta de linea de transporte público, ella todos los dias se traslada con sus envases de comida, el proposito de adquirir un crédito con nosotros es porque requiere el dinero para reparar el automovil en el que todos los dias traslada su comida para la venta; para ella el exito significa tener una casa propia para dejarles un patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is located in Puebla, Mexico, in a small district on the outskirts of the city of Puebla.  The area has a lot of commercial activity.  The group has 10 female members who are all hard working, honest and enterprising.  They decided to call their group "Flores del Tepeyac" (Flowers of El Tepeyac).  With this name, they are making reference to the name of their neighborhood and the flowers that appeared in the miracle of the Virgin of Guadalupe.

Alma Margarita was elected as the group's treasurer as she is a responsible and honest person like the other members of the group.  She is also very enthusiastic and very good at doing accounts.  Alma Margarita's business is making meals and selling them to all the drivers on a public transport route.  Every day she travels there with her meal containers.

Alma Margarita would like this loan from us as she needs the money to repair the car that she uses every day to transport the meals that she sells.  For her, success would be to own her own home so that she would then have an inheritance to leave her children.

loans.use: To repair the car she uses to transport her meals

loans.name: 20 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal "20 de Enero" está ingresando al ciclo Nro. 1, son mujeres entusiastas y con deseos de mejorar su vida.   El grupo será parte del centro focal de Senkata, está integrado por 10 mujeres.
Cada una de las integrantes ya tiene negocio propio, ente los cuales se encuentra:  venta de artículos para el hogar (pasta dental, pilas, ganchos para ropa, cremas para la cara, en general las señoras le dicen a este tipo de negocio “venta de cachivaches”), costura de polleras, venta de tunta, tejidos y costura de polleras, tejidos de ropa para bebé, venta de CD´s, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio.

La Banca Comunal “20 de Enero” está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por  una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas, quienes tienen el encargo de guiar a sus compañeras durante este ciclo.

La  presidenta, la señora Lidia ha participado  durante seis años y medio en el Centro Focal de Villa Tejada  y en esta oportunidad está ingresando a su primer ciclo de la Banca Comunal "20 de Enero", la señora Lidia comenta que entre varias socias antiguas, entre ella doña Miguelina,  decidieron formar grupo para sacar el crédito.  Entre los servicios que más les gusta está la atención del consultorio de salud y contar con un Seguro.

El negocio que ocupa a la señora presidenta es el tejido de chompas, la venta de “cachivaches” y venta de refresco de mocochinchi (durazno seco) por vaso, éste último es un negocio que tuvo desde muy joven.  
El crédito que está solicitando la señora Lidia servirá para comprar azúcar, quisa  (durazno seco) y lana, negocios que ella espera impulsar este semestre.
texts.en:
The "20 de Enero" (January 20th) community bank is beginning its first loan cycle.  The members of this group are enthusiastic women who have a desire to improve their lives.  The group forms part of the Senkata regional office and has 10 female members.

Each of the group's members has her own business.  These businesses include: selling household products (toothpaste, batteries, clothes hangers, face cream - in general, the ladies call this type of business 'venta de cachivaches' (knick knack sales)), sewing traditional skirts, selling 'tunta' (a dried potato product), weaving and sewing traditional skirts, knitting baby clothes, selling CDs, selling vegetables and running a neighborhood store.

The '20 de Enero' community bank is run by a board of directors which consists of a president, a treasurer and a secretary, who are in charge of guiding their fellow group members through this loan cycle.

The bank's president, Lidia, was a member of the Villa Tejada regional office for six and a half years.  She is currently joining the '20 de Enero' community bank for their first loan cycle.  Lidia tells us that she and several long-standing members, including Miguelina, decided to form their own group to request a loan.  Their favorite services are the health service and the insurance service.

The president's business is knitting sweaters, selling 'knick knacks' and selling 'mocochinchi' (a dried peach drink) by the glass.  This latter business is one that she has had since she was very young.

Lidia is requesting her loan to buy sugar, 'quisa' (dried peach) and wool.  These will help her in the businesses that she wishes to carry out this season.

loans.use: To buy sugar, 'quisa' (dried peach) and wool

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a caring lady who prefers to stay at home and do the household work. She is a very good wife and mother. She works hard to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Her husband, M. S., has a fruit shop in the market. Nazeeran has three sons; two of them support their father in his fruit-selling business while the youngest is studying in class 10th. 

Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially support her husband who wants to buy seasonal fruits to offer better quality and fresh fruits to his customers. He is doing this business for some time now and Nazeeran is very confident that an investment will help him to further expand the business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In the previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. She belongs to Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a small colony named Tariq with her family in a two-room brick house.

loans.use: Buy fruits for fruit selling business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a buy and sell fashion accessories business. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her buy and sell fashion accessories business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Teresa is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teresa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y. has been selling cassava, an important source of carbohydrates in Ghana and many parts of the world, for 10 years now. Married with three children, she is from Kokowada near Elmina. 

Her income pays for her children’s school fees and also for some of the utility bills. She wants to improve her earnings by growing her business and needs the loan to do so. The loan will be used to purchase more cassava to increase her sales. 

Aba intends to reinvest the profits into her business for further expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to increase her sales

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33  ans, 3 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires dans le village de Madoudiarrabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers.                                                                                                                             
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habillements, des condiments,  de l’indigo pour la teinture, de l’arachide et de la farine de blé.                                                                          
MAMA D. compte acheter des habillements avec les grossistes du marché de Fana hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Balimaya group are all married, are on average 33 years old, and have three children.  They live mostly in nuclear families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, in the Fana prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through family ties, as neighbors and as friends.  They sell various items. 
The women of the Balimaya group on are their second joint loan which will be used to buy clothing, condiments, indigo for dyeing, peanuts and wheat flour.
MAMA D. plans to buy clothing weekly from the wholesalers at the Fana market. She makes her sales daily in the village, for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to pay off the loan.  The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Sefora Janeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Sefora,  tiene 27 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 7 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del mismo y  le gusta porque en esta institución ha recibido mucha ayuda además de que es un grupo muy unido y solidario.

Tiene un pequeño comedor frente al mercado en Charapoto en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja los viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde. Trabaja sola.  Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor por siete años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos lo que la hace especial. Lo que más vende es el viche de mariscos, es un plato que sus clientes siempre le piden y ella los complace.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado, papas, mariscos y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Sus metas son tener un gran restaurante y darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Lourdes” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and for being two minutes away from the best beaches in the San Jacinto and San Clemente Provinces.

Here we find Sefora.  She is 27 years old and the single mother of a seven year old son who attends school.  She has been part of the communal bank since it began and is currently its president.  She likes it because she has received much help and the group is very united.

She has a small fod stall across from the market in Charapoto, where she prepares delicious dishes on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.  She works alone and tells us that she has had her food stall for seven years and it has always done well because her customers like the way she seasons her dishes.  She sells seafood ceviche mostly.  This is a dish that her customers are always asking for and she is happy to provide.

She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, potatoes, seafood, and other ingredients for her dishes.

Her goals are to have a big restaurant and provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: My's Group

texts.en:
My T. D. is 52 years old with 3 children. Her husband died 4 years ago so she has to manage family life with difficulty. To earn daily income, she is not only doing farming but also managing a grocery shop at her house. Every day she can earn 100,000 Vietnamese dong to manage her life. A participant in our credit program since 2006, she has used loans to buy fertilizer. For this new loan cycle, she is requesting a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more products for her shop.

Tinh T. Pham is 28 years old with 1 child. She is running a shop that sells ready, cooked food. She needs a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to make some glass equipment to keep food hygienic.

Thuy T. D. is 48 years old with 2 children. Her main earning activity is making brooms to sell. She needs a loan of 7,630,000 Vietnamese dong to buy materials.

Hoa  T. L. is 45 years old with 2 children. Being a farmer, she grows rice and corn to support her family with food. She also makes brooms to sell wholesale to earn daily income. She needs a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy material.

loans.use: to buy more products for her shop

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn A. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marilyn is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from making and serving a variety of different meals to customers like "kinilaw", fried chickens & "afritada" in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables & spices. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables & spices.

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en:
Jeni is a 32-year-old lady who married to Messakh, 29 years old. They have a cute son named Jetriks, who is one year old. They live with Jeni’s parents. Jeni and husband work as farmers in order to meet their daily needs.

Jeni is a hard worker; she has been a farmer for almost five years and plants vegetables such as mustard greens, “kangkung” and chilies.  She gets up early in the morning, goes to the farm and returns home when the sun goes down. Every morning she prepares vegetables and brings them in sacks to the market using a motorbike. Jeni has customers who are willing to buy vegetables from her wholesale, and her customers resell the vegetables in the market. In the evening, she looks after her baby while doing her tasks as a housewife. 

Jeni is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) from Kiva field partner TLM, and plans to use the loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and chicks. She dreams of opening other businesses in order to generate more income for her family; one undertaking she wants to start is a chicken broiler business.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and chicks

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 30 years old and married with one school-aged child. He earns about PHP 35,000 per cropping as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Ricardo grows corn. He has been doing this for 13 years. Ricardo is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow. 

In the future, Ricardo hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rulo

texts.es: el señor rulo es casado, tiene 2 hijos  de 2 y 5 años uno de ellos ya esta en edad escolar, rulo se dedica a manejar una moto taxi en sus inicios alquilaba dicha herramienta de trabajo y con el correr del tiempo logro adquirir su propia moto taxi, rulo es una persona muy trabajadora  de buenas referencias  por parte de sus  compañeros  y amigos, su sueño a futuro de rulo es comprarse otra moto taxi y con ello generar mejores ingresos, para mejorar su calidad de vida, el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprarle el soat y también para integrar a una asociación de moto taxistas, el cual se paga un derecho. Rulo esta muy contento con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Mr. Rulo is married and has 2 school-age children ages 2 and 5.  Rulo drives a motorcycle taxi which was initially leased but after much time and work he was able to acquire his own moto-taxi.  Rulo is a very hardworking man with good references because of his friends.  

His future dream is to buy another motorcycle taxi and generate a greater income from it in order to improve his quality of life.  

He is requesting a loan to buy the soat and also become a member of the association for motorcycle taxis, which one must pay to be a member.  Rulo is very happy with the confidence that this brings him.

loans.use: to buy Soat for the moto-taxi, and pay a fee to belong to the Association of motorcycle taxi drivers.

loans.name: Ninoska Del Carmen

texts.es: En la ciudad de Masaya, reside la señora Ninoska del Carmen, quien labora como Auditor Fiscal para la institución de D.G.I desde hace tres años,  es casada. Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando la familia de la señora Ninoska es la condición del techo y el levantamiento de una pared  de su vivienda,   se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para solicitarnos un crédito y  poder realizar compras como zinc, cemento, lamina, perlin, Piedra, arena etc.  y así por medio de este mejoramiento se dará en techo digno y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ninoska del Carmen lives in the city of Masaya. She has worked as a fiscal auditor for the D.G.I. institution for three years. She is married. One of the needs that Ninoska's family faces is the condition of their roof and a wall of their home which needs rebuilding. She came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan so that she can buy materials such as metal sheets, cement, laminates, beams, stone, sand, etc. Through these improvements, the family will have a proper roof and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, laminates, beams, stone, sand, etc.

loans.name: Siyaya

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Siyaya; la socia tiene 19 años; la socia es soltera;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos por catalogo; la socia vende productos de belleza en diferentes instituciones, ella trabaja con sus catálogos y deja en una empresa al día siguiente pasar para recoger y ya están los pedidos con los nombres de las personas que desean los diferentes pedidos y anotan lo que desean; la socia estudia contabilidad en la universidad Andina del Cusco; la socia se ayuda con el ingreso que reúne de la venta de catálogos, la socia desea invertir en sus estudios; La socia pagara sus mensualidades del  semestre. La socia solicita invertir en sus mensualidades de la universidad. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Siyaya, 19, belongs to the “Choquequirao” communal bank that belongs to Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is single and is a catalogue cosmetics merchant.  She sells beauty products at various institutions.  She works via catalogue.  She places orders at a firm and the next day returns to pick them up and they are ready with the names of the people who placed each order and they record what they want.

She is studying Accounting at the Andina del Cusco University.  Income from her catalogue sales helps her out.  She wants to invest in her studies and will pay her monthly tuition fees.  She needs to pay her monthly university tuition fees.

She is satisfied and very grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to pay her monthly tuition fees.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is 42 years old and is married. She has a 3-year-old child.

Ma. Cecelia and her husband are both farmers. They own and till land in Sta Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Rice is the main crop that they grow.

Ma. Cecelia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: María Guillermina

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
Doña María tiene 60 años, es casada y ha concebido 7 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados, dos están en la universidad y tres de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan en la economía del hogar. Su esposo labora como latonero (enderezada de latas vehículos), labora en su taller propio,  la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de comida, esta actividad  la realiza hace 20 años, labora todos los días sin un horario fijo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y cerdos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 15 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ollas, licuadora, cubiertos y más productos para su negocio de comida.
 
Su meta es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir Communal Bank.  She lives in the Cumbe parish.  This place has a cold climate, its people are very charismatic and friendly, and they maintain their culture and traditions.  They are merchants, they raise animals, and they farm.

María, age 60, is married and has seven children.  Two of her children are married, two are in the university, and three of them work and help her with the household finances.  Her husband works doing auto body repair.  He works in his own shop.  The house they live in is their own.

María has been selling food for 20 years.  She works every day without a fixed schedule.  She raises guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs at home.

She has been in her communal bank for 15 years.  She will use her new loan to buy pots, a blender, cutlery, and other products for her food business.

Her goal is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy pots, a blender, and cutlery, etc.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
Gabina nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba de la provincia de La Convención  (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 60 años de edad. Ella es casada y fruto de unión tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, leña y jora. Ya son vaR. años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El crédito que requiere Gabina es para comprar leña.

El Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Gabina was born in the town of Quillabamba in the province of La Convención  (Cusco, Perú). She is 60 years old. She is married and has 5 children. Currently she lives and works in the town of Urubamba. She sells beer, wood and corn. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Gabina needs the loan to buy firewood.

The communal bank “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” meets every 30 days in the town of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known as a popular tourist area and commercial centre. It is also known for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and because it is located near one of the seven wonders of the world "Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, es una mujer trabajadora de 38 años. Junto con su esposo  Wilder, velan por sus 5 hijos a los que educan con mucho amor, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). “Me gusta el trabajo de mi banco comunal”, así comienza a relatar su vida. El trabajo al que se dedica está increíble mujer es la agricultura, hace 6 años que viene sembrando café, naranja, tanllarina y toda variedad de cítricos. Su esmero y dedicación constante en sus terrenos agrícolas le proporcionan buenos ingresos económicos, tanto así que los mismos compradores vienen a su chacra a negociar sus frutos. Ahora cuenta que termino su cosecha, donde obtuvo buenas ganancias. Del mismo modo coparte su tiempo ayudando a otros agricultores a cuidar de sus cultivos, de esta manera obtiene un dinero extra. Asimismo se está preparando para la cosecha de naranja del mes de noviembre. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde es una mujer responsable y espera obtener buenas resultados con el trabajo de su asociación. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Teresa, después de la cosecha; comenzará la limpieza de sus cafetales. Por ello de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para comenzar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Teresa is a hard-working 38-year old woman.  Together with her husband, Wilder, they watch over their 5 children who they educate with much love.  The family lives in their own home located in the Kivinaki community (Peruvian central jungle).  “I like the work of my cooperative bank”, is how she starts to talk about her life.

The work that this incredible woman dedicates herself to is farming.  She has been planting coffee, oranges, and a variety of citrus fruits for 6 years.  Her constant care and dedication to her farmland provide her with good earnings, so much so that the buyers themselves come to her farm to negotiate for her fruits.

She now tells us that she finished her harvest, and she obtained good profits.  At the same time, she divides her time helping other farmers tend to their crops, and earns extra money.  Likewise, she is preparing for the harvest of her orange crop in the month of November.

She belongs to the “Flor de Almendra” (“Almond Flower”) cooperative bank, and this is her seventh loan with MFP.  She is a very responsible woman, and hopes to obtain good results with the work of her association.  Likewise, she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.

Teresa, after the harvest, will start the clean up of her grove of coffee plantings.  For this reason, at receiving your support, she will invest the requested funds into buying tools to start her work.

loans.use: buy farming tools.

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es:
José tiene 51 años es soltero y vive en San Gabriel con sus dos hijos. Es una persona libre, capaz de tomar iniciativas parea poder emprender en su negocio.

Trabaja solo en su tiendita de víveres. Lleva trabajando con Fodemi un año, los créditos le ayudan ya que Fodemi entiende la necesidad, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de víveres para abastecer su negocio y también quiere comprar terneros porque quiere empezar con el negocio del ganado.

Su sueño es tener una casa y tener un establo para ganado lechero.
texts.en:
51-year-old José is single and lives in San Gabriel with his two children.  He is a free person who is able to take initiatives in order move forward in his business.

José works alone in his grocery store.  He has been working with Fodemi for one year.  The loans help him as Fodemi understand his needs.  The loan that he is currently requesting will be used to buy food products with which to stock his business.  He would also like to buy calves because he would like to start a livestock-raising business.

José's dream is to own a house and a stable so that he can keep dairy cows.

loans.use: to stock his grocery store and to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lakena

texts.en:
Lakena (pictured here) is 37 years old and her husband, Sophal, is 39 years old.  They have been married since 2005 and have two young sons. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Lakena and her husband are garment workers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: To put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Chanmarika

texts.en: Chanmarika, 31 years old, is a grocery seller and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a primary teacher earns $2 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one more is only one year old. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $6 on electricity, and $10 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy more grocery goods to sell at her store. She wants to extend her career so she can make better income and have enough money to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell at her store

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 30 years old, married and with two children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with a previous loan. Caroline hopes to open a boutique in the future. She has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 38 years old married  woman. She has three children who depend on her. She has been a poultry farmer for a period of six years.

She knew about KADET LTD through other women registered in her area of residence. She applied for her first loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy more chicks for rearing. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for rearing

loans.name: Aldifooty Group

texts.fr:
Aldi footy est un groupe créé le 12 octobre 2010 à l’inauguration de leur Banc villageois Dialicounda Naforé. Il est composé de  16 femmes qui ont une bonne entente. Elles ont le petit commerce comme activité principale.

Madame Aida  (assise à l’extrême droit de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle  est mariée et mère de trois enfants.

Elle vend de la patte d’arachide et de l’huile de palm au marché de son quartier. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l’avoir pratique pendant au moins cinq ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de la patte d’arachide pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices tirés de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Aldifooty group was created on the 12th of October 2010, on the inauguration day of their "banc villageois" Dialicounda Naforé. The group is made up of 16 women, who all get along well together and are all involved in small retail.

Aida, sitting on the far right of the picture, is the group's leader. She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She sells peanut butter and palm oil at her local market. She is an experienced saleswoman with over 5 years experience in this area.

This loan will allow Aida to restock on peanut butter for resale. She plans to use the profits from her business to support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy peanut butter for resale.

loans.name: Grace Ndumi

texts.en: Grace is a 23-year-old married woman. She has a son who is 3 years old. She describes herself to be talkative. Grace operates a motorcycle garage where she sells tires and does vehicle servicing. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are motorcycle owners. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying the spare parts. Grace will use the loan to purchase more spare parts. Her business goal is to run a similar motorcycle garage in a nearby town within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more tubes, tires and rims

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single man, working and living in Saida, in the south of Lebanon. He has been operating an auto repair workshop since 2008, during which time his business has grown steadily. He is well known in the region, and has a good number of clients who represent most of his relatives, friends and neighbors.

Ali is requesting a loan for the second time from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new car necessary for his newly established business. He has
started selling hardware, so he needs a car to buy and sell the hardware among neighboring villages, as extra income in his free time.

His previous loan was invested in purchasing tools and stock for his auto repair workshop, and it reflected positively on his social & financial situation that helped in starting a new business.

In the future, Ali hopes to open a larger shop next to the main road that will attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy a new car for his business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 25 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente José no pudo estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones su mamá cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones para engreírlo, ya que este es su comida favorita.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, José traba como obrero de campo, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia sus labores de campo, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea poder hacer los acabados de una habitación, ya que su casa es muy pequeña y desearía poder tener una habitación adecuada donde sus pequeños hermanos puedan vivir con seguridad y mayor bienestar, así pues José seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para junto a su familia salir adelante y lograr sus sueños de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
José is a 25 year old man. He lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with his parents and siblings. He is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who really wants to get ahead. Unfortunately, José wasn't able to study civil engineering like he wanted, since he had to work from the time he was very young to help his parents. He would have liked to do so. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and on occasion his mother makes delicious chicharrones to spoil him, because this is his favorite food. 

With mush effort and dedication, José works as a laborer. Every day very early he starts in the fields. He can work approximately 8 hours and he thinks that it is going well for him because of his hard work and because of how he treats others kindly.

José is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he can do some home improvements. He wants to finish a room, since it is very small and he would like to have a room where his young siblings can live in safety and wellbeing. José will keep working and striving to get ahead with his family and make his dream come true of having a good profession.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis owns a fruit stand in a local market. He sells all types of fruits including: watermelons oranges, papayas and mangoes. He has already taken a loan out from Kiva and Mifex before. The loan was of great help to Luis who was finally able to avoid buying from creditors and lending from loan sharks that were abusive. He felt very relieved to be able to invest his own money in the business and has seen a steady increase in profits. With the capital Luis was able to buy more diverse fruits at larger quantities. With this new loan he will continue to buy fruits for his store and keep his business growing.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Luis will buy a variety of fruits in bulk for his stand in a local market

loans.name: Tanti Kossiwa

texts.en:
Tanti Kossiwa A. is a woman with a low level of education, born on July 12, 1961 in Kétao. Married and mother of three children, she took control of her destiny very early on by taking on various jobs and then working in the restaurant business. It’s in this last activity that she excels and today has her own restaurant in Hédjranawoé, a popular neighborhood in Lomé.

After receiving two loans of $300 then $500, she has managed to gain a large clientele, which is becoming more and more demanding. It is for this reason that she is asking for a new loan of $1200 that will serve to refurbish her bar and to build a large stock of corn and rice, the primary goods used in the preparation of her dishes that are much enjoyed by her clients.

In the past this woman has proved her dynamism and above all her ability in loan management. She fully merits being financed again, which will permit her to increase her sales and improve her economic and social conditions.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Tanti Kossiwa A. est une femme d’un niveau de scolarisation très faible, née le 12 juillet 1961 à Kétao. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a très tôt pris en main son destin en s’adonnant au commerce de divers puis à la restauration. C’est dans cette dernière activité qu’elle excelle et tient aujourd’hui elle-même son restaurant à Hédjranawoé, un quartier populaire de Lomé.

Après deux crédits de $300 puis $500 reçus, elle est arrivée à gagner une clientèle très importante qui se fait de plus en plus exigeante. C’est pourquoi, elle sollicite un nouveau financement de $1200 qui servira au réaménagement de son bar et à la constitution d’un stock importante de maïs et de riz, les produits de base entrant dans la préparation de ses mets très appréciés par ses clients.

Cette femme a fait preuve dans le passé de son dynamisme et surtout de sa capacité de gestion du crédit. Elle mérite pleinement d’être encore financé pour lui permettre d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et d’améliorer ses conditions économiques et sociales.

loans.use: To refurbish her restaurant and build a stock of primary goods for her meals

loans.name: Ama Odette

texts.en:
H. Ama Odette is a single 29-year-old woman with 2 children. She is from a very poor family and did not have a chance to go to school. She lost her parents when she was a child and was forced to marry an old man she never loved. She has left home and lived with her son and her daughter in Anono near Abidjan. She produces and sells cassava, banana, taro and other legumes.

She wants a loan to increase cassava production and acquire equipment for cassava paste processing to add more value to her products.

H. Ama Odette is very dynamic and ambitious despite her difficult situation.

loans.use: Loan will be used to diversify goods and acquire equipment for cassava paste processing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 5 cows to be resold when they are fattened

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate U. is 32 years old and married with no children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Kate is a hardworking woman who has run a small business selling clothes, shoes, bags and baby products for 5 years. As she acquires more customers, she needs capital to expand her business.

Kate has been a LAPO client for 3 years and is seeking a $325 loan to expand her business. "I believe my business will improve with the above loan amount," explained Kate when talking about her reasons for requesting a loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags & baby items for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary E. is 44 years old, she is married with four children, and she lives in Benin City. She has been in business since 2002. She sells wrappers and jewelry. She is requesting $675 to enable her to buy more wrappers and jewelry to sell.

loans.use: Mary would like to buy more wrappers & jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Soila Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Soila gets her products from the distributors at Chinandega, she travels to Managua, and what she sells is a daily use product aside from cosmetics. She has been able to get into the market of basic grains, such as beans, rice, oil, etc.

She has been working for 15 years in this business, starting with US$54 of her own money. She started with the need to have a home and give her children a good quality of life. She started selling thread, hair irons, and silk. She had to immigrate to Panama to work hard and save money to continue her business here, in Nicaragua. Her business has been growing little by little, and she now has a good clientele in the central market of Leon and would like to grow more to have more profit and be able to sell her children to college.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Soila obtiene sus productos de los distribuidores de Chinandega, viaja a Managua y lo que vende es un producto de consumo diario, aparte de los cosméticos ha logrado abrirse al mercado de los granos básicos como frijoles, arro, aceite,. etc.

Lleva 15 años trabajando en este negocio, comenzó con 54 dólares de su propio dinero., inicia con la necesidad de tener un hogar y darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, comenzó vendiendo hilos, prensadores de pelo, seda. Tuvo que imigrar a Panamá para trabajar mucho y ahorrar para continuar con su negocio aqui en Nicaragua. Su negocio va creciendo poco a poco, ya tiene buena clientela en el mercado central de Leon y desea crecer mas para tener ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la universidad.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de Mercaderia)

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
Maria Cruz has three children (the youngest is 3 and the oldest is 10). Her husband works as a laborer. On one occasion the youngest son became ill and Maria didn't have money to buy medicine, which caused her to become sad and desperate. This is when Maria decided that it was time that she begin to sell something in order to gain extra income. On the recommendation of her sister, Maria began selling cosmetics through catalogues, and she began to do so through friends and neighbors. Currently, Maria has several clients who purchase items from her regularly. Maria says that sometimes distributors sell beauty products at auction, so this is why she's applying for a loan of $ 475 USD, which she's willing to pay within 6 months. With this loan she'll be able to buy products cheaper and make a larger return when selling to her clients. With your help Maria can grow her business so that her family doesn't have to do without especially should any emergencies arise.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Cruz tiene tres hijos, el más pequeño tiene tres y el mayor tiene 10 años, su esposo trabaja como obrero. En una ocasión el hijo más pequeño enfermó y ni Maria tenían dinero para poder comprar las medicinas, cosa que puso muy triste y desesperada a María es por eso que decidió que era momento de que ella empezara a vender algo para poder tener ingresos extras. Por recomendación de su hermana María comenzó a vender artículos de belleza por catálogo y fue así como comenzó. Poco a poco ofreciéndoles a sus amigas y vecinas. Poco a poco se dio a conocer y actualmente ya cuenta con varias clientas que la buscan para que les surta los artículos.

Sin embargo María comenta que en ocasiones las distribuidoras tienen productos de belleza en remate. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá aprovechar las baratas y surtirse de productos para poder ofrecerle a sus clientas. Con tu ayuda María podrá crecer su negocio para que en su familia no falte nada y en especial no falte dinero en el momento de alguna tragedia.

loans.use: To purchase products for her inventory. (Comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
When he married, Benjamín was a construction worker. However as his three daughters began to grow up the money he made was not enough to pay for the expenses of his home. He decided to rent a taxi to increase his income. Litlle by little he saved enough money to purchase his own taxi and he currently owns his vehicle.

Unfortunately his taxi needs to be repaired. To repair his taxi Benjamín is requesting a microloan of US $650 to be paid back in six months. With the money he will be able to repair and paint his taxi which will allow him to continue paying for his three girls´ schooling. With your help Benjamin´s daughters will be able to earn a degree and have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Repair and paint his taxi

loans.name: I Nyoman Wiastra

texts.id:
I Nyoman Wiastra is a 48 years old head of household. He lives in Nusasari village in West Bali. With his wife and a 10 years old child, I Nyoman Wiastra covers their basic needs by doing several business in farming and raising animals. One of his businesses with guidance from Dinari is hog farming. I Nyoman Wiastra raises two hogs and four others for meat producing. Every day I Nyoman Wiastra spend IDR 20,000 (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between IDR 9,000-9,500.00) for animal feeds. He gives pollard to feed his animals. Beside pollard he also feeds them with banana leafs and taro. Each sow will deliver on average eight piglets that can be sold for IDR 250,000 after reaching two months old. He earns IDR 1,280,000 for each sow every five months or so. The profit will be used to put his kindergarten-age child to school. The loan from Dinari is going to be used to buy more animal feed.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

I Nyoman Wiastra adalah seorang kepala rumah tangga yang sudah berumur 48 tahun. Ia tinggal di sebuah desa bernama Nusasari, Bali Barat. Bersama istri dan satu orang anaknya yang baru berumur 10 tahun, I Nyoman Wiastra mencukupi kebutuhan hidupnya dengan melakukan berbagai usaha baik dalam hal pertanian maupun peternakan yang sudah mereka jalani. Salah satu usaha yang mereka jalani saat ini melalui binaan Dinari adalah beternak babi. I Nyoman Wiastra memelihara 2 induk dan 4 ekor penggemukan Setiap hari I Nyoman Wiastra mengeluarkan biaya untuk pakan ternaknya sebesar Rp. 20.000.- Makanan yang diberikan berupa dedak. Namun selain dedak, I Nyoman Wiastra juga memberikan makanan tambahan seperti daun pisang dan daun talas. Induk babi akan melahirkan rata-rata 8 ekor anak yang bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250 000 per ekor setelah dipelihara selama dua bulan. Keuntungan yang akan didapat sebesar Rp.1.280.000,- untuk jangka waktu 5 bulan dari satu Induk Babi. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dipakai untuk pendidikan anaknya yang baru bersekolah di Taman Kanak - Kanak, sedangkan pinjaman dari Dinari dipakai untuk membeli pakan ternaknya.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.
