loans.name: Prosper

texts.en: Prosper O. is married and 43 years old. He hails from Edo State. He is a photographer and has been in this business since 2001. He needs the loan amount of $875 to buy a digital camera and printer for his business.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera and printer for his business

loans.name: Monica's Jiliwaze Group

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with 6 children, ages 14-28 years old. Monica owns a small food store and she sells clothes as well, a business she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $62 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Manywele, Fatuma, and Monica, who have businesses running a salon, and in food vending and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Falak Naz

texts.en:
Falak Naz, son of G. H., is 28 years old. He is one of those persons who returned to his own country, Afghanistan, in 2001. He graduated from grade twelve, but he couldn’t continue to higher education because of financial problems. Now he is marred and working as a gardener in district Shewa of Ningarhar province.

He wants to buy some plants for his garden but he doesn’t have much money; therefore, he requested a loan of 50,000 Afghanis from AFSG to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy some plants for his garden

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeurn C. is a villager in Prey Chum Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is currently a subsistence farmer and a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Von Sum, is a subsistence farmer and house builder. Aside from this business activity, Mr. Von Sum is a bed maker. In his bed-making business, he has now insufficient raw materials to make beds; thus, his wife, Mrs. Moeurn C., has applied for a loan to buy bed-making materials for her husband's business.

Mrs. Moeurn C. is 51 and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending a local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy bed-making materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Pheun

texts.en:
Mr. Pheun M. is a farmer in the Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. He is a farmer. Aside from this business, he also collects palm juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. His wife, Mrs. Khon Huot, helps her husband on the plantation. Mr. Pheun M. is 57 years old and the father of four children. One is a construction worker, and another is a garment factory worker. The others are attending school. Even though the family members have different business activities, they still live in poor conditions.

In order to improve their standard of living, Mr. Pheun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow cart to move fertilizer to the field to help his farming business. He will use the rest of the loan to buy some piglets for breeding. Previously, Mr. Pheun M. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to support his field. He has fully paid back the loan.

(His wife is on the left of the photo.)

loans.use: To buy a cow cart to move fertilizer to the field and to buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Josefa Dolores

texts.es:
Josefa Dolores U. is single and 48 years of age. She is an employee of the Asunción de Juigalpa, Chontale Hospital. She has 30 years of service as a nurse's assistant. In her job, she does 7 night shifts each month. She has 4 children who live with her who work and study to help her. She is asking for her fifth loan to use in the construction of a drain. With her previous loans and her Christmas bonus, she has been able to improve her home and that way get a decent roof for her children. She has stated that loans do good when they are well used. In her workplace, she is distinguished by her responsibility and abnegation to work in the service of those most in need.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Josefa Dolores U. es soltera, con 48 años de edad, trabajadora del Hospital Asunción de Juigalpa, Chontales. Tiene 30 años de servicio como auxiliar de enfermeria, dentro de su trabajo realiza 7 turnos nocturnos durante el mes, tiene 4 hijos los cuales habitan con ella, los que trabajan y estudian para ayudarle. Está solicitando su 5to. crédito para utilizarlo en la construcción de un sumidero, con sus créditos anteriores y su aguinaldo ha podido mejorar su vivienda y asi obtener un techo digno para sus hijos. Manifestó los créditos sirven mucho cuando son bien utilizados. En su centro de trabajo se ha destacado por su responsabilidad y abnegación al trabajo al servicio de los más necesitados.

loans.use: Purchase of Metal and Quarry Stone to Build a Drain

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou est une jeune femme qui évolue dans le commerce de parfums et autres produits. Elle a un chiffre d'affaire en moyenne de 5000 fcfa en moyenne. Elle gére ses besoins. Le crédit lui a permis de renforcer son commerce et d'envisager ouvrir une cantineprochainement.
texts.en:
Astou is a young woman who trades in perfume and other products. On average, she does $11 in sales (daily). She manages the business. The loan would permit her to expand her business and to consider opening a small shop soon.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trade, purchase of perfumes, fabric, hair extensions

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of M. and lives in an area named Bund Road of City Lahore, Paksitan. She owes a two- room brick house and has been living in it for the last 22 years. She is the mother of three daughters. Her elder daughter is in the 7th standard. The next to her is in the 2nd standard. Her younger daughter is in kindergarten. Razia baji’s husband sells horse food and makes horse carts on order and earns a profit. He has been in this profession for the last 30 years. Razia baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy horse food to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Samina baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her clinic. Parveen baji and Kosar baji and Zahida baji each want a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Faiza baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy horse food to resell

loans.name: Margarita Concepción

texts.es:
Margarita es una persona muy trabajadora, entusiasta y optimista. Ella inició el negocio porque quería sentirse una persona útil y porque le gustan mucho las ventas y como sus hijos ya están grandes y pueden valerse solos y le quedaba mas tiempo libre. Comenzó en el mes de Febrero de 2006, en el patio de su casa vendiendo la ropa que dejábamos en la familia y después una de sus vecinas la animó para que comprara pacas de ropa usada las cuales salen muy baratas y se vende rápido y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por $5,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una paca de ropa y tener un buen surtido para esta época de fin de año que se acerca y que es cuando la gente comprar mas ropa.
texts.en:
Margarita is hard-working, enthusiastic and optimistic. She went into business because she wanted to feel useful and because she likes working in sales; since her children were grown and can look after themselves, she had more free time. She started in February 2006 in the patio of her house, selling her own family's used clothing. Encouraged by her neighbours, she bought bales of used clothes, which are very cheap and sell quickly. She has been very successful since then. She needs a loan of $5,000, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy a bale of clothes and have a good range of merchandise for the year-end season, when people tend to buy more clothes.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bale of clothes

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 42 años, es casada, vive junto a sus familiares incluyendo hijos y nietos. Ella se dedica a administrar el alquiler de autos que posee, los cuales arrienda a los choferes por día, actividad que realiza por más de 10 años, iniciándose gracias al trabajo de agricultora junto a su esposo. Inés no deja de sorprenderse de todo lo que puede lograr con esfuerzo y dedicación, trata de cuidar al máximo sus bienes y no despilfarrar el dinero que tiene como ganancia, sino de administrarlo adecuadamente. Lo complicado es cuando los carros se malogran o sufren daños que hay que reparar, las cuales son muy costosas en las mecánicas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y tiene muchas ganas de ser una clienta constante de su IMF. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en la compra de repuestos y en el mantenimiento de  sus carros.
texts.en:
Inés is 42 years old, married, and lives with her family, including her children and grandchildren. For ten years, she has rented out her vehicles to drivers on a daily basis. She previously worked as a farmer with her husband, and thanks to her success in that field, she was able to begin her current business.

Inés never ceases to be amazed at how much one can achieve through hard work and dedication. She tries to take good care of her property and does not squander the money that she earns, but manages it wisely. The hard part of her work is when the vehicles break down or are damaged and must have costly repairs.

This is her first loan with Kiva's partner MFP, and she has a great desire to be a regular customer of this microfinance institution. She will invest the loan in the purchase of spare parts and in the maintenance of her vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and maintain vehicles

loans.name: Rethy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rethy N. is a group leader of four who all live in Choeung Khnar village in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells fruit and vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables to resell. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Rethy N. is a 28-year-old widow with two children who are too young to work or study. 

Three members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the other has a monthL. payment loan. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther T. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Esther sells sewing materials and footwear at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1989. Her husband is a trader. Esther uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Esther will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of footwear and sewing materials to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade in footwear and sewing materials.

loans.use: To increase the sale of footwear and sewing materials to meet the increase in demand by her customers

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She sells plastics. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more plastics to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruit for making juices and to buy stocks of soda and drinking water

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine C. is a 28 year-old mother of two. Her husband, Roderick, is a messenger. She helps her husband by selling fish around the village. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital for her new venture of raising piglets. She applied for this loan to buy two pigs for fattening. She will also use some of her loan to buy fish to sell. She hopes that in the future, her pigpen will expand to a piggery. She also dreams of building a beautiful house and being able to send her children to a university

loans.use: To buy two pigs for fattening and additional capital for fish selling.

loans.name: Dionsel

texts.es: El cliente Diosnel es casado y residente en la compañia de San Antonio, ciudad de San Ignacio Mnes.  Vive en domicilio propio y es padre de 1 hijo menor de edad. El Señor se dedica a la distribución de verduras y frutas para despensas, almacenes o personas particulares, con una antigüedad de mas de 5 años en el ramo. El destino de los fondos de esta operación de préstamo realizada en nuestra institución fue para compra de mercaderías y ademas de la reparación de su vehiculo en el cual realiza sus repartos, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
This client, Dionsel, is married and lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of San Ignacio, Misiones Department, Paraguay. He lives in his own house and is the father of one young son. This gentleman is engaged in distributing vegetables and fruits to supermarkets, warehouses and individuals, and he's been in the business for more than five years. The funds from this loan from Fundación Paraguay are for the purchase of merchandise and also for the repair of his vehicle which he uses to make his deliveries. Thus, he will be able to increase his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new sewing machines and work materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort T. is married and has 3 children. She has not received a formal education. Comfort sells charcoal in Akotokyri, which she has done since 2001. Comfort uses her income to pay for utility bills. Comfort will use the loan to buy charcoal in larger quantities to expand the business in support of the family. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to pay the children's school fees for a higher educational level.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk for resale

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr:
A. Léonie a 52 ans. Léonie est mariée et mère de trois filles toutes scolarisées. Léonie et sa famille résident depuis cinq (5) ans à  Akpakpa  PK10, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Depuis 10 ans Léonie est dans le secteur de la production et de la distribution d’eau de pompe en sachet de 50 millilitre, localement appelée pure water. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Léonie distribue ses produits aux semi-grossistes. 

Les sachets d’emballage que Léonie utilise pour son activité, elle va les acheter au Nigeria un pays voisin du Bénin. Léonie a déjà  bénéficié de prêts de ALIDé. Et Léonie a toujours respecté ses engagements de remboursement de prêt. Pour satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Léonie sollicite actuellement un nouveau crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Léonie is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of three girls who are all in school. She and her family have been living for five years in Akpakpa PK10, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. For ten years, Léonie has been in the field of producing and distributing pump water in 50-milliliter bags, locally called "Pure Water". Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where she distributes her products to semi-wholesalers. The bags as packaging, which Léonie uses for her business, are gotten from Nigeria, a country bordering Benin. She has already benefited from Alidé loans. And she has always honored her commitments for repaying loans. To do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she's now requesting a new loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bags for packing water

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora G. is a 45-year-old woman, happily married to Waren, and they are blessed with four children. Three among the four are still studying. One is in fourth year college taking a Bachelor of Arts degree in Political Science in the University of the Philippines; another is in her first year of college; and the youngest is in his second year of high school. 

It was never easy for Teodora and her husband to sustain the education of their children. They have been through a lot of struggles in life but they did not give up because they have each other to hold on to. Waren is a municipal ambulance driver and Teodora was a plain housewife before she joined ASHI. Coping with financial struggles at that time was so hard for the couple since Teodora's husband was the only one earning. 

Five years ago, Teodora took the opportunity of loaning when ASHI came into her life. She believed that she had the skill to raise pigs and sell them after four months. She knew that she would be successful and that, in this kind of business, she could help her husband earn because this was what most of her family members do as their way of living.

Through loaning business capital which she can obtain from ASHI, Teodora will be able to make her dreamed business happen and she will be able to support the needs of her children in school. She is confident to venture in the business pursuit she chose knowing that her husband's support will always be there as well as people around the world through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy five piglets, feed, and also rice to retail

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée  en 2007 dans le commerce de chaussures, elle y a associé plus tard le commerce de mèches. Elle veut agrandir son stock pour cette raison elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 paires de chaussures et  quelques mèches. Elle est divorcée.
C’est avec ce qu’elle gagne comme revenu dans cette activité qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges et à celles de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who got started in the commerce of shoes in 2007. She has included with it commerce in hair extensions. She wants to expand her inventory. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 pairs of shoes and some hair extensions. She is divorced. With what she earns in revenues from this business, she supports herself and her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102642&_tpos=f&_tpg=h
Irineo es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Irineo se dedica a dar servicio de moto-taxi y cría de chanchos, con las ganancias de    sus negocios ha podido comprase otra moto-car.  
El préstamo ha ayudado ha que pueda crecer económicamente
Ireneo necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para arreglar sus motores de su moto-car.
El sueño de Irineo luchar por sacar adelante a sus  hijos y  quiere comprase un carro para taxiar.
texts.en:
Irineo is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de las Mercedes”. He operates a moto-taxi service and also raises pigs. Using the profits from his businesses, he was able to purchase another moto-car. His previous loans have helped him grow financially. Irineo is in need of a loan of 1600 soles to repair the engines of his moto-car. He dreams of fighting for the success of his children and wants to buy a sidecar for his taxi. Click here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102642&_tpos=f&_tpg=h to view Irineo’s previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Engine repairs

loans.name: Estrellas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Santiago II, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, se reúne la asociación “Estrellas De Mar", esta formada por doce miembros, los cuales trabajan de manera responsable en sus actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios dentro el grupo, tales como: venta de ropa, tejido artesanal en telar de mantas, en fibra de alpaca; venta de refrescos; venta de chompas tejidas a mano; uno de los integrantes, que es Dalio ofrece servicio de transporte público. Necesitan comprar materia prima o productos para ampliar su producción,( fibra de alpaca, lana, repuestos y otros)con el único objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos para brindar necesidades mínimas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Estrellas De Mar” group, part of the Santiago II association located in the city of El Alto, is comprised of 12 members who work in a responsible manner on their activities. There are several different types of businesses within the group, including: the sale of clothing, the weaving of artisanal blankets using alpaca fibers, the sale of hand-woven jackets, the sale of soft drinks, and one of the members, Dalio, provides transportation services to the public. They need to buy raw materials or supplies to increase their production (alpaca fiber, wool, spare parts and other items) with the sole objective of obtaining better incomes to provide for the basic needs of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials or merchandise

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine M. is a married woman and a Tanzanian business entrepreneur. She is a livestock keeper specializing in poultry. She keeps both broilers and layers at her poultry cages. It takes almost six months to get the first lays. She collects and sells ten trays of eggs per day and sells both wholesale and retail.

Valentine has been in the business for ten years and the business income has enabled her to meet her daily family needs and has enabled her to capitalize the business. It has also enabled her to buy a plot of land and to build her house.

Valentine needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To boost her business by buying more chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel A. is from the village of Taboo,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Raquel is separated from spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Raquel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Raquel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old. She is married with three children between 1 and 10 years of age. Two of her children go to school. She resides in a two room house where she is staying with seven people. Agnes takes care of additional family members as well.

Agnes owns a pub selling soft drinks. She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for three years; this is her eighteenth loan and ninth year with MCDT. 

Agnes sells to all categories of people. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and other soft drinks.

loans.use: purchasing more crates of soda and other soft drinks

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Matilde G. se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a vender mariscos (pescado) pero esta actividad no le permitía cubrir los gastos tanto del negocio como de la familia y es por esto que decidió comenzar a vender frutas y verduras.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, ella requiere invertir en la compra de las frutas y las verduras para continuar brindándole a sus clientes dichos perecederos y de esta manera seguir esforzándose por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Matilde G. is a fruit and vegetable seller although she used to sell fish; but this latter activity did not produce sufficient profits to cover business expenses nor provide for household expenses. This is why she began to sell fruits and vegetables. Like in all developing businesses, however, she needs to invest in inventory so that she can continue to offer her clients these perishable items thereby continuing to try each day to do better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the quality of her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa A. is a native of the island village of Talim Binangonan, in the Rizal province of the Philippines. She is a courageous mother who hopes to rise from poverty. She is 62 years old and married to Leon, who is 62 years old and a fisherman. She has 5 children, between the ages of 27 and 43, none of whom finished their studies in college due to poverty. The income from the business has been insufficient to provide for further education for her children beyond high school. 

Luisa's biggest dream is to raise the family's standard of living. She wants to give her family a refined life. She has been in the fishing business for almost 44 years. The sales seem to be profitable and sound, and she desires to invest more in the business.

In 2007, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with the encouragement of having access to more capital for a larger income. She is requesting a loan of Php 20,000.00 as additional capital for her fishing business. 

Luisa is hopeful that her business will grow and that she can earn more income.  She would like to save money to help fulfill their dreams to support her children to have a good life and to send her grandchildren to school to finish college, something she failed to provide for her children. Her children are a big support to Luisa and she also believes that her grandchildren are the hopes of their future dreams.

loans.use: purchase of fish nets, ropes, sinkers, bamboo to expand her business

loans.name: Nancy Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Nancy se dedica ala venta de comida y refrescos desde hace varios años el cual ha sido su sustento y la manera de ayudar a su esposo a pagar los gastos básico de agua y luz y lo necesario, el trabaja como agente de ventas. Procreo tres hijos dos independientes de ella, la menor esta a su cuido, en los últimos meses las ventas han sido bajas lo que implica obtener ganancias, retrasar los pagos. Todo esto se ha dado por la crisis en la economía en el país, todo mas caro, con la sequía aumentaron de precio la canasta básica y mucha gente en desempleo son las causas de las ventas bajas. En sus créditos anteriores ah logrado invertir el inventario para preparar los alimentos. Hoy tiene la necesidad construir el baño y cerrar el inodoro para estar en mejores condiciones de higiene como una mejor privacidad para su familia. Agradeciendo Afodenic por los préstamos el cual ha hecho de su vida una mejor estabilidad de equilibrio en su negocio como las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Nancy has worked for many years selling food and soft drinks. This has been her way of providing for herself and helping her husband to pay for basic needs such as water and electricity. Her husband works as a sales agent. She raised three children. Two of them are adults and the third is still in her care. In the last few months her sales have lagged, which has meant difficulties in making a profit, and delaying payments. All of this has occurred because of the economic crisis in Nicaragua. Everything is more expensive and a drought has meant that the cost of basic goods has gone up. This, as well as the many people who are unemployed, are the causes of her poor sales. With earlier loans, Nancy has been able to invest in inventory to prepare her foods. Now she needs to build a bathroom and enclose the toilet in order to improve the hygiene in her home and provide her family with more privacy. She thanks Afodenic for the loans, which have made her life more stable and balanced, both in her business and in the improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand and cement to buid a bathroom and enclose the toilet

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday E. is currently in the business of selling beans and potatoes in a market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice, posho 	(a hot, sticky dough made from maize flour) and more beans to sell.  

Sunday is 25 years old and married to an accountant. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice, posho and more beans to sell

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica en el departamento de León, la señora María R. se ha dedicado a atender su propia pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos comestibles tales como pan dulce, pan simple, galletas, golosinas, entre otros. Tambien vende huevos y refrescos en polvo listos para preparar. Sus productos los oferta en sus estantes y en su vitrina exhibiéndolos.
Ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir a lo inmediato en los productos para la pulpería y por tal motivo es que solicita un crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, pan, entre otros para continuar comercializándolos y así obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
In the city of Telica and department of León, Sra. María R. manages her own store where she offers all types of edible products such as sweet bread, plain bread, cookies, candy, and other items. She also sells eggs and powdered drinks that are ready to prepare. Her products are arranged on the shelves and placed in a display case for viewing.

She has found it necessary to acquire more products for her store. For this reason, María is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, bread, and other products so that she can continue generating sales and obtain the income needed to maintain her modest home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She is a café owner. Her café is located in a nice quiet neighborhood of the city and is always full of people. Nadezhda opened her café 3 years ago. Within this short period of time she managed to establish a stable business with a good reputation among her customers. 

Nadezhda is a high-achiever. She always tries to be successful in all her endeavors. She is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to increase her working capital which will allow her to improve service quality and diversify the menu in her café.  Nadezhda is very sociable. She has a friendly personality which helps her in her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.es:
El señor Inocencio S. tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda, pero le está haciendo falta algunas detalles, para el lo mas importante por el momento son las barda, ya que trabaja gran parte del día y quiere la seguridad para su familia.
Es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo y así poder elaborar las bardas alrededor de la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con sus ingresos que obtiene de su empleo en un restauran de mariscos en el departamento de cocina. 
Inocencio S. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Inocencio S. has achieved home ownership in little time but he is lacking certain details. The most important item at the moment is the fence since he works for a great part of the day and wants to keep his family secure. It is for this reason that he is requesting the loan and be able build a fence around his house. He plans to pay the loan with his earnings that he obtains from his kitchen job in a seafood restaurant. Inocencio S. has already had two loans with FVP which he paid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence in front of his house.

loans.name: Carmen Milagros

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Perla.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Carmen vende leña en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Carmen junto a su esposo se dedican a la reventa de gaseosas, para lo cual tiene un carro.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Carmen son aumentar su negocio y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Perla” (Pearl). She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Carmen sells firewood from her house, an activity she engages in every day. Her husband has a car from which he sells soft drinks.

Carmen needs a loan of 1200 PEN to purchase firewood. Her dreams are to increase her business and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Antonia Digna

texts.es: La señora Antonia de 43 años de edad, es comerciante de un tramo en el mercado del Mayoreo en la capital de Managua, tiene vaR. años administrando este negocio que es la venta de gorras, fajas, bolsos, sondaleza, carcasa de celulares, batería y una variedad de productos. Su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad, tiene una hija el cual cursa la secundaria, y es la que queda en la casa cuidando.  Inicie mis ventas con poco dinero propio, luego con dinero que la institución financio. Las dificultades es que las ventas se bajan, pero no se deja de vender lo cual quiere invertir en más productos para lograr mejores resultado. Comprara gorras al por mayor en variedades para adulto y niños, bolsos, calzonetas, toallas para aprovechar la temporada del verano. Sus planes es lograr hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia is 43 years old and a merchant who has a vending post at the Wholesale Market in the capital of Managua. For several years she has been managing her business of selling caps, belts, handbags, nautical rope, mobile phone cases, batteries, and a variety of other products. Her husband provides security services. They have a daughter who attends high school and is left to look after the house.

Antonia started her sales with a little bit of her own money and later utilized money from a financial institution. Her difficulty has been when sales were low as a result of not being able to invest in more products to achieve better results. She will buy a wider variety of caps for adults and children, handbags, bathing suits, and towels to take advantage of the summer season. Her plans include making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase caps, handbags, bathing suits, and towels

loans.name: Monsuratu

texts.en:
Monsuratu is 48 years old, married and has four children. Her children are aged 9 to 28 years old. They also assist her in the trade when they are back from school. She hopes to expand more on her business so she can make a good profit for her business and family upkeep. 

Monsuratu buys and sells drinks and also sells cooked food to her customers. She has been in this business since 1998.         
She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase drinks and food items in bulk at a reduced rate so she can sell more and make more profit as well. She says thank to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food items and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 35 years old and married with two children.  She sells eggs in her rural home to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years.  Her customers are her neighbors and her friends who know about the business.  She rents out her residential houses to earn enough money to support her family since the living costs are high.  

Joyce has been saving her money with her group in Faulu Kenya called 'Precious' which enables her to access loans and the group guarantees. She is determined to improve her business now that she can access loans and this is her first loan. She has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stocks of eggs for sale.  She hopes to venture into other businesses and improve her living standard in the future.

loans.use: To add stocks of eggs for sale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta S. is from the village of Ramon Magsaysay, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old and single. To make a living, Julieta has a general store, which she has been engaged in for seven years, and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase inventory

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto tiene 55 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de acarreo. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Con mucho sacrificio ha mejorado su actividad, pues siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a su hijo estudios que son necesarios, por lo que trabaja de sol a sol para generar ingresos necesarios en su hogar. Por lo que siente muy contento con esta experiencia para mejorar su calidad de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la reparación de camión, ya que tiene comprar además ciertos repuestos. Su deseo es llegar a cambiar su camión y obtener otro.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 55 years old and he has been providing trucking services for more than 12 years. He has improved his business with much sacrifice and he wants to be able to provide his son with a good education, which he feels is essential. He works from sunup to sundown to generate the necessary household income. He is happy to be able to improve his family’s quality of life. He is asking for this loan in order to be able to make repairs to his truck and buy some spare parts that he needs. He would like to trade his truck in for another.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Truck repair

loans.name: Sirojitdin

texts.en:
N. Sirojitdin has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with two children. 

Sirojitdin has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of 200 USD, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Sirojitdin began this enterprise 5 years ago. He has expanded his business and today his family is also engaged in this business. 

Today Sirojitdin needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1000 USD. Sirojitdin is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.    
      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. She is a farmer. She currently owns two hectares of rice field that she and her husband till. She sells their harvest at the market. She also owns a pig for breeding. She says that the reason she and her husband work hard is so that their children will get a proper education and finish college some day.

In 2009, Rosalie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa del señor Raúl T..

El señor Raúl T. M. es un hombre responsable y trabajador, es padre de 2 hijos a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. En este momento el desea arreglar el techo de su casa por que se encuentra muy deteriorado y en temporada de lluvia se traspasa el agua y teme que pueda perjudicar en sus aparatos electrónicos y pueda suceder algún desperfecto. 
Raúl T. trabaja como chofer de trasporte de maquiladoras y su esposa en una maquiladora como costurera es así como ellos se ayudan para cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
The person in the picture is the wife of Raúl T.. Raúl T. M. is a responsible, hardworking man. He is the father of two children, and wants to offer them a better quality of life. At present he would like to fix the roof of his home, because it is in a poor state of repair. During the rainy season it lets the water in and Raúl T. is concerned that this will damage his electrical items and spoil the things in thier home. Because Raúl T. works as a driver for factories in the area, and his wife is a semstress in one of the factories, they will be able to cover the repayments on the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make their home waterproof

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El Señor Santos, tiene 2 hijos nacido el primero de Diciembre de 1986 em Santa Cruz, Andrés Ibáñez, el señor es mototaxista, se dedica a esta actividad casi 10 años es su actividad principal, tambien se dedica  ha la agricultura, ha obtenido su tierra mediande compra. Son 194226 Hectareas en la cual siembra Maiz, Sandia, Maní y otros productos. y con esta actividad mantiene a su familia ya que su esposa se dedica a labores de casa y al cuidado de sus dos hijos, es una persona responsable y trabajador siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, con el dinero del credito el Sr. Santos desea contratar mano de obra para que le ayuden en la cosecha de sus productos para luego comercializarlos en el mercado de el Torno esta muy agardecido con Emprender por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Santos, who has 2 children, was born on the 1st of December 1986, in Andrés Ibáñez, Santa Cruz. Santos drives a motorcycle-taxi, and this has been his principal activity for 10 years. He also is engaged in agriculture and has bought some land that he farms. He has 194,226 hectares on which he sows corn, watermelon, maní (a basic root crop), and other products. With this activity, he maintains his family, while his wife dedicates herself to household work and caring for their 2 children. He is a responsible person and worker, always thinking about his family's well-being. With this loan, Santos will hire laborers to help in harvesting his crops, which can then be sold in the local market in Torno. He is very grateful to Emprender for the credit opportunity it offers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: HIRING WORKERS TO HELP HARVEST HIS CROPS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sales of generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: G.s. Funez Mendoza Group

texts.es: Ángela Martina y Alejandrina Gloria  conforman al grupo solidario Fúnez M. tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación por lo que se sienten muy satisfechas de mejorar su calidad de vida por medio de los financiamientos. Ambas tienen una pulpería, en el caso de alejandrina  tiene más experiencia en el negocio y así aconseja a su amiga Ángela para saber administrar su negocio y además se ayudan en comprar nuevos productos para ofrecerlos en sus pulperías, pues juntas han mejorado su actividad a base de puro sacrificio. Este financiamiento es destinado para comprar golosinas, lácteos, detergentes, golosinas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Ángela Martina and Alejandrina Gloria make up the communal bank "F. M.." They have been working with the Fundación for a long time, and they feel very pleased to have been able to improve their quality of life through these loans. Both of them have grocery stores. In the case of Alejandrina, she has more experience with the business and so she gives advice to her friend Angela on how to run the business. The loans help them to buy new products to offer in their stores, and together they have increased their businesses as a result of pure sacrifice. This loan will be used to buy snacks, dairy products, detergents, sweets, and staple grains.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy products for their grocery stores

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson O. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 35 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Benson owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling seafood products, including fish, in the local community. She has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Benson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be Benson’s 1st loan from HSPFI. He  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 39 años, es una mujer muy alegre, está casada con Caparachin, de 40 años; ambos viven con sus 3 hijos, Bryan de 15, Gimena de 7 y Florentino de 1 año y 6 meses de nacido; como una gran familia ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de la Unión. A doce kilómetros de la ciudad de (Tarma – Perú), se ubica los terrenos de cultivo de Blanca, ahí desde hace 10 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, habas y maíz, que después los vende en el mercado central de Tarma. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dirige a su terreno de cultivo donde cuida y aplica abono a sus plantaciones, aquí espera ansiosa la llegada del atardecer, ya que de regreso a casa, abrirá su pequeña peluquería; donde no solo corta cabellos,  también vende una variedad de artículos para el hogar así como objetos para regalos que los pobladores compran cuando celebran una fiesta. En su negocio es muy rentable, puesto que Blanca recibe buenos ingresos; por eso ella está pensando más adelante construir su casa propia y poder tener un espacio más grande para atender a sus clientes, que todas las noches esperan ansiosos la llegada de Blanca. Este es cuarto crédito con MFP y  está feliz de poder participar y apoyar junto a su banco comunal a otras personas que como ella quieren salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de regalos, con ello tendrá mayor variedad para sus clientes, de la misma manera suministrará su peluquería con nuevos equipos.
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 39 years old, is a very happy woman. She is married to Caparachin, who is 40, and they live with their three children, Bryan, who is 15, Gimena, 7, and Florentino, who is 18 months old. As a large family, they live in a rented house located in the district of Unión. Blanca's farmlands are located twelve kilometers from the city of Tarma (Peru). For 10 years she has planted potatoes, beans, and corn, which she then sells in the central market of Tarma. Very early every morning she goes to her fields, where she cares for and applies fertilizer to her plantings. Here she waits anxiously for the arrival of evening, since when she returns to her house, she opens her little hairdresser's shop, where she not only cuts hair but also sells a variety of articles for the home, which people buy for gifts when they are celebrating a holiday. Blanca's business is very profitable, since she has a good income. For this reason, she is thinking of building her own house in the future and having a larger space to attend to her customers, who anxiously wait for her arrival every night. 

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is happy to be able to participate and support, along with her community bank, other people who want to advance themselves like she does. With the loan that she is applying for, she will invest in the purchase of gifts so that she will have a greater variety for her customers. She will also furnish her hairdresser's shop with new equipment.

loans.use: Buy gifts and articles for the home for resale; furnish her hairdresser's shop.

loans.name: Anuarite

texts.en:
Anuarite is 35 years old. She is married and has seven children between the ages of two and 13. Five of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband is a driver. 

Anuarite sells cooking oil, sugar, soaps, soft drinks and lotions. She has spent ten years in this business. With this loan, she will buy more items such as sugar, soaps, and soft drinks to sell. With the profit she will buy more stock for sale. She says her business is well-known because she has a large number of customers. 

In the future, she would like to sell food as well.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, soft drinks and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda O. is from the town of Talibon. She is 56 years old. Esmeralda is married. Her business is a sari-sari store where she sells various kinds of products. She opened her store at the front of her house because she wants to be able to manage it any time of day. Esmeralda is happy to be of service to her neighbors, she likes selling to them. She also hopes for her store to grow and have more products to sell.

Esmeralda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase soft drinks, canned goods and noodles.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Hafeez's Group

texts.en:
Hafeez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s dairy business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo.  That will help him sell more quantities of milk to more clients. 

Hafeez is 50 years old, a mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Her sons are illiterate and are involved in the business of selling animal feed. Her daughter is studying in the 5th class.
 
Hafeez herself is a housewife, stays at home and does her household work. She also helps her husband in his business. She takes care of his buffaloes by giving them food and water on time. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she timely paid her installments and attended every meeting. She is hopeful that through this loan investment, her husband’s business will be improved, and that will result in a positive financial outcome.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Elvin Francisco

texts.es: Elvin Francisco tiene 26 años. Es casado y  vive su esposa e hijo. Elvin tiene su panadería ubicada en su vivienda.  El aprendió este medio de vida porque necesitaba proporcionarle a su familia un medio de ingreso, desde hace mas de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Desde las 5 de la mañana inicia su labor por lo que tiene que elaborarlos y algunas veces venderlos en las calles la mayoría de sus clientes son familiares amigos vecinos y público en general.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos y realizar la elaboración de su delicioso pan ya que se acerca diciembre y son los meses que mas demanda obtiene. Su sueño es terminar los estudios profesionales y le gustaría tener un terreno para construir una casa.
texts.en: Elvin Francisco is 26 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son. Elvin owns a bakery located in his house. He learned this trade because he needed to provide income for his family. He has had this business for more than four years. He begins his work at 5 am, making the bread and sometimes selling it on the street. The majority of his customers are relatives, friends, neighbors, and the general public. He is requesting this loan in order to buy supplies and continue making his delicious bread since December is approaching and these are the months when he has the highest demand. His dream is to finish his professional studies, and he would also like to obtain land in order to build a house.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa de 37 años, desde pequeña ella veía a la mama cuando cosía ropa y como atendía a sus clientes cogiendo las medidas del sus cuerpo para confeccionar  la ropa que ellos querían por eso ella decidió seguir la misma carrera de la mama  cosiendo y confeccionando ropa de sus vecinos obtuvo experiencia para ayudarla a la mama en su trabajo.  

Con la dedicación que utilizo para ayudarla a la mama ahora ella tiene su taller de confección y costura conjunto con ella. Trabaja  desde las 08h00am de lunes a sábado con ayuda de 5 empleadas confeccionan y cosen ropa.  Rosa quiere seguir con su negocio para poder mantener a sus hijos de 17, 7, 5 años ya que su esposo es electricista. Por eso coge turnos doble y trabaja con su mama haciendo entrega de vestidos, blusas, camisetas etc. 

Ella tiene muchas aspiración para su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, hilos, accesorios para confeccionar mas ropa. En el futuro quiere incrementar el taller para poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old.  When she was a little girl, she watched her mom when she was sewing clothes and saw how she served her customers, taking their measurements so that she could make clothes that they wanted.  Rosa decided to follow the same career path as her mom, sewing and making clothes for her neighbors.  She gained experience by helping her mom in her work.

Through the same dedication with which she used to help her mom, Rosa now has a sewing and dressmaking workshop with her.  She works from 8.00am from Monday to Saturday with the help of 5 employees.  Together they make and sew clothes.  Rosa would like to continue with her business so that she can support her children aged 17, 7 and 5.  Her husband is an electrician.  Rosa works double shifts and works with her mom delivering dresses, blouses, t-shirts etc.

Rosa has a lot of aspirations for her business.  She would like to use her loan to buy fabric, threads and accessories so that she can make more clothes.  In the future, she would like to expand her workshop so that she can provide other people with work.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads and accessories

loans.name: Rolando Albeiro

texts.es:
Después de graduarse como Técnico en Mecatrónica, Rolando Albeiro P. H., decidió ser independiente, situación que le ha permitido convertirse en microempresario en el municipio de Yarumal-Antioquia, donde repara todo tipo de aparatos electrónicos con la limitante de que los repuestos debe llevarlos desde Medellín- Antioquia, lo que le dificulta ser oportuno en la entrega de sus trabajos. 

Rolando espera mejorar sus servicios y mantenerse en el mercado, necesita del apoyo económico para comprar algunos repuestos necesarios para reparar televisores y equipos de sonido, así como herramienta mecánica que le permitirá reparar mucho mejor los artefactos. 

Si Rolando obtiene dicho apoyo logrará ser más oportuno en la entrega, aumentarán sus clientes y en esa medida sus ingresos, para continuar ofreciéndole a su familia el sustento diario, pues actualmente está casado y tiene 2 hijos.
texts.en:
When he graduated as a Mechatronics Technician, Rolando Albeiro P. H. decided to be independent, a situation that has allowed him to become a micro businessman in the town of Yarumal, Antioquia, where he repairs all kinds of electronic devices.  He’s limited by the fact, however, that he has to get his replacement parts in Medellín, Antioquia, which creates difficulty for him to deliver his jobs on time.

Rolando hopes to improve his services and stay in the marketplace.  He needs financial help to buy some needed replacement parts to repair television sets and sound equipment as well as technical equipment that will make it possible for him to repair the devices much better.

If Rolando gets the help he will be able to finish jobs on time, his clientele will grow and, by the same token, so will his income and he will be able to continue to provide daily support to his family since he’s married and has two children.

loans.use: To buy television set replacement parts and mechanical tools.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos en Lolotiquillo, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y bebidas, este negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Lolotiquillo, donde a diario ofrece a sus clientes lo mejor en bebidas y pupusas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar ingredientes para la preparación de las pupusas  como chicharrón, pollo,  quesillo, tomates, condimentos y compra de bebidas, con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar su inventario y de contar con todo lo necesario para disponer de él al momento de realizar la venta.
Su propósito principal es mejorar su calidad de vida, ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios, a través del buen manejo del negocio y brindando una buena atención y servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
María, 35 years of age, lives with her husband and two children in Lolotiquillo, department of Morazán.  She is dedicated to the sale of pupusas and drinks. (Pupusas are a traditional Salvadoran dish made from a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, meat, or vegetables.)  This business is located in the municipal market of Lolotiquillo, where she offers the best drinks and pupusas to her clients daily.
She is requesting a loan to purchase drinks and ingredients for the preparation of pupusas, such as pork rinds, chicken, cheese, tomatoes, and condiments.  With this loan she will have the opportunity to improve her inventory and be able to rely on having what she needs available at her point of sale.  Her principal goals are to improve her quality of life and help her children in their studies, in addition to providing good management to her business and offering good attention and service to her clients.

loans.use: Compra de chicharrón, pollo,  quesillo, tomates, condimentos y compra de bebidas

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: La señora Melania esta casada con don Placido con 4 hijos, ella es nacida en VallegranD. hace 35 años que viven en la forestal a 10 km del Torno donD.  tienen su tierra,  trabaja en la agricultura junto a su hijos quienes le ayudan en la siembra maíz, poroto y papa pero también  se dedican a la plantación D. cítrico y ganadería, son una familia muy unida el dinero del crédito lo utilizaran en la compra D. semillas para la siembra D. papa y maíz y también para el preparado D. la tierra, todos los productos que siembran lo comercializan en el mercado D. el Torno, la Sra. Melania es una persona trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Melania is married to don Placido, they have 4 children. She was born in VallegranD. 35 years ago and currently lives in the forestal 10km from Torno where they have their land. She works in agriculture with her children who help her sow corn, poroto (kidney beans), and potatoes they also grow citric fruits and cattle raise. They are a very united family and with the loan they will buy seeds for the potato and corn crops also to prepare the land. All the products that they farm they sell in the Torno market. Mrs. Melania is a hardworking person and is very grateful with the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: For potato and poroto (kidney beans) crops.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sebastiana L. contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar esta comisión en la zona. La Sra. Sebastiana tiene un pequeño puesto D. hamburguesas en el centro. En los últimos años ha tenido un número considerable D. clientes, por ello trata cada vez más D. darles un agradable ambiente en su negocio. Ella está ansiosa por tener una oportunidad D. hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos.
El comité se denomina "Mujeres Virtuosas", con 15 miembros. Es un grupo que se destaca en la comunidad por ser muy unidas y tener un espíritu emprendedor. Las damas están cobrando el crédito para la compra D. mercaderías comestibles para su posterior venta (frutas, verduras y carne).
texts.en:
Sra. Sebastiana L. contacted her neighbors and friends to form this commission in the neighborhood. Sra. Sebastiana has a small hamburger stand in the center of town. In the last few years she's had a considerable number of clients, but she continually tries to give them an enjoyable atmosphere in her business. She's anxious to have the opportunity to grow her business and increase her income. 

The committee calls itself "Mujeres Virtuosas", or "Virtuous Women", and has 15 members. They stand out in the community for being very united and having an entrepeneurial spirit. The ladies are asking for the credit for the purchase of edible merchadise for later sale, such as fruits, vegetables, and meat.

loans.use: Buying vegetables, fruits and meat

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating food production and cake making businesses.  She lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food production and cake making businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000. Susan is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her business. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Susan aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mary Cruz

texts.es: Mary Cruz tiene 34 años, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su actividad. Ella se dedica a una pulpería  por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora que disfruta de su trabajo, y que además está luchando por llevar los ingresos necesarios a su hogar ya que tiene 2 hijos menores a su cargo. Ella actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, golosinas y detergente. Ella sueña con tener una casa con muchas comodidades y tener un negocio muy productivo, si es posible establecerlo en el mercado.
texts.en: Mary Cruz is 34 years old, and has always liked to be active. She works at a local store and is a very hardworking woman who enjoys her job, and who is also struggling to bring in the household income she needs, since she has 2 young children in her care. Right now she is requesting this loan in order to buy basic grains, dairy products, meat, sweets, and detergent. Her dream is to have a house with many conveniences and to have a very productive business, if it is possible to establish one in the market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira O. is from the village of Pedlagahan, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Elvira is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of meals like chicken and pork adobo to customers in the local community. She also sells coco and wood charcoal. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. 

Elvira is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José Gilberto tiene 39 años de edad es casado y tiene 3 hijos de edad escolar. Actualmente vive en casa propia en el caserío Olleria ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Morrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la provincia en el norte de Perú. Vive en la parte rural de su distrito y su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Se gana la vida desde hace 15 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Además, cuenta con ingresos adicionales de actividades relacionadas a su trabajo al jornal en diferentes chacras en su zona. José Gilberto desea invertir en su negocio con la compra de aves menores para engorde y alimento balanceado sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). José Gilberto es muy trabajador y bastante entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es usar sus ingresos para ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Gilberto, 39, is married and has three school age children.  He lives in his own house in Ollería which is located 15 minutes from the city of Mórrope, a district inhabited by humble, hard working people who are farmers.  It’s located in Lambayeque Province over forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of this province in northern Peru.  He lives in the rural part of the district and his community is small with approximately 100 families.

For the last 15 years he’s been earning a living raising small farm animals in corrals located in his back yard.  He tends to raise pigs, sheep, ducks and turkeys.  When they reach a good point of development he sells them to merchants who tend to visit the area where he lives.  He learned this activity from his parents which is to say he knows it to perfection.  The business has competition but also a large market for sales.  Besides, he has an additional source of income working as a day laborer in various fields in his area.

José Gilberto wants to invest in his business buying barnyard fowl to raise and buying nutritionally balanced animal feed.  Because of this, he’s thought it convenient to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).  José Gilberto is a hard working man who is devoted to his family.  His greatest wish is to use his income to provide his family with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy barnyard fowl to raise and to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan K., 58, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. K. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about $5 US per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $38 on food and $90 on other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a new sewing machine for the children to expand their business. 

This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. K. is not available so her husband appeared in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to expand her children's business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 50 years old and married with five children. Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mercy has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 30 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mercy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, age 52, is married and resides with his two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia. 

He and his wife are engaged in a business of selling groceries. They earn an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since Phat and his wife have had this business. 

Phat is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is his second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. Phat appears in the photograph with his family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Esmeralda has a retail shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of dried fish.

Esmeralda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Esmeralda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Clemencia Pilar

texts.es:
Clemencia de 44 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Esa casada y el trabajo haciendo vallas publicitarias tienen dos hijos de 13 y 15 años que estudian en colegios fiscales. Es maestra particular en una institución educativa.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás en una institución educativa ya que ella es licenciada en educación decidió abrir ese tipo de negocio. Ella labora de lunes a viernes de 7H00 am a 14H00 pm con ayuda de tres maestras mas. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, ladrillos, pinturas para en un futuro construir otra institución educativa.
texts.en:
Clemencia, 44, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because at its beginning there were many orchid flowers) in Guayaquil.  She is married and her husband works manufacturing advertising fencing.  They have two children who are 13 and 15 years old and attend public school.  She is a private teacher at an educational institution.

She started some time ago working at an educational institution because as a licensed teacher she decided to open that type of business.  She works Monday through Friday from 7am until 2pm with the help of three additional teachers.  

With help from the loan she plans to buy building materials and supplies like cement, bricks and paint to build another educational institution in the future.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en: Nemesia, a 46-year-old married mother of five children, lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City where she has had a general store that sells a variety of products  for six years.  A member of PMPC for four years, Nemesia is requesting a loan for 10,000 to purchase more stocks for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia nacio el año 1972.
