La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta útiles escolares y pasamanería, la socia trabaja ene ste negocio desde hace 10 años y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos, lapicerosm reglas, borradores, papeles, papelotes, escuadras, album, folders y otros útiles más para implementar su librería. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de utiles para implementar su librería.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This lady is a member of the “TERCER MILENIO” communal bank, located in the Urubamba district and province, within the Cusco department.

She was born in 1972, is in a live-in relationship, has two children, and has been selling school supplies and decorations for ten years.  Things are going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She needs this loan in order to buy notebooks, mechanical pencils, rulers, erasers, paper, scratch paper, T-squares, albums, folders, and other utensils for her store.  She is asking for this loan to invest into her store.

She is very happy and grateful for the support she has gotten through this method and she is committed to making her payments on scheduled.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Phoeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Poeung is a married woman and the mother of six children. She resides of Reussey Keo commune. She is a domestic rice farmer. She always has a plot of fertile land which comes from her parent since she was single. In order to generate more income, her husband is a fish catcher. They could earn a daily profit of approximately $4. Mrs. Poeung has six children, one of whom is a security guard in a private company. 
Mrs. Poeung is looking for a loan in the amount of $700 to do the farm, such as to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is married, with 8 children.  She is 53 years old and lives in Zamora, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  Marciana sells products such as rice, coffee, milk, sugar, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.  Marciana has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Yucay, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Lorenza; tiene 45 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia tiene 2 hijos de 16, 11 años de edad; y sus otros dos hijos ya son independientes; la socia trabaja en artesanía, la socia compra artesanía hecha y también ella teje diferentes trabajos como mantas, ponchos, chullos, chalinas, correas todos con motivos andinos y hechos a mano, la socia lleva la técnica heredada desde sus ancestros y con una perfección y una combinación de colores extraordinarios capta las vivencias del día a día en las altas y frías montañas, la socia recrea en sus trabajo las, aves, las montañas, los ríos, las quebradas y mucho mas en finos diseños. La socia es artesana independiente y ella lleva sus trabajos a la puerta del hotel Posada en Yucay, esperando que los pasajeros salgan de su hotel rumbo a diferentes circuitos y ella aprovecha el relax de los pasajeros para ofrecer sus trabajos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar en esta ocasión lanas de alpaca para realizar mantas y pisos para las mesas.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank "VIRGEN NATIVIDAD". The bank is located in the District of Yucay, in the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco.

The member is Lorenza, she is 45 years old.  The member is unmarried, and has two children aged 16 and 11 years old, and two older independent children.  The member works in handicrafts.  The member buys handicrafts, and she also weaves different items such as shawls, ponchos, winter hats, scarves and belts.  They all have Andean motifs, and are made by hand.  The member uses a technique brought down through the generations, and with her perfectionism and combination of extraordinary colors, she captures the day to day experiences of life in the high, cold mountains.  In her handicrafts, the member recreates birds, mountains, river, ravines, and many more things with her fine designs.

The member is an independent artisan, and she brings her handiwork to the entrance of the hotel Posada in Yucay, hoping that as travelers leave the hotel bound for different destinations, she can take advantage of their relaxation to show them her handiwork.

The member is requesting the loan on this occasion to buy alpaca wool to make shawls and table runners.  The member is grateful for the support that is being offered to her and similarly, she promises to comply with her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: on this occasion to buy alpaca wool for making shawls and table runners.

loans.name: Mer

texts.en: Mer, 47, is a cake seller and can earn $4 a day. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom work in a factory for $3 a day each. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on housing rent, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. Mer used to be a farmer but changed her career to sell cake afT. she take a loan from Kredit MFI. Her new career can provide a good income to her family. In the future, she wants to buy a flat in Phnom Penh and to sell food and cake there.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work.

loans.name: Arling Jissell

texts.es: Arling de la Comarca Villa Alvarez labora en su casa de habitacion, donde tiene establecido un molino de moler maiz, para realizar este servicio al pueblo de Villa Alvarez, actividad que funciona como su mayor fuente de ingreso para el bienestar familiar, requiere de este financiamiento para complementar gastos en la construccion de su vivienda, esto le permitira garantizar vivir en mejores condiciones de vida, en su comunidad la consideran como una persona responsable, trabajadora, porgresiva  y de buenas costumbres espera ser beneficiada con este fondo para poder llevar a cobo su actividad proyectada.
texts.en:
Arling is from Villa Alvarez.  She works at home where she has a mill which grinds corn.  She provides this service to the village of Villa Alvarez.  This is the main source of income for her family.

Arling needs this loan to cover the cost of building her home.  This will enable her to enjoy better living conditions.  Within her community, Arling is considered to be a responsible, hard-working, progressive person with good habits.  She hopes to receive this loan so that she can carry out her planned project.

loans.use: to finish building her home

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is single. She lives with her sister and widowed mother in a suburb about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chanthy sells bread. She buys it from a bakery in Phnom Penh and resells it in her village. She has received one Kiva loan and is now asking for a second one, in the amount of $250, to construct a concrete path leading to her house.

loans.use: To construct a concrete path leading to her house.

loans.name: Raphar's Group

texts.en:
Raphar is a a sixty-three-year-old married man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to have a better house and to expand his business to earn more income. He once had a retail shop selling fresh foods and after accumulating enough profits he ventured  into a  shop dealing in general merchandise, a business he has operated for the last six years.

Raphar needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and boxes of matches to sell. He is a member of Kahuna B where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan; out of six members only five took the money.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and boxes of matches to sell.

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is 21 years old and married and has two children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Serena is borrowing 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Serena has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from sari-sari (general) store. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina tiene 70 años, es D. la ciudad D. Paraguarí. Tiene una despensa bien surtida en frente D. una plaza D. la ciudad hace más D. 50 años, está casada con el Sr Crecenciano, ellos viven solos en su pequeña casita.
Tienen una sola hija, llamada Hilda, quien trabaja en Buenos Aires y desD. allí los ayuda con un poco D. dinero. Marina nos cuenta que a lo largo D. los 50 años D. abrir su despensa logró juntar muchísima clientela y gracias a eso tiene un buen ingreso en el negocio, lo cual la ayuda muchísimo.
La Sra. Marina pretenD. utilizar el dinero del crédito para recargar más su despensa, con los productos D. primera necesidad, como ser: fideos, azúcar, harina, panificados y demás artículos. agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues es muy importante su apoyo.
texts.en:
Marina, 70, is from the city of Paraguarí.  She has had a well-stocked store across from a square in the city for over 50 years.  She’s married to Crescenciano; they live alone in a small house.

They only have one daughter, called Hilda, who works in Buenos Aires and helps them out sending them a little money from there.  Marina tells us that throughout these fifty years since she opened her store she’s acquired quite a few customers and thanks to that she earns good income in the business which helps her very much.

Marina intends to use the loan money to restock her store more with basic staple items like noodles, sugar, flour, baked goods and other items.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her because its support is very important.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: El señor Samuel, nacido en la comunidad de mora, del departamento de Santa Cruz de 24 años, su señora esposa es la Sra. Fátima trabaja en una sala de bingos  de la ciudad de Santa Cruz tienen un hijo y ambos trabajan  y se  esfuerzan para buscar mejores días para su familia y para el bienestar de su hijito, ellos radican desde hace 3 años en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, viven en la zona del  Plan 3.000 actualmente el Sr.  Samuel se dedica a prestar sus servicios de soldadura en forma independiente, a las empresas o personas particulares que lo solicitan, su crédito justamente es para la compra de herramienta de trabajo en el área de arco y oxigeno y esto de ayuda en realizar un buen trabajo  y así satisfacer a sus clientes el sr. Samuel  esta agradecido con el préstamo y la oportunidad que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Samuel was born in the community of Mora, in the Department of Santa Cruz. He is 24 years old, and his wife, Fátima, works in a bingo hall in the city of Santa Cruz. They have one child, and both of them work and make great efforts to achieve better days for their family and for the well-being of their little child. For the past three years, they have lived in the city of Santa Cruz. They live in the "Plan 3000" zone. Currently, Samuel works providing welding services on an independent basis, to businesses or private individuals who request his services. His loan will be used to buy working tools in the area of arc and oxygen welding. This will help him do a good job and thus satisfy his customers. Samuel is grateful for the loan and the opportunity that has been provided to him.

loans.use: to buy tools for arc and oxygen welding.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. In order to satisfy his family's needs, he decided to open his own business. He started to work as an blacksmith in 2009, having already had fifteen years of experience in this domain. 

He has gained a fair number of clients so far and is looking forward to attract more. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase metal for his business. This Kiva loan will certainly boost his productivity thus his profits. In the future, he plans to expand his business and take bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase metal for his business.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen, aged 25 years, is a single lady who runs a photocopying business that has been in operation for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of about Kes 12,000. This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy another photocopier machine and printing paper.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Dogan Hortense

texts.fr:
Dogan est une femme âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée å un instituteur. Elle a 4 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 23 ans et le dernier a 4 ans.
Dogan travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence.
Dogan a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dogan voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dogan is a woman of 46. She is married to a grammar school teacher. She has four children who all attend school. The oldest is 23 and the youngest four. 

Dogan has been working as a retailer since 1992. She sells charcoal to all comers out of her home. She buys her product in Lomé and she works alone. At the present time, her biggest difficulty is the competition. 

Dogan has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that with the profit, she intends to care for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en:
Johnbosco is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in this profession for the past six years. 

After realizing that as a certificate holder he cannot attain his dream of becoming a head teacher, Johnbosco decided to go back to school so as to be able to compete nationally in the job market. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to pay school fees for himself.  His personal goal is to educate himself and children to attain better qualifications.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is married with one child.  She runs a retail shop near her residence selling different consumable items, especially food.  She lives in Vituka Dar es Salaam.  She is facing stiff competition from nearby shops.  Due to her weak capital base she is likely to face difficulties as she usually faced with stockouts.  To sustain these competitions she is in need of USD 400 to strengthen her working capital.  The amount will be used to add stock of some items especially those with high turnover.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Fakal

texts.en:
Born in 1982 at Alklakou where he still currently lives, Mr. Fakal GBAHOUGBA is a young married man and father of two children. After elementary school he began to learn the retail industry of auto parts, from which he currently receives income. During the last ten years, through this activity, Mr. Fakal G. possesses experience in selling auto parts that should provide you with confidence in supporting him with a loan.

His business is currently working very well and in the worry of increasing his capabilities to satisfy the increasing demands of his clients, he is asking for a credit of $1000 to be able to buy and sell, in bulk quantities, original auto parts well sought after by his clients. The satisfaction of this project will allow him to increase his revenues and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1982 à Aklakou où il vit actuellement, Monsieur GBAHOUGBA Fakal est un jeune homme marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Après ses études primaires, il s’est lancé dans le commerce des pièces détachées ; ce qui fait ses revenus actuels. Depuis une dizaine d’années, dans cette activité, Monsieur G. Fakal possède une expérience dans la vente des pièces détachées ; expérience qui lui confère une assurance dans la gestion de crédit.

Ses affaires marchent à merveille et dans le souci d’accroître sa capacité de satisfaire les demandes de plus en plus croissantes de sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter en gros et revendre les pièces détachées originales très appréciées des clients . Comme impact, la satisfaction de ce projet lui permettra d’arriver à augmenter ses revenus et du coup améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling of auto parts.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan T. is 32 years old and lives with her husband Hou Thim in the Kampung Cham Province, Cambodia. They both work very hard, and just gave birth to a new baby. She and her husband make a living by planting and cultivating crops in their field and make around $5/day from their plantation. This couple is striving to work almost day and night in their field plowing, cultivating, and fertilizing soil to grow more crops due to a great demand in the market. They hope to use a loan to purchase one horse and a cart in order to transport crops from their farm to the local market. In the future, they hope to save more money to buy one more plantation so they can grow a wider range of crops for an addtional income. Chan T. hopes one day she will have enough money to send her children to a local univesity.

loans.use: To purchase one horse and a cart to work in the farm .

loans.name: Natividad Regina

texts.es:
Natividad is 20 years old, is married, and has 3 children. Her husband works in the fields cultivating corn. She has a small grocery store in her house and in the afternoons she embroiders cotton blouses and napkins. She sells them to people in her community who later sell the items in the city of San Cristobal de las Casas. She belongs to the loan group “Mezte 2”. The other members of the group are Maura P. G. (grocery store) and María Eva G. G. (grocery store). With the loan, they plan to invest in merchandise at whole-sale prices. They will then divide up what they buy and use it to stock their stores.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

NATIVIDAD TIENE 20 AÑOS CASADA 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJ EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DE MAIZ. ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA Y POR LAS TARDES SE DEDICA A BORDAR BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS DE MANTA LAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE A PERSONAS DENTRO DE SU COMUNIDAD LAS QUE LUEGO COMERCIAN LAS PRENDAS EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MEZTE 2. LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : MAURA P. G. ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) MARIA EVA G. G. ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) .. CON EL PRESTAMO TODAS ESPERAN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR PARA LUEGO REPARTIRSE ENTRE ELLAS PARA ABASTECER SUS TIENDITAS.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for small grocery store

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella I. is the owner of a store in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she supplements her husband’s income by selling provisions, food stuffs and drinks to her community.

Stella's business is important to her in ensuring the well-being of her 6 children. With the requested loan of US$ 400, Stella will expand her business and enhance her business operation by adding to her inventory.

Stella has been in business since 1999. She is 51 years old and has been a LAPO member for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, food stuffs & drinks for sale

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Mr. Samson is a 30 year-old man, married with three, and lives in Benin City. He repairs cars for a living. He learned this business for four years and started his own in 1994. He needs $800 to buy more car parts and equipment. This, he said, will help him serve his customer better.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment

loans.name: Dian

texts.en: Dian is 21 years old and is a mother of a child aged 3. She sells detergents on credit by going around to various places. She can earn $5 per week. Her husband is a driver who does not have a steady job. She requests this loan to expand her business by  buying more goods to earn more income. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Roiyah

texts.en: Roiyah is a 39-year-old woman who has a small shop and sells crackers, snacks, etc.  She usually earns US$12 per day. Her husband, I., has no fixed income.  Roiyah requests a $125 loan to buy more goods to fill the shop. She hopes that this loan could help her cover her family needs and get more income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: José Vianey

texts.es:
Vianey started selling flowers so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. That business required a lot of investment, and for this reason she was forced to change businesses and started selling clothing three years ago. Now she sells clothes in the traveling markets. Vianey's dream is to build a small store outside her house and also to have a stall in a stationary market.

For this reason Vianey is asking for a loan of $650 that she is ready to repay over a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy more clothing and expand her business little by little. This way she can establish a store in her home. With your help Vianey would be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Vianey comenzó a vender flores para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Sin embargo este negocio requería de mucha inversión, fue por eso que se vio obligada a cambiar de giro fue así como encontró la venta de ropa hace tres años, actualmente vende en los mercados rodantes sin embargo el sueño de Vianey es poder hacer un pequeño local fuera de su casa, además de tener un local en un mercado fijo.

Es por eso que Vianey está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más ropa para ir creciendo poco a poco y así poder establecerse en un local en su casa. Con tu ayuda Vianey podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra K. is 44 years old and raising seven children on her own. She earns an income selling food and beverages in her town's central market. Gulchehra is very nice woman who works hard to make her business stable and successful because she is her family's sole means of support. Gulchehra is trying to generate enough income not only to pay expenses but also to assemble dowries for her three daughters and pay for their weddings. She has borrowed from IMON in the past and made good use of those loans to expand her business rapidly. She has come to us with a new request for a loan, for $1,000 to buy additional goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages such as tea, sugar, coffee, cookies, rolls and chocolate.

loans.name: Donato

texts.es:
Donato is 51 years old. For the past 23 years he has lived with his partner Cristina, who is 52 years of age. Together, they have five children ranging in age from 8 to 25 years old.

He recounts that previously he dedicated himself to making and selling “chipas”, a typical Paraguayan food made from a base of starch, corn and cheese, which his parents taught him how to make. Donato comes from a humble family, for whom he started working at a very young age to help earn food each day.

A few years ago he suffered a hemorrhage which forced him to put a halt to his business for a time. When he recovered, he invested his savings into purchasing corn, starch, flour, nuts and other merchandise to sell.

Donato has advanced greatly and, thanks to excellent sales, he was able to buy a small truck to use for his business. He previously had to sell to order, and carry the merchandise in bags for delivery. With the loan he is seeking he wants to start buying his merchandise at wholesale prices. This will allow him to improve his profit margins and take advantage of discounts that are offered for purchasing at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Donato tiene 51 años. Vive en pareja hace 23 años con Cristina que tiene 52 años. De la unión de ambos nacieron 5 hijos que hoy día tienen el mayor de sus hijos tiene 25 años y el más pequeño tiene 8 años.

Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la fabricación y venta de chipas, la chipa es una comida típica paraguaya a base de almidón, maíz y queso que el aprendió a cocinar de sus padres que también se dedicaban a este rubro. Donato proviene de una familia muy humilde, por lo que el trabajo desde muy temprana edad para ganarse el pan de cada día.

Hace unos años, sufrió un derrame facial, por lo que dejo de trabajar en la elaboración de la chipa por un tiempo. Cuando se recuperó, el invirtió unos ahorros y compro granos de maíz, poroto, almidón, harina, maní entre otras mercaderías para vender.

Donato ha progresado bastante, gracias a sus buenas ventas ha podido comprarse una camioneta para realizar sus ventas, ya que anteriormente lo hacia abajo pedido y debía cargarse con las bolsas para transportarlas. Con el crédito que solicita tiene proyectado comprar sus mercaderías en mayor volumen y así obtener mayores ganancias y beneficios con los descuentos especiales que recibe cuando compra al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase of grains of corn, nuts, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 23 years old and is married with one child, age 3. She and her husband also take care of one other person, age 18 years old. Rukia sells fish and soup. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
. .Doña Flor is separated, she is 41 years old from Ayabaca – Piura. She completed her secondary studies and has 5 children, two of which still depend on her, she lives in Puerto de Salaverry – Trujillo – Peru. A year ago she set up a general store in her living room where she sells groceries, candies, pops, etc. Two years ago she received her first loan of S/.300 from Manuela Ramos and invested the money in clothes which she sold to people she knew who ordered specific garments. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry”. With the loan of S/.800, to be repaid in 4 months she will buy rice, sugar and other products to supply her general store. Doña Flor dreams of owning a bigger general store and thus increase earnings to provide better for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Flor es separada, tiene 41 años, natural de Ayabaca- Piura, cursó estudios secundarios completos, tiene 05 hijos de los cuales 02 de ellos aún dependen de ella; vive en el Puerto de Salaverry - Trujillo – Perú. Ella, tiene desde hace un año, una bodega en la sala de su casa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros. Se inició con Manuela Ramos hace dos años concediéndole un primer préstamo de S/.300.oo, lo invirtió en la compra de ropa para la venta a personas conocidas las cuales le hacen pedidos de prendas específicas. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras De Salaverry”, Con el préstamo de S/. 800.oo, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses; invirtiéndolo en la compra de: arróz, azúcar y otros, para surtir la bodega. La señora Flor sueña con tener una bodega mas grande, y generarse mayores ingresos con lo cual podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales at general store.

loans.name: Homit

texts.en:
Homit H. sells cattle. He started his business in 1993 by raising some calves. Now, Homit has a large cow shed in which he houses many calves and milk cows. He likes animals and his job very much, and his business enables him to support his family.

Homit is 43 years old. He is married with three children. His youngest child is in his last year of school, while his elder son is an adult and helps Homit and his wife with the business. In practice, the business requires a great deal of effort in order to keep it successful and to generate stable income for the family. Thus, Homit gets up every morning at five o’clock to feed the animals and to look after them.

Today, Homit is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 over a 12-month term. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase calves in order to expand the business and to thereby generate more income. In fact, Homit needs the extra income because his children's expenses increase as they grow older. Now, all of his children are studying at school, and he wants them to continue to receive a good education because he hopes that they will achieve their goals in life. With your help, this will be possible, so please be an important part of the growth of Homit’s business.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business by purchasing additional calves

loans.name: Sion's Galilaya Group

texts.en:
Sion L. is 48 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children ages 18 and 16. She makes bricks and sells them. This is a business which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Sion now hopes for a loan of $450 to buy more materials for making bricks. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Nai F. who has a business dealing with banana sales.

loans.use: To buy more materials for bricks making.

loans.name: Donilda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Donilda is requesting her sixth loan to invest it in improving her house by laying tile in her home. This client has worked as a teacher in the Rubén Darío school in zone #5 in the urban zone of Nueva Guinea for 15 years. Currently she is studying in the URACCAN University in Nueva Guinea. She is known for being humble, responsible, honest, and having many dreams of improving herself. She has 5 children, 3 adults and 2 minors: a 13-year-old boy who is in his first year of secondary school and an 11-year-old girl who is in fifth grade. Her husband works as a brick layer. Both of them share the family expenses. Her dream is to have a stable job, a nice house, and to have her children study so they can be worthy people.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La clienta Donilda está solicitando su sexto refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es ponerle la ceramica a la casa, esta cliente labora como docente de la Escuela Rubén Darío en zona # 5 de zona Urbana de Nueva Guinea desde hace 15 años, actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en Universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea; se caracteriza por ser humilde, responsable, honesta y con muncho deseos de superación personal, tiene 5 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y 2 que estan están en su custodia, el niño tiene 13 años estudia su primer año de educación secundaria y la niña de 11 años estudia su quinto grado, su esposo labora como albañil, viven en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, en un barrio creciente, ambos comparten con los gastos familiares, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda bonita y que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de bien.

loans.use: To tile the floor in her home

loans.name: Naqibllah

texts.en:
Naqibllah is a hard worker who operates a dress shop, a business he started seven years ago in Kabul. While he has a large number of clients, he is requesting a loan of $1075 for a term of 12 months to both expand his stock and enlarge his shop, thereby increasing his income and improving his family’s living conditions.

Naqibilah is happy about his relationship with Kiva and AFSG and hopes to open another shop in next few years. He would like to thank all lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expand his store stock.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Pheng P. is 45 and is married with four children. She lives in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a pig breeder and has started her lives stock since 1995. Her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver and typically makes about $5/day for his household. She and her husband would really like to buy another motor-bike so one of their children can earn money as a motor-taxi driver as well. They believe a new motor-bike will generate more profit for their household. (Her husband is pictured with this motor-bike, while Pheng P. is not available).

loans.use: To buy a motor-bike  to operate a business.

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es: LA SEÑORA SINDY TIENE SU TIENDITA EN SU CASA ELLA TENIA UN SUEÑO TENER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO Y LO HA LOGRADO POR SU GRAN ESFUERZO Y RESPONSABILIDAD, AHORA ELLA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS MERCANCIA PARA SURTIR SU TIENDITA  ASI ELEVAR LAS VENTAS Y CRECER ECONOMICAMENTE.
texts.en:
Señora Sindy has a small shop in her house. She dreams of having her own business, and she has managed with a great deal of effort and responsibility. Now she is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise to supply her small store so she can raise her sales and grow economically.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Julia del Carmen G. R., tiene la edad de 34 años ,habita en el barrio monimbo ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su esposo y  hijos, el esposo señora trabaja para poder apoyarla con los gastos de la casa y salir adelante con la familia una  las hijas de doña carmen le apoya con las cosas de la casa mientras ella , se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace mas de diez años , con esta tipo de negocio a logrado mantener su hogar pasando dificultades por a falta de financiamiento ya que ella con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado establecer su clientela, con esta solicitud va a comprar mercadería para tener productos variados para la temporada. Los planes para su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y para el negocio incrementar mas su producto.
texts.en:
Julia del Carmen G. is 34 years old and lives in the Monimbo neighborhood in the city of Masaya with her husband and children. Her husband works to help support the family’s expenses and get ahead. One of Mrs. Carmen’s daughters helps her tend to the home while she dedicates herself to selling footwear, an activity she has carried out for more than ten years. With this type of business, she has managed to maintain the home despite having gone through some difficulties due to lack of financing. Through her own efforts, she has managed to build a customer base. With this request, she will purchase merchandise to have varied products for the season. Her plans for her family include improving their standard of living and, for the business, to increase her supply of products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase footwear for children and adults.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S. is 29 years old and her husband's Mouy Tiey is 32. They currently live in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. The couple has two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. They earn a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind their house, raising them for slaughterer and also for offspring. They started their business three years ago. They currently earn about $3 each day. They always work hard and are very responsible for both their children, paying for school fees, food, clothing, and medical care. Because pig raising is the main source for family's income, S. and Tiey are applying for a loan to buy more piglets for raising.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Married with four children, three boys and a girl currently attending school, Theresa B. is a 44-year-old trader in cereals such as maize who believes that hard work and dedication are the primary antidotes to poverty.

She started this business 11 years ago from Koforidua, but relocated to Abofour for greater market opportunity. Theresa is now requesting a loan to buy larger supplies of maize directly from the farmers to reduce her reliance on middlemen and their often very high prices, an especially important goal given the inflation caused by the current food crisis.

This loan will enable Theresa to better support her husband in taking care of their home and better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize.

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo Akinnade is a 48-year-old married woman with five children.  To earn a living and to support her family, she sells crates of eggs. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more crates of eggs for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional crates of eggs

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres, tiene dos hermanos, ella es la mayor. Tras de haber realizado estudios de contabilidad en un instituto, ahora trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad como asistente contable. Sus padres se dedican a la agricultura y tienen una bodega, pero ahora están pasando dificultades muy severas, debido que no resultó su siembra por el alza de los fertilizantes y la tienda no está bien surtida, debido a ello su madre está desmotivada, ante sus dificultades. Carmen cree que su labor de hija es apoyarla incrementando la cantidad de productos de su bodega y convertirla en un negocio rentable para que sus hermanos tengan la misma oportunidad que ella, está convencida que incrementado los productos captará más clientes que le den la oportunidad de crecer y prosperar. Mientras tanto, sus planes son de seguir trabajando, con la esperanza que la vuelvan a contratar el resto de los seis meses del año para ayudar a sus padres y hermanos menores. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, tiene muchos anhelos de trabajar en este banco comunal, en el cual hace compromisos de pagar las cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para la bodega de su madre.
texts.en:
Carmen is twenty years old, single and she lives in a house with her parents and two younger brothers. After having achieved a degree in accounting from an private school, she now works at the city hall of her town as an assistant accountant. Her parents makes a living by farming and they also owns a grocery store, but they are now going through severe difficulties because the price of fertilizer went up by a lot and they were not able to buy enough. For this reason, their crops are suffering. Also, the store that they own is not well stocked since her mother is feeling very worried because of the crops. Carmen believes that she can help her parents by increasing the amount of products in the store and by making it a profitable business. She wants her younger siblings to have the same opportunities that she had to get an education. She is convinced that by increasing the amount of products at the store, they will be able to attract more customers. Carmen's plans are to continue to work with the hope that her contract at her job will be renewed for another six months so that she can help her parents and her younger siblings. This is the first loan that she is requesting through MFP. She hopes to work with this communal bank and she promises to make her loan payments on time. The money that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing more merchandise for her mother's store.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S., 47, is married with 2 children.  She has 5 years experience in the cabbage & cucumber business. She sells to people of the village 2 days per week. She started her business with a previous loan of US$750 from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala (~US$28).  SPBD loans are Victoria’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used to purchase cement, iron roofing & timber. Victoria produces a lot of fruit & vegetables from her garden.

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to improve and maintain vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Sonia del Carmen R. tiene 30 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ajo, el cual lleva catorce años en las ventas, pues un productos que se vende mucho por su exquisito gusto en la comida. Ella tiene 30 años y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, con tres hijos de 2,6 y 8 años de edad, este crédito lo quiere para comprar 36 cajas de ajo para incrementar el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias, este es su décimo ciclo el cual se ha beneficiado para mantener su negocio y apoyar a su familia, es por eso da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios adquirido y espera poder seguir trabajando. Sus planes  es poder vender en los departamentos y crecer.
texts.en:
Sonia del Carmen R. is 30 years old and her business, which she has been in for fourteen years, is the sale of garlic. This is a product that sells very well given the delicious flavor it adds to food. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, and has three children ages 2, 6 and 8. She would like this loan to purchase 36 boxes of garlic to increase her business and augment her income. This is her tenth loan cycle; these have greatly helped her to maintain her enterprise and support her family. She is grateful to Afodenic for the benefits provided, and she hopes to continue working. Her plans are to be able to sell her product in other areas and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 36 boxes of garlic to increase sales.

loans.name: Mazalo K.

texts.fr: Mme A. K. Mazalo est née en 1971 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle pratique la vente du charbon de bois. Très indispensable dans le ménage, elle sollicite un crédit pour stocker du charbon pendant la saison sèche et le revendre pendant la saison des pluies. Les profits serviront à l’éducation de ses enfants et à l’entretien du ménage.
texts.en:
Madame Mazalo K. A. was born in Tsévié in 1971. She is married and has five children. She sells charcoal, an activity that is essential to her household. She is requesting a loan to stock up on charcoal during the dry season and sell it during the rainy season. The profit will be used for the education of her children and the upkeep of her home.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.en:
The funds obtained by this group are invested in small businesses owned by each one of its members. All of the group members invest according to the needs that they have in their business ventures. The women, dedicated to their sales, invest in the purchase of goods such as fruits, vegetables, rice, coal, etc.     

Graciela M. B. – sale of foodstuffs 
Melody Caballero – sale of general goods 
Sonia A. – sale of vegetables 
María O. – sale of fruits 
Elizabeth N. – domestic employment
Felicita B.  – small convenience store 
Rosa V. – small grocery store
Maria A. – small grocery store
Maria E. – fruit sales 
Liz C. – fruit sales 
Maria L.  – coal sales 
Mercedes G. – convenience store 
Iluminada L. – fruit sales 
Silvia O. – sale of meats and sausages 
Domiciana A. – sale of coal and meats

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys G. is the mother of two children, both boys, who are currently in the senior high and the primary schools. She is thirty-six years old and divorced. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Gladys is a food vendor. She fries and sells doughnuts in her community. She supplies other retailers and sells the rest by hawking (selling door-to-door). She buys bags of flour from nearby towns.

Gladys has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients such as cooking oil, sugar, etc. in bulk. She desires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Ngideka

texts.en:
C. is 32 years old and married with a child. She sells wine, canned drinks and she rents DVDs and VCDs in her shop. She acquired the skill from her mother and she has been in the business for the past seven years.

C. hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more wine, canned drinks and DVDs to sell and rent. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more wine, canned drinks and DVDs to sell and rent

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de friperie, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2000 et s’approvisionne au marché local de hedzranawoé.elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, pour les satisfaire tous elle doit augmenter son stock alors elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  3 ballots de friperie.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns revenues from commerce in second-hand clothing, sheets, and the like. She has been in this business since 2000 and acquires her supplies at the local market of Hedzranawoé. She operates door-to-door. Her customers grow in number day after day. To satisfy them all, she must increase her inventory. She is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy three bales of used clothing. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Gilda Tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes de barrio, el esposo es chofer asalariado; estas actividades constituyen su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la Zona Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería para la tienda y de esa forma podrá surtir, ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos para la venta a sus clientes.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Gilda has a small neighborhood grocery store and her husband works as a salaried driver. These jobs provide their main source of income to support their three children. They rent in the Ballivián district in the city of El Alto. Gilda plans to use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her store so she can offer her customers a wider selection of products. This will be her first loan with Impro and our evaluation confirms that she qualifies to borrow the funds.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Dalila Maruja

texts.es:
La señora DALILA MARUJA  R. M., tiene 36 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LOS JAZMINES
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  2 hijos quienes  dependen económicamente de ella, porque aun se encuentran en el colegio.
DALILA se dedica a la preparación y venta de menús (alimentos) a los obreros (personal) de una fábrica de Trujillo
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de insumos alimenticios como; arroz, azucar, aceite, huevos, papas,etc 
Este crédito de 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas insumos alimenticios como azúcar, fideos, huevos, papas, verduras, etc para preparar su menú.
DALILA, sueña con tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalila is 36 years old. She lives in the Moche district, in the province of Trujillo, in Libertad, Peru. She belongs to “Los Jazmines” community bank. This businesswoman has completed the fifth year of her secondary studies. She has two children that depend on her economically because they are still in high school. Dalila prepares and sells meals (food) to the workers (personnel) in a factory in Trujillo. Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to buy food supplies such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, potatoes, etc. This loan, for 500 new soles, will be used to buy more food supplies such as sugar, noodles, eggs, potatoes, vegetables, etc. that will be used to make her meals. Dalila hopes to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more food supplies like sugar, noodles, eggs, potatoes, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Maula

texts.en:
Maula M. is an entrepreneurial Tanzanian business woman. She is married and runs a food shop business at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases and sells a variety of food products to retail customers. Business goods are purchased in wholesale from the shops and marketed at Kariakoo trading city center.

She has been running the business for four years and uses the income to fulfill her daily family demands and for business capitalization. She would appreciate a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more food products to resell to her customers.

loans.use: Buy more food products to resell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene R., who is 47 years old. She lives in Pasay City. Her husband, Nelson, 45, is a house painter. They have three children.

Arlene is a multi-tasking businesswoman. She has a general store in front of her house. She also sells frozen meat products. She also converted a few rooms in her house as apartments for rent. She earns nearly 25,000 PHP a month from these business activities. Her profits are used to support her family’s daily needs. She is also sending her grandchildren to school.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004.  Having been a member has brought her many blessings.  Through the loans from the cooperative and combined with her savings from her profits, she acquired a residential lot which is now continuously amortizing. Her next project would be to build a house for her family and leave their current house for rent. Arlene applied for a new loan from the Cooperative in the amount of 18,000 PHP.  She will use the funds to renovate her apartment.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Renovation of apartment units

loans.name: Señor  De Mayo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado SEÑOR DE MAYO  está conformado por trece personas de edades variadas que oscilan desde los 20 a los 60 años. La presidenta de la banca la Sra. Patricia es una persona de carácter fuerte y proactiva que tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solo una está en colegio, La Sra. Alisan  secretaria de la banca en una persona tranquila pero proactiva que en conjunto con sus vecinos forman parte de la banca, el Sr. Rene es una persona con carácter muy alegre y colaborador, las otras personas que conforman la banca son de personalidades similares. La presidenta administra un pequeño local de juegos electrónicos mismos establecidos en su domicilio,  la secretaria se dedica  a la venta de productos lácteos  en la feria de la zona otra parte también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a pedido, otra parte de los socios se dedican a conducción de vehículos de transporte público, otro de los socios se dedica a la administración de un pequeño café Internet, otro de los socios a la  venta de celulares. Si bien dentro de los lugares donde se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia de  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se  desarrollaban en el lugar no se vean afectadas por lo contrario muchas de las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito.  Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición de  repuestos y mantenimiento  para sus equipos otros para  el incremento de mercadería, otras para la compra de materiales de construcción  para el ampliado de sus pequeños locales y dar mejor atención a sus clientes. Este grupo se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo, por lo cual  la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia de trabajo en esta modalidad de crédito.

loans.use: COMPRAS DE MERCADERIA  Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: The Project Group

texts.es:
Alexandra Yuliza L. P., María Auxiliadora L. G. y Margarita Elizabeth M. Rodríguez formaron el Grupo el Proyectos, porque eso eran sus negocios proyectos de vida.

La joven L. P. de 28 años tiene una Fritanga que es un tipo de restaurante popular en la que se vende cosas fritas como carne asada, enchiladas tajadas con queso…etc. María Auxiliadora L. G. desde hace diez años tiene una pulpería y Margarita Elizabeth M. Rodríguez hace ocho años empezó a vender cerdo.
texts.en:
Alexandra Yuliza L. P., María Auxiliadora L. G. and Margarita Elizabeth M. Rodríguez are the members of the Project Group. They are aptly named because their businesses are their “life projects”.

Alexandra is 28 years old and manages a snack bar where she sell items such as roasted meats, enchiladas, fried plantains with cheese, etc. María has been operating a grocery store for 10 years. Margarita sells pork and has been in business for 8 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Delvy Marina

texts.es:
la sra. Delvi Marina E. tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la comunidad de Jicaro Galan municipio de Nacaome Valle, tiene 24 años años de vivir en ese lugar.
Delvi se dedica a la venta de ropa, lociones y mariscos, esta actividad la realiza en su comunidad y en aldeas cercanas, sus hijos les ayudan a cargar su mercaderia despues de horarios de escuela. 
su deseo es tener su propio local en el mercado municipal de Nacaome o San Lorenzo
Delvi quiere enseñar a sus hijos el negocio y que ellos puedan salir adelante en un futuro.
ahorita desea invertir en ropa ya que se hacerla la epoca de navidad y en estos dias las ventas son muy buenas, quiere comprar ropa de dama, caballero y niños al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Delvi Marina E. is 42 years old. She is a single mother of two children; she has lived for 24 years in the community of Jicaro Galan in the municipality of Nacaome, Valle. Delvi works selling clothing, lotions, and seafood. She works in her town and in nearby villages. Her children help her carry her merchandise after school. Her wish is to have her own store in the market of Nacaome or San Lorenzo. Delvi wants to teach her children the business so that they can continue to improve their quality of life in the future. Now she wants to invest in the purchase of clothing because it will soon be Christmas time because it is the season with the highest sales. She wants to buy wholesale clothing for women, men, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Mrs. Belen T. is 36 years old. She sells fish, shrimp, and crabs. She’s been in this business for 5 years, starting with capital of PHP 2,000.00. Now she earns an average amount of PHP 5,000.00 per month. Mr. Joel T., her husband, also earns PHP 7,800.00 monthly from his salary as a survey aide for the Ozamiz City local government. They have four school-age children and they reside in San Apolnario, Tangub City. 

Just this year, Mrs. Belen T. joined PAGLAUM MPC. She has no previous loans. With the growth of her loyal customers and market demands, she needs additional capital for her existing fish, crab and shrimp retailing business. She is applying for a first loan of  PHP 20,000.00 to add to her business capital. She will use the profit from this loan for her family's basic needs and for future savings. She is planning to expand her business market in the future.

loans.use: Additional capital for her shrimp, crab, and fish business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 30 años y muchas ganas de salir adelante; él vive en la tranquilidad de su hogar junto a su esposa (Reyna), de 23 años. Por ahora no tienen hijos, pero esperan en el futuro convertirse en padres.

Este hombre trabajador se dedica al cultivo de café y plátano en sus amplias chacras desde hace dos años, además se dedica paralelamente a trabajar como obrero para otras personas, ya que también éste es un trabajo muy rentable, sobretodo en época de cosecha que faltan manos para recoger los frutos frescos que brinda esta zona del Perú.
A Edgar le gusta cosechar sus tierras y también en las ajenas porque con las ganancias que obtiene puede comprar algunas cosas para empezar a formar su hogar, además para el futuro piensa ampliar su chacra y sembrar café en mayor cantidad para convertirse en el mejor productor de la zona, pues él piensa que “no importa la profesión o el oficio que puedan tener los hombres, lo importante es que lleguen a ser los mejores en el rubro que se desempeñan”. 
Así transcurren los días de Edgar, quien cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y así se dan fuerzas mutuamente para salir adelante y concretar todos los planes que tiene para el futuro.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable en los pagos, además está muy contento con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque está compuesto por personas conocidas y trabajadoras como él. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono y plantas de café para empezar el proyecto de sembrar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Edgar is 30 years old and eager to get ahead. He lives peacefully at home with wife Reyna, who is 23. The do not have any children at the moment, but they hope to become parents in the future.

This hardworking gentleman has been growing coffee and bananas in his wide-open fields for the past two years. At the same time, he works for other people as a field laborer. He considers this type of work to be very profitable, especially around harvest time when he lacks the help to pick fresh fruit to supply this region of Peru.

Edgar enjoys working both on his land and in other people’s fields because, with his earnings, he is able to buy a few things to begin construction of his home as well as pursue future plans to expand his farm and plant more coffee. He plans to become the best producer in the area. Edgar believes, “It doesn’t matter what profession or occupation you have. What matters is that you become the best in the field of work that you choose.” Edgar keeps his days busy and is helped by his wife. They provide strength for one another and encourage each other to succeed and fulfill their plans for the future.

This is his first loan with MFP. He promises to be responsible with his payments. Edgar is very happy with the other members of his Communal Bank because they are well-known and hard workers just like him. With the money he requested, Edgar will buy compost and coffee plants for starting a project to grow these crops in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & coffee plants

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji A. is currently in the business of selling pots in a market and is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use to make more pots to sell.  Keji is 40 years old. She is married and her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to use and make more pots to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys del Socorro G., Labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y  este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento y arena, para la construcción de un un muro en la parte delantera de su vivienda. 

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Gladys dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Gladys del Socorro G. works as the caretaker at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua Institute. She is married and has one child in her care, who is of school-age. She has worked with Ceprodel loans for 3 years, and during this time has invested the 3 loans granted by Ceprodel in the improvement of her house. The loan she is seeking is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as stone, cement and sand, for the construction of a wall at the front part of her house - with the objective of giving more security and a better standard of living to her children. Gladys said thank you for the loans granted by Ceprodel, that have allowed her to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Perina

texts.en: Perina B. is currently in the business of selling maize at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize to sell. Perina is 40 years old and is married to a carpenter. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor Jose C. es trabajador de la universidad UNAN en Esteli trabajando como guarda de seguridad.
Jose va usar este crédito para la compra de una motocicleta quiere que con su moto pueda transportarse al trabajo.
Jose es casado y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Este es el segundo crédito con Ceprodel ha trabajado por dos años con Ceprodel.
Jose dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han sido de mucha importancia ya que ha pagado deuda y ha comprado algunas cosas para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose C. works in the UNAN University in Esteli, working as a security guard.

Jose will use the loan to buy a motorcycle and hopes that with it he will be able to travel to and from work.

Jose is married and has 2 children under his care. This is his second loan with Ceprodel (Kiva’s field partner) he has worked for two years with the institution.

Jose says that his loans with Ceprodel have been very important since he paid his debt and has bought some things for his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YANAPAY”, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúne cada treinta días en el distrito de Wanchaq en el local de Asociación Arariwa. La palabra quechua “Yanapay” traducido al castellano significa “Ayuda”.  

Francisca tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos (Rai, Larry, Mario y Alison), ella vende quesos en el mercado “Molino II” y hace 19 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, la socia antes vendía de manera ambulatoria y ahora con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio tiene su propio stand. Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar más quesos, aceitunas, huevos y quesos, ella hace un año que es socia de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia en general agradece la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the "Yanapay" (Quechua for "Help") Community Bank and lives in the city of Cusco. She meets every month with Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa at its site in the district of Wanchaq. Francisca is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has four children (Rai, Larry, Mario and Alison). She has sold cheeses at the Molino II market for the past 19 years, and it has gone very well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She previously sold her products as street vendor but now with a lot of hard work and sacrifice she has her own stand. Francisca is requesting the loan to purchase more cheeses, olives and eggs. She has been a member of Asociación Arariwa for one year and is grateful for the opportunity it provides. She promises to fulfill her payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheeses, olives and eggs

loans.name: Levy Abdiel

texts.es: Levy de 32 años de edad es casado, trabaja como docente de primaria desde hace 8 años  en la Escuela Paulino Halsall de Nueva Guinea, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos: el mayor de 9 y el menor de 1 añito de edad, su esposa tambien labora como docente en la misma escuela, por la mañana y por la tarde. Levy gracias a los creditos que ha recibido de AFODENIC y con muchos sacrificios ha logrado tener su propia casa y desea mejorarla, por lo que está solicitando su 4to credito  para hacer la division a 2 habitaciones  asi contar con mayor comodidad y privacidad, ya que su hijo esta creciendo y desea su propio espacio. Este es  el segundo crèdito que solicita para mejoras de su casa y gracias al fondo kiva con el credito anterior logro satisfactoriamente cambiarle el zinc a la vivienda que se encontraba en mal estado , ellos son una familia que sueñan un porvenir mejor para sus dos hijos, desean que estudien para que sean personas de bien y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Levy is 32 years old and married. He has worked as a primary school teacher at the Paulino Halsall School of New Guinea for eight years. He lives with his wife and their two children. The oldest is nine, and the youngest is one. His wife also works as a teacher in the same school in the mornings and in the afternoons. Thanks to the loans received from Afodenic and with much sacrifice, Levy has been able to have his own house. He wants to improve it. That is why he is requesting his fourth loan in order to partition two rooms. That way they will be more comfortable and have more privacy. His son is growing and wants his own space. This is the second loan he has requested to make improvements on the house. Thanks to Kiva funds with the previous loan, he was able to satisfactorily change the zinc on the house, which was in bad shape. They are a family that dreams of a better future for their two children. They want them to go to school in order to become good people and good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partition two rooms

loans.name: Tamaraneh Iii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Tamaraneh III group. They are small-scale businesswomen from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come together as a group of three in order to seek a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, this group of entrepreneurs will be able to improve their businesses and consequently their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Isatu T.. Isatu is thirty-two years old. She was born in Makeni, is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school – one in secondary school and two in primary school. Isatu has been selling cosmetics and jewelry for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will improve her business by buying jewelry and Vaseline wholesale.

loans.use: To improve her business by buying costume jewelry and Vaseline wholesale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 46 years old and widowed with three children aged 25, 22, and 19.   She sells cereals and legumes, retail and wholesale, in an open-air market to earn a living. She also practices farming and green grocery businesses to earn extra income.  She has an experience of ten years in the business.   

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Cecilia's lifestyle has improved because she can access loans.  She saves her money on a weekly basis with her group under Faulu Kenya which guarantees members' loans.  She has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of maize, beans and other types of cereals.  She hopes to open a store and a posho (maize meal) mill in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of cereals

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida L. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Zenaida is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida raises livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Zenaida has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services so she could improve her living situation. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP that she will use to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to allow their Field Partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Mohammad Tarek

texts.en:
Mohammad Tarek is a 21-year-old single man living in Lebanon. He has experience in selling and maintaining tires since 2005. He sells and repairs mainly truck tires and rims and his clients are mainly truck companies.

Today, for the first time, Mohammad Tarek has requested a loan to purchase a machine for tire maintenance. This machine will allow him to improve his work. He hopes that he will continue to improve and expand his work.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for tire maintenance

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday E. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to sell. Sunday is 42 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 5 children and all five attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wholesale staple grains (rice, cooking oil, beans)

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es:
Don Ovidio tiene 67 años, es casado vive con su hijo y esposa en su casa propia, el tiene mucha expereincia en el aspecto comercial ya que desde muy pequeño se inicio vendiendo ropa usada.
Don Ovidio vive en una comunidad muy grande, es sueño de don Ovidio es tener una empresa de costuras y manejar su propio capital. El tiene un local de rpa usada en el cual tiene 3 años de estar y también tiene 3 lineas de taxi, Don Ovidio solicita un crédito para poder incrementar su mercaderia y ofrecer nuevas cosas en su tienda de ropa usada, el lugar donde se ubica el local de don Ovidio no tiene mucha competencia y gracias a esto los ingresos son mucho mayores.
texts.en:
Don Ovidio is 67 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son in their own home. He has a great deal of business experience because he began to sell used clothing when he was very young. Don Ovidio lives in a very large community. His dream is to have a business that makes clothing and to manage his own capital. He has been selling used clothing from his current store for three years. He also has three taxis. Don Ovidio requests a loan to increase inventory and offer new items at his store. Because he does not have much competition near his store, his income is much higher than it might be.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply his store with more merchandise

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio, de 46 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposa Celia (40) y sus  3 jóvenes hijos, juntos trabajan para salir adelante. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura; siembra arveja, papa y maíz en sus tierras que compró gracias a varios años de constante esfuerzo en su trabajo. Dice que trabaja a lado de toda su familia, y que le gusta esta labor porque es tranquila y aunque es algo sacrificado madrugar todos los días para vigilar sus cultivos, la recompensa a su esfuerzo, es recoger una productiva cosecha, que vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad a buenos precios. Lo que no le gusta de su trabajo es que debe trasladar todos sus productos para venderlos, hasta la ciudad, porque es bastante cansado. Como quiere continuar progresando para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de comprar algunas cabezas de reses para criarlas y luego venderlas a mayor precio. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, también dice que el trabajo con su grupo comunal es bastante organizado, porque los miembros de su grupo son personas responsables y puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar sus tierras, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Celia (40 years old) and his three young sons. They are working together to get ahead. Since he was very young, Eusebio has worked in agriculture, planting peas, potatoes and corn on the land that he bought thanks to many years of constant effort in his job. He says that he works alongside his family and that he likes this work because it is peaceful. Although it is a sacrifice to get up at dawn every day to care for his crops, the reward for his effort is a productive harvest that he sells at the largest market in his city for good prices. What he doesn't like about his job is that he must transport all his products to the city in order to sell them, because it is very tiring. Since he wants to continue his progress for the future, he is planning to plant greater quantities of crops and also to buy a few head of cattle to raise and then sell them at a higher price. This is his 7th loan with MFP and he is very grateful to all the people that made this credit possible because it allowed him to continue working. He also says that the work with his community group is very organized, because the members of the group are responsible people, and punctual in their loan repayments. With the loan he has requested, he will buy the manure and fertilizer that he needs to improve his soil and hopes to continue his progress this way.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 20 años es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Michael de 30 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Marcelina se dedica, es el cultivo de plátano y café. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, pues sabe que así obtendrá las ganancias suficientes de la venta de su cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus frutos por que recibe la recompensa de tanto esfuerzo que dio sobre sus plantaciones.
