En adelante, desea extender sus cultivos, de esa manera incrementará su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que el crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes, para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 20 years old. She is a very happy and unpretentious young woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband Michael, 30 years old, and their two beloved children, to whom she strives to provide a better quality of life. Marcelina's work is cultivating bananas and coffee. Every day since very early in the morning she works in her fields, knowing this is the way to obtain the best earnings for her harvest. What she likes best about her work is harvest the fruits of her labor, receiving her rewards for all the efforts she invested in her fields. In the future she hopes to have more land, to increase her yield. This is her third loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She indicates that this loan will help her a great deal in the progress of her business. She is very well liked in her community bank group, being very close to them. The one thousand five hundred nuevos soles she requests will be used to purchase fertilizers to improve the productivity of the harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Rowena Agustin's Group

texts.en:
Rowena A. is from the village of Amobocan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Rowena is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Rowena joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a stallion and two calves.

loans.name: Leon Isaias

texts.es:
León de 54 años, el tiene un taller de ebanistería tiene cinco hijos con su esposa, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. 

Antes de ser ebanista y de tener su propio negocio el fue albañil de la ciudad de Guayaquil en uno de sus trabajos lo contrataron para hacer muebles, comenzó a gustarle esta profesión cuando hizo solo su primer mueble. Cuando fue con su familia a playas para vivir decidió que tendría su taller de muebles en la parte delantera de su casa. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido trabajar con ayuda de sus hijos y unos amigos. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. El hace todo tipo de muebles como closet, puertas, juegos de sala, ventanas de madera etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar madera para tener oportunidades de hacer mas muebles para los contratos que hace con compañías. En el futuro quiere construir una casa para que viva toda su familia e incrementar su taller de madera en otra local.
texts.en:
León is 54 years old and has a cabinetmaking workshop. He has five children with his wife, and lives in a canton called Playas, one of the touristic areas of Ecuador famous for seafood.

Before becoming a cabinetmaker and having his own business, he was a mason for the city of Guayaquil. On one of his jobs, he was contracted to make furniture, and he began to like the profession when he made his first piece by himself. When he and his family moved to Playas, he decided that he would have a furniture workshop in the back of his house. Little by little with effort he was able to work with the help of his children and some friends. He works from 7am to 6pm every day. He makes all types of furniture, like closets, doors, living room furniture, wooden windows, etc.

With this loan, he wants to buy wood in order to make furniture for contracts he has with companies. In the future he wants to build a house for his whole family to live in and to expand his woodshop in another location.

loans.use: Wood

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 48 años, es vendedora de productos de uso personal herbalife y Avon ( empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras a vender cosméticos a un bajo costo). Vive con sus tres hijos y esposo en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado).    

Hace 4 años atrás comenzó con las ventas de productos de uso personas Avon. Debido a su salud tubo que comenzar a tomar productos Herbalife por lo buenos resultados que le dieron a su cuerpo decidió no solo vender Avon sino combinarlo con productos herbalife. En la actualidad es vendedora de Avon y herbalife trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta que pueda vender los productos en stop. Vende te-batidos, perfumes, cremas, etc.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos herbalife, perfumes, cremas para tener un volumen de ventas mejorado. En el futuro quiere comprar un terreno para construir su casa y tener cuartos de alquiler.
texts.en:
María, age 48, sells personal products manufactured by Herbalife and Avon (a company that helps women entrepreneurs sell cosmetics at a low cost). She lives with her husband and three children along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil, a periurban area surrounded by a salt marsh.

Four years ago, María began selling personal products as an Avon salesperson. Due to health problems, she began taking Herbalife products and achieved good results that made her feel better. She decided to combine her business by adding Herbalife products to the merchandise she sells. María currently works from 8am until she is able to stop selling her products. She sells powdered shakes, perfumes, crèmes, and other items.

With this loan, María wants to buy Herbalife products, perfumes, and crèmes so that she can increase her volume of merchandise and improve her sales. In the future, she wants to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house and have rooms available for rent.

loans.use: Purchase Herbalife & Avon products to sell

loans.name: Tazara Maganga Group

texts.en:
Happiness M. is in her mid-twenties, and married with two children.  Since 2009, she has been selling vitenge (cloth), kangas (sarongs), and fruit door-to-door.  She works from 10 am to 5 pm daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $40.  

This will be Happiness' second loan with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loan to purchase bananas, mangoes, pineapple, vitenge and kangas.  It is her dream to one day open a food shop.  Happiness will share her loan with her group, Tazara Maganga, which has 24 members.  The members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  

In the photo, Happiness can be seen in the front row, holding a child and wearing a yellow dress.

loans.use: To purchase vitenge, kangas, and fruit for resale

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 35 años, tiene una tienda de víveres. Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Cuando tenía 14 años María empezó a vender confiterías para poder pagar sus estudios ya que ha su corta edad no tenia su familia muchos recursos para estudiar. Desde ese tiempo pudo reunir dinero y tener su propia tienda pero cuando estuvo embarazada tuvo problemas de salud y tuvo que cerrar la tienda por un tiempo ya que era muy riesgoso tener a su bebe. Pero ahora debido a la estabilidad económica que tenía lo abrió de nuevo y lo surtió con más víveres. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm y en ocasiones su papa le ayuda a tender el negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, enlatados para poder surtir más su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener un local grande y que sus hijos estudien en un buen colegio
texts.en:
Maria is 35-years-old.  She has a grocery store.  She lives in a region called Playas (Beaches), one of the touristy regions of Ecuador that has a lot of seafood.  

When she was 14-years-old, Maria started to sell sweets to be able to pay for her studies as at her young age her family didn’t have many resources to allow her to study.  Since that time, she has been able to save money and have her own store, but when she was pregnant she had health problems and had to close the store for some time as it was risky for her to have her baby.  But now, with more financial stability, she opened it again and stocked it with more groceries.  She works from 7AM to 9PM and sometimes her father helps her to attend to her business.

With the loan she would like to buy rice, oil, and canned goods to be able to stock the store better.  In the future she would like to have a large business space and for her children to study in a good school.

loans.use: Rice, oil, canned goods

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una mujer trabajadora, madre de cinco hijos, su negocio es la venta de tortillas y venta de cereales.
Pues ha sido su medio de lograr ingresos para dar la alimentación  a sus hijos. Lo cual vende todos los días en su casa de habitación. Es una mujer de recursos económicos muy pobre, pero se esfuerza por lograr mejoras a su casa también. Con este préstamo comprara materia prima como: maíz, cacao, semilla de jícaro, canela, clavo de olor y leña para hacer el cereal y palmear sus tortillas lo que espera vender mas.
texts.en: Josefa is a hard-working woman who has five children.  Her business is selling tortillas and cereal.  This is her way of earning income so that she can feed her children.  She sells her products from her home every day.  She is a woman of few economic means but she works hard to make improvements to her house as well.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients such as: corn, cacao, jícaro seeds (jícaro is a fruit native to Mexico and Central America), cinnamon, cloves and firewood for making her cereal and hand making her tortillas which she hopes to sell more of.

loans.use: To buy corn, cacao, cinnamon, cloves and firewood for making cereal and a larger quantity of tortillas

loans.name: Las Chicuelas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO SE ENCUENTRA LOCALIZADO EN MORELOS, ESTADO D. MÉXICO.EL GRUPO SE LLAMA LAS CHICUELAS PORQUE SUS INTEGRANTES EN SU MAYORÍA SON MUJERES JÓVENES.LA SEÑORA MARÍA MAGDALENA N. TIENE 34 AÑOS D. EDAD Y TIENE TRES HIJOS (10, 8 Y 2 AÑOS). ELLA Y SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA D. ABARROTES, POR LO QUE EL CRÉDITO LO HAN SOLICITADO PARA LA COMPRA D. MERCANCÍA PARA HACER CRECER MÁS SU TIENDA,  COMPRAR  MERCANCÍA AL MAYOREO Y OFRECER PRODUCTOS SURTIDOS, LOGRANDO TENER UNA MAYOR VARIEDAD D. ARTÍCULOS D. ABARROTES, LO CUAL SE VERÁ REFLEJADO EN SUS VENTAS Y EN SUS INGRESOS CON LO CUAL PODRÁN HECERLE MEJORAS A SU CASA  Y ASÍ OFRECERLE UNA MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en: The group is located in Morelos in the state of Mexico and is called Las Chicuelas ["The Little Kids"] because the majority of its members are young women.  María Magdalena N. is 34 years old and has 3 children (10, 8, and 2 years old).  She and her husband sell groceries and are requesting this loan to buy merchandise at wholesale to supply their store and help grow their business.  They would like to buy assorted products, allowing them to have a greater variety of groceries, which will be reflected in their sales and income.  With increased income they will be able to make improvements on their home and improve the quality of life of their children.

loans.use: To buy assorted products to supply their grocery store

loans.name: Libia Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. Libia O. es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el sector de María Auxiliadora en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad cuenta con la belleza de sus paisajes que se mezclan entre lo colonial y lo moderno, sus 4 ríos que la bañan hacen de esta una ciudad única, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
Doña Libia tiene 61 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos que son mayores de edad,  tres de ellos son casados viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan en la economía de su hogar. Su esposo labora como empleado privado en una fábrica, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Libia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar pero en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado, etc., recorrer la ciudad vendiendo sus productos hace 7 años, labora de lunes a sábados.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 12 años tiempo el cual los créditos le han permitido crecer poco a poco en su negocio, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa y calzado. Su meta es seguir trabajando y crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en: Libia O. is a member of Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) community bank and lives in the María Auxiliadora sector of the city of Cuenca. It is a city known for its beautiful scenery, its mixture of colonial and modern traits, its four rivers that make it unique, and its gastronomy that captivates locals and foreigners alike. Libia is 61 years old, married and has five adult children, three who are married and live on their own and two who are single and work and help with household expenses. Her husband works as a private employee in a factory. They do not have their own home so they rent. Libia dedicates herself to taking care of the house but in her free time she makes a living selling clothing, footwear, etc. She has traveled the city selling her products for the past seven years, working from Monday through Saturday. She has belonged to her community bank for 12 years, and the loans have helped her grow her business little by little. She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of more clothing and footwear. Her goal is to keep working and grow her business even more.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and footwear

loans.name: Edin Eduardo

texts.es: Edin es un joven de 21 años de edad, originario de Totonicapán , es soltero,  estudiante de diversificado, además de seguir creciendo profesionalmente ejerce el trabajo de albañil y así también se dedica al comercio, el esta solicitando un tercer préstamo en Asociación ASDIR ya que desea seguir invirtiendo su dinero en compra de herramientas, sus creditos anteriores los ha cancelado sin problemas de atraso, es una persona responsable y cumplida el cuenta  con el apoyo de su familia ya que tiene  10 años de experiencia  y desea seguir incrementado su negocio y asi poder cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Edin is a young man, 21 years of age, originally from Totonicapan. He is single and he is a student taking many subjects. He also endeavors to keep growing professionally as a construction working and as a merchant. He requests his third loan from Asociacion ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner) in order to invest in the purchase of tools. His previous loans were successfully repaid. He is a responsible and committed individual and he has the support of his family. He has 10 years’ experience in the field and he wishes to keep increasing his business and to reach his goals.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Adith

texts.es:
La Sra. Adith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Proceres”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 62 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos ya independientes.

La necesidad D. sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella deciD. iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. animales vivos (Cuyes, conejos y gallinas), criadas en su propia casa. Con su primer crédito  D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles fue implementando poco a poco un local, para la crianza D. sus animales,  posteriormente fue comprando sus animales, estos reproducieron y fueron aumentando mensualmente. Ahora es muy conocida por sus clientes y conocen el negocio que realiza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará, huevos para hacer poner a sus gallinas, alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres D. cualquier enfermedad.

Adith, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, para alimentar a sus animales, cree que vale el sacrificio que está haciendo día a día. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  muchas mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Adith belongs to the “Los Proceres” community bank, Tarapoto district, San Martin province, department of San Martín. She is married, 62 years old and the mother of 5 children, all on their own. 

Due to the need to get her children ahead and thanks to her enterprising spirit and energy, she decided to open her own business selling live animals (guinea pigs, rabbits and hens) raised in her own home. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles she outfitted her locale to raise animals little by little. The animals reproduced and grew every month. Now she is very well known to her customers and they know her business.  

With this loan of S/1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy eggs to make her hens lay, and balanced feed and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and free of disease.  

Adith is very satisfied with the job she does, despite the work being hard and having to get up early to feed her animals. She believes that the sacrifice she is making day to day is worth it.  She is also grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering support to her and to many women who want to get ahead.

loans.use: She will buy animals (guinea pigs, rabbits and hens)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing inventory for spring.

loans.name: Benito Martin

texts.es: Benito Martín se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, pues se desempeña en lo que más le gusta y todos los días se levanta temprano para comenzar su labor. El siempre se ha caracterizado por tener un buen carisma con sus clientes. Tiene más de 4 años en este negocio, él le enseña a su hijo a ganarse la vida y mantener el negocio activo que es el que les proporciona el alimento diario. El financiamiento es para la compra de naranjas, cebollas, tomates, naranjas, melones mangos entre otros.
texts.en:
Benito Martín is a fruit and vegetable vendor.  This isn’t his first loan request.  He works at what he most enjoys and every day he rises early to start his work.  He has always been characterized by having a good charisma with his customers.  He’s been in this business for over 4 years.  He teaches his son how to earn a living and keep the business, which provides for their daily bread, going.  

The loan will be used to buy oranges, onion, tomatoes, melons and mangoes, among others.

loans.use: To buy oranges, onions, tomatoes, melons and mangoes, among others.

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita C. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Luisita is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Luisita makes and sells food, including snacks and delicacies like suman and bibingka (two types of rice cake) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Luisita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. 

Luisita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the necessary raw ingredients like sticky rice, sugar and milk. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Luisita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve  and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like sticky rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Jose Beto

texts.es:
José tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero sin hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres quienes son comerciantes de venta de verduras. Viven en el distrito de La Victoria, a unos veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. La zona donde vive es rural en está en vías de crecimiento.

José se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros, para lo cual cuenta con una mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Realiza el servicio de transporte en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande y con bastante movimiento comercial. Con los ingresos de su negocio, José puede ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento económico de la familia. Solicita un préstamo para regularizar toda la documentación que necesita para su mototaxi y también hacerle unos arreglos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. José quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para crecerlo y un día conseguir una flota de mototaxis. Goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales manifestadas por sus vecinos. José es un cliente recurrente  para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado otros préstamos y los canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
José is 23 years old, single, with no children.  He lives in his parents’ house and they sell vegetables.  They live in the La Victoria district about 20 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region in northern Peru.  This is a rural zone, but is growing.

For the past five years, José has been providing transportation with his mototaxi, a vehicle consisting of a modified motorcycle with a passenger cabin added. He provides services from the Moshoqueque Market, a large market with lots of commercial movement.  This income allows José to help his parents financially.

He is asking for this loan to straighten out the documents that he needs for his mototaxi, and also to make some repairs on it.  He has seen fit to request a loan for 1,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.  José wants to continue investing in his business and some day to own a fleet of mototaxis.  He comes with good personal and professional references from his neighbors.  He is a recurring client of Edpyme Alternativa and has managed previous loans, repaying them on time.

loans.use: to make repairs to his mototaxi

loans.name: Bolasbai

texts.en: Bolasbai is 43 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His daughter, age 13, attends a local secondary school. Bolasbai manages a grocery business with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2003 and has since worked hard to provide goods and services that could be of great value to innumerable customers. Through his diligent work, he has built a strong customer base and made his grocery shop well-known. He has also managed to pay his daughter's education expenses. Bolasbai is an honest man who attributes his success to his good accounting skills. He says, "I want to own a big trading center one day." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 30 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Agnes requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Agnes has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activity.

In the future, Agnes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Veoun

texts.en:
Veoun, age 63, is married and resides with his wife and child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. 

He is engaged in a business as a motorbike repairman, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since Veoun has had this business. 

Veoun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase motorbike spare parts to resell and improve his business. This is his third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts to resell and improve the business.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is married and has four school-aged children. Joselito is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 20 years. 

Joselito is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow. Joselito hopes this loan will expand his operations. Currently, Joselito earns 35,000 PHP every harvest season. 

In the future, Joselito hopes to have bigger farmland to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yfenia is one of the members of the Group Dios Es Mi Pastor 1 & 2 (God is My Shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. Yfenia sells miscellaneous products in her business, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories. After her first loan with Esperanza, she expanded her business from clothing sales to many other products. 

After successfully repaying her previous loans and thus taking a step towards expanding her business, Yfenia is very excited to receive her second loan from Esperanza International. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in more of these products and get more clients for her business.  

She tells us that her challenge is to help her two children and husband to improve their lives by saving and bringing extra income to their household. She is planning to reinvest her profits in the business to make it bigger and sustainable. Her dream is to see all her children become professionals and good people.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothes, and accessories

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 53 years old and married. He has only one child. He really works hard to be able to provide for the needs of his family and to become successful in his business.

Wilfredo grows rice, which he has been doing for 33 years. According to him, he is able to earn about PHP30,000 every crop harvest. The profit he generates from his business is not enough. He is asking for additional capital of PHP25,000, which will be used for the maintenance of his rice farm. He will purchase supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides. Some amounts will be used for the payment of the laborers on the farm. He is hoping that he could avail this loan amount so that he can sustain the needs of his family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay for the laborer in the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de piñatería, el vende artículos para fiestas infantiles como piñatas, vasos, platos entre otros artículos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de piñatería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artículos como piñatas, platos, globos y velas para las fiestas de cumpleaños.
                                                                                                                                                                     
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank which is located in Urubamba District that belongs to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.


The member is 42 years old, married and has two children.  He alternates his daily chores with a piñata business.  He sells children’s party supplies like piñatas, glasses and dishes, among other items.  He works from 8am until 6pm and is able to support his children through this business. 

He wants to expand the piñata business and needs a loan to buy such items as piñatas, plates, balloons and candles for birthday parties.                                                                                                                                                                   

                                                                                                                                                                     
He is happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy party supplies.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en: Emerenciana is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for the restaurant she has run for eight years. She earns additiional income from motorcycle transport. Emerenciana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Esnang

texts.en:
Esnang is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying & selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her buying & selling of dried fish business.

Esnang has been in this business for six years. Esnang earns more income from food vending.

Esnang has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Haydee Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una mujer trabajadora y que le ha gustado sacar adelante a su familia. Desde hace mas de 42 años que tiene este negocio como es la venta de producto lácteos. A pesar de tener la edad de 66 años, ella ha sabido mantener el negocio y por medio de él ha podido brindarles a sus hijos el alimento diario. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de leche, cuajada, crema, queso, leche agria para realizar la elaboración de estos productos que son derivados de la leche.
texts.en:
Francisca is a hard-working woman who has enjoyed getting her family ahead. For over 42 years she has had her business selling dairy products.
Despite being 66 years old, she has been able to maintain her business and through it offer her children their daily bread. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of milk, curds, cream, cheese, and buttermilk for making dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase milk, curds, cream, cheese, and buttermilk.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old, married, and has two children. 

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell. 

Teresita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from frozen foods. 

Teresita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory to sell

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba desde hace unos años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa cerca de la plaza de Mercado del municipio de Rionegro, ella con su negocio se sostiene económicamente ya que su esposo la dejo ya hace un tiempo.

Ella quiete tener mas surtido en su negocios para poder tener mas clientes y ofrecerles mejor variedad, además al incrementar sus ventas su calidad de vida mejorará notablemente.
texts.en:
Alba has had a business of selling clothing for some years near the market plaza in Rionegro.  She supports herself with this business since her husband left her some time ago.

She would like to have a larger selection in her business to have more customers and to be able to offer them a greater variety. Also with the increase in sales her quality of life would improve measurably.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
At her age of 58, Milagros still works hard to generate an income. She has been a widow for 23 years now. She had four children. Unfortunately, all her children finished only their secondary education and were not given an opportunity to enter into college due to the financial burden. They are now working as farmers and sometimes help her financially. 

Milagros raises hogs to fatten. She has been doing it for almost five years. She is now borrowing a loan of P8,000 to buy hog feed and vaccines in order to make her business more profitable.

In the future, Milagros would like to construct a more convenient pigpen for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 25-years-old, married and now blessed with two children. She was not given an opportunity to enter into college and have employment so she entered into an early marriage. 

To generate an income, her spouse works as a local farmer and she also operates a retail business in the village where her family lives. Each month the couple earns an income of P6,000 and use it for their electric bills, vitamins for her children and for their daily meals. 

She is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugars, milk and coffee to sell in her store. She wants to sell more items in her store to acquire more profit from it.

In the future, she wants to make her small store grow into bigger one and someday improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugars, milk and coffee to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
Sreyoun, 33 years old, sells groceries and gas in front of her house, and earns $2 per day. Her husband sells salt and earns $3 per day. They have three childrE., two are studying and one more is too small to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $83 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $3 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy salt to sell. She wants to opE. a grocery store in front of her home bigger than the one she has now, and will sell more kinds of grocery goods so that she can make better income.

loans.use: To buy salt to sell

loans.name: Latafat

texts.en:
Latafat is a 36 years old woman who has bred sheep for the last 5 years.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who lives in Bilasuvar, a IDP settlement with her husband and three children. 

Her monthly income from selling sheep is about 150 AZN.  It is their family's primarily source of income.  Her husband actively helps Latafat look after the sheep. 

Now she would like to expand her activities and purchase one milk cow.  She applied for 700 AZN loan to do that.  

Latafat has already demonstrated herself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to expand her activity and purchase one milk cow.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is a 52 year old widowed woman. She has 5 children between the ages of 24 and 40. She describes herself as a welcoming and hardworking woman. She operates a store where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in Changamwe, a suburb of Mombasa, and she has both new and returning customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chicken.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La socia Dominga se sigue dedicando al negocio D. venta D. fruta como manzanas,platanos,naranjas y uvas y negocio D. venta D. carne,ella lleva a lugares como Paruro,ella trabaja independientemente,por medio D. este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. fruta y negocio D. venta D. carne.La socia solicita el credito para comprar manzanas,naranjas,uva y platanos al por mayor y tambien para comprar carne al por mayor.
texts.en:
Dominga is still in the business of selling fruit such as apples, bananas, oranges, and grapes and a meat sales business. She sells in places such as Paruro. She works alone and through this business she provides for her children. 

She wants to expand and improve the business of selling fruit and her meat sales business. She is asking for a loan to buy apples, oranges, grapes and bananas at wholesale and also to buy meat in bulk.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, grapes and bananas at wholesale prices and also to buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en: Vardanush works as a teacher at the local school and as a governess at the local kindergarden. To insure better living standards for her family, Vardanush is also engaged in agriculture. She lives with her husband, who helps her run the farm. She has applied for a loan to increase the number of cattle. Vardanush will develop her farm and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for cattle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 41-year-old businessman. He is married to Judy, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with four children. He has been selling scrap metals for the past 20 years. He uses his monthly income of KES 15,000 to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET, Ltd. after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy more scrap metals for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams include opening a spare-parts shop, which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy more scrap metals for his business

loans.name: Mairamkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул 49 лет. В поисках источника финансирования, 20 лет назад Майрамкул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкул, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы и одна лошадь,  что позволяет получать прибыль около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майрамкул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Майрамкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья домашней скотины, а в будущем – купить машину для семьи.
texts.en:
Mairamkul is 49 years old. In search of a source of funding, Mairamkul started her business of animal husbandry 20 years ago, with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Mairamkul's hard work, her farm today has two dairy cows and one horse, which allows for a profit around 4,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk. 

For the further development of her business, Mairamkul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. The income from the loan, Mairamkul plans to invest in the further increase of the number of domestic animals, and in the future to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 38 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single and has three children between 9 months to 11 years old; they are in school except for the youngest one who is only 9 months old. For the past 4 years Rebecca has been selling cosmetics in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She started this business with money that she received from her uncle. Her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Anna who is in her early 30s is single with one daughter who is still small. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Anna's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her mamalishe stock and has managed to pay pack all her loans successfully. She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay for the shop and house rent and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy rice, beans, wheat flour, cooking oil and the small items missing from her food store. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Anna will share this loan with her loan group "Momela",  which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, wheat flour, cooking oil and the small items that are missing from  the food store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Sirakaru is a village that is famously known for producing the “creme de la creme” when it comes to athletics. It also has a lot of smallholder farmers who work the land and raise animals. 
Unfortunately, the people who do this farm work face many problems, like the high costs of the farm inputs. Rose has full knowledge of this but always finds a way to come through. 

Rose is from a remote village in the Sirakaru, Kitale area of Kenya and she is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her family. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize and vegetables and also keeping dairy cows. Rose has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Rose is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Rose believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Rose waits for your kindness.

Be inspired to loan to her today to keep her big smile!

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Sasho

texts.en:
Sasho S. lives in the village of Stambolovo which is 10 km. far from the small Bulgarian town Pavlikeni. Sasho’s only business is cattle breeding. He has two cows and a calf.

Sasho needs $ 1 000 to buy a new cow. This will increase his monthly income with 30 %. Callte breeding and milk selling is Sasho’s only source of income.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Dorila

texts.en:
In my neighborhood I am well known because I have sold food for many years, which are known in Honduras as "golosinas" (snacks), which are really fast-food types of food such as tacos, pastries, and french fries. I currently have many customers who buy my foods in the evening hours and since school has started again, many students who buy my food in the afternoons as well as the evenings, since my business is located near one of the school centers. With this activity I have been able to help my children with their studies and cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

En mi colonia soy bastante conocida ya que desde hace muchos años me dedico a vender comidas, en Honduras a este tipo de comida le llamamos golosinas que son comidas tipicas rapidas, como tacos de tortillas con pollo, pastelitos, papas fritas. Actualmente tengo bastantes clientes quienes por las noches me compran, ahora que iniciaron clases los estudiantes me compran por las tardes y en la noche, ya que mi negocio esta ubicado cerca de un centro de estudios. Con esta actividad he podido ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios, y apoyar en los gastos de mi casa.

loans.use: To sell pastries, french fries, tacos and other foods.

loans.name: Paskazia

texts.en: Paskazia lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. In her tailoring business, Paskazia makes and repairs both men's and women's clothes. She employs one assistant. With additional capital of $750, she can buy two sewing machines, employ another assistant, and buy other tailoring supplies. This expansion strategy will help her increase her income. One of her two sons is in secondary school and an increased income will help her pay for school fees and other associated costs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yaho

texts.en: Yaho K. A. is a 46 year old woman. She is married and has 9 children. Her husband is a retired mechanic worker. She has never been to school. She sells food-stuffs in order to be independent. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She started her career as a dressmaker, but due to some pain in her eyes, she was forced to stop. She would like to use the loan to buy more goods and increase her margin.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung (32) and his wife Cuc (35) run a small butcher stand in the commune marketplace. They sell pork at their stand. Before working with Mekong Plus and Kiva, they took out loans from other sources. They had to pay high interest on those loans, which severely cut into their profits. They were not left with much to raise their 2 sons, M. Nhat Hong (12) and M. Nhat Huong (10). They hope that they can partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva so that they can increase their profits and save money to send their children to school.

Cuc usually tends to their stand in the market. They earn about 20-25,000 VND (US$1.25-1.56) per day from selling pork. They would like this loan in order to buy more pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to provide pork to sell at their meat stand

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María B. A. is part of the village bank “Kusikuy” which is Quechua (native language) for “Happiness.” María, who is a proud mother of seven children, has been in the industry of “ganadería,” or stockbreeding, for more than 20 years. Her daily business consists of traveling great distances to the countryside where she buys young bulls and cows. These she takes to her corral outside the city where they stay for several months as she fattens them up to eventually be sold to her clients. She began when her best friend, who is also a stockbreeder, invited her to be a business partner. Together, they began with small products such as eggs and wool, and eventually branched out into the profitable business of stockbreeding.

This 27-year-old, who lights up the room with her friendly conversation and energetic character, has another business in artesanías. She and another friend meet on a regular basis to weave beautiful blankets, which she then sells to her many clients. Most of her work is on a contract basis and the majority of her clients are foreigners who wish to return to their country with a colorful souvenir. María says her goal has always been to save up enough money from both of her businesses and open a small artesanía shop around the corner from her home. As stockbreeding is a particularly strenuous way to make a living and as María grows older, opening a small store would become an especially ideal source of income.

María says she feels very happy and content to be a part of her village bank because it has taught her how to save her money and earn interest. It is also an important place for women to meet and share ideas. María is requesting a $1,000 loan with which she will be able to fund both of her businesses through the care of her cattle and upkeep of her corral, as well as materials to continue weaving artesanás.

loans.use: María is requesting a $1,000 loan with which she will be able to fund both of her businesses through the care of her cattle and upkeep of her corral, as well as materials to continue weaving artesanás.

loans.name: Subgroup D Of Group Sungura

texts.en:
Hellen, age 26, is the leader of Subgroup D of group Sungura (Swahili for “rabbit”), which totals 31 members. Hellen owns a beauty salon which she opened in 2004. Before starting this business, she worked as an assistant hairdresser in other salons. Now her salon brings in around 10-15 customers a day and makes about $35-45 a week. Her sister assists her in her work. She lives with her sister and brother at their relatives’ home.

Hellen will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members Mwamtumu B. (selling fruits), Godfrey M. (selling fruits), Juma M. (photographer), Martha M. (selling chicken), and Stella J. (honey vendor). This subgroup has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses, and they were able to pay each back successfully.

Hellen used the previous loans to pay for her sister’s school fees and to enhance her business. With the new loan, she hopes to purchase more hair treatments and a new hair dryer. Her ultimate dream is to one day open a pharmacy.

In the picture, Hellen is the woman standing next to the man on the far right.

loans.use: To buy hair salon treatments and equipment

loans.name: Sarhani

texts.en: Sarhani is a 40 year old woman who has a small food shop from which sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products. She can earn US$5.50 per day. Her husband, M., has no fixed income. She requests a IDR 800,000 loan to expand her business. Sarhani hopes that she can increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Jose Celedonio

texts.es:
The business that José Celedonios works at is carpentry, which he has developed over the past 10 years with much sacrifice. His business is located in the market at the bus station in León. Since he was young he has had experience in this type of work, as he was in a carpentry workshop for many years. He tells us that this business has been the only means of support for him and his family. In addition, because of the business, his daughter is able to study.

One of Jose´s greatest achievements has been that he has been able to capture a number of clients in the area, owing to the fact that his carpentry work is of high quality and very professional. For the past year he has worked with CEPRODEL and he is very satisfied with the loans granted to him, as they have been made at opportune moments, helping him to supply the needs of his workshop. In this way he has been able to fulfill requests from his clients and continue to pay for his daughter´s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el señor José Celedonio es la carpintería que con mucho sacrificio ha venido desarrollando desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de León en el mercado la Estación. Desde muy pequeño ha tenido experiencia en lo que respecta a este trabajo, ya que por muchísimo tiempo trabajó en un taller y nos cuenta que este negocio ha sido el único sustento para el y su familia. Además por medio del negocio beneficia a su hija que es estudiante.

Un merito muy grande que ha tenido el señor José es que ha logrado captar varios clientes en su zona debido a que los trabajos de carpintería los realiza muy finamente y con alta profesionalidad. Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados pues se los han brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del taller y de esta manera poder satisfacer los pedidos de los clientes y seguir manteniendo los estudios de su hija.

loans.use: Purchase equipment and wood.

loans.name: Lweza A (2007) D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ssaku C.. She is a tailor and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth. Ssaku is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children, ages 6 and 8, who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Ssaku hopes to be able to expand her business.

Ssaku is joined in her small group by Christine N., Harriet N., Harriet N., and Harriet N.. Christine N. sells charcoal and wants to stock more sacks of charcoal. Harriet N. operates a stone quarry and wants a loan to boost her business. Harriet N. sells fresh food and wants to increase her inventory. Harriet N. has a piggery and is requesting a loan to purchase more piglets.

loans.use: To add to her tailoring business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo is 56 years old and has been married for 34 years to Prisciliana, who is 55 years old. They have 5 children aged 32, 29, 27, 22 and 20. The three oldest are married and live with their respective partners and have their own houses. The two youngest children, on the other hand, still live at home and help them with the business.

Ricardo tells us that previously he used to work at an oil factory that later went bankrupt. Due to this turn of events he decided to find a different way to earn a living and this is how he got started selling charcoal and firewood.

Thanks to his efforts he was able to support his family and help them get ahead. Additionally he was able to enjoy the comforts of owning his house and a truck that he now uses to deliver his products.

Ricardo proudly mentions that he is doing well in his business and that he can count on the constant support of his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase charcoal and firewood for him to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Ricardo tiene 56 años, está casado hace 34 años con Prisciliana de 55 años. De la unión de ambos nacieron 5 hijos de 32, 29, 27, 22 y 20 años respectivamente. Los tres hijos mayores ya están casados y viven con sus respectivas parejas, ya poseen sus casas propias mientras que los dos hijos menores aún viven con ellos y les ayudan en el negocio.

Ricardo cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba en una fábrica aceitera que luego fue a la quiebra. Por tal motivo comenzó a buscar una actividad a la cual dedicarse y fue así que comenzó con la venta de carbón y leñas.

Gracias al fruto de su esfuerzo pudo mantener y sacar adelante a toda su familia, además de obtener comodidades como su casa propia y una camioneta que hoy día emplea en la distribución de sus mercaderías.

Ricardo comenta orgulloso que le va muy bien en su trabajo y que además cuenta con el apoyo constante de toda su familia. El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de leñas y carbón para la venta.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Karankay Group

texts.en:
The members of Karankay group grow vegetables, such as tomatoes, lettuce, carrots and cabbage to sell. Nema and Fatmata are also engaged in small-scale retail sales. They said they would use the loan to grow vegetables to sell and use the income from their retail sales to pay the loan instalments.

The group would like to increase their farm activites and each member guarantees each other for loan repayment. Nema is 40 years and is married with 3 children. She serves as the group leader.

The Karankay group works together to produce vegetables, and to sell their produce at the market. They need a small loan to increase their yields and incomes.

loans.use: To grow vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny is 32 years old and lives with her partner in Puerto de Salaverry in Trujillo, Peru. A native of La Libertad, Marleny completed her secondary schooling. She has one daughter who attends school.

Marleny works selling cosmetics for a well known company. She also buys and sells clothing for children and adults by request from friends, family and acquaintances. She received her first loan 2 years ago and invested in beauty products to sell. She is a member of the communal bank called Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more clothing for the winter season to meet the requests of her customers. She dreams of having enough capital to invest even more in her business and continuing to increase her income.

La señora Marleny es conviviente, tiene 32 años, natural de La Libertad, cursó estudios secundarios completos, tiene 01 hija estudiante; vive en el Puerto de Salaverry - Trujillo – Perú. Marleny; se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de una conocida empresa , así como compra - venta de ropa de niños, y adultos, los cuales son pedidos por familiares, vecinos y demás conocidos. Se inició con Manuela Ramos hace dos años concediéndole un primer préstamo de S/.300.oo, el cual lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza como son colonias, shampu, etc. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Las Triunfadoras De Salaverry” Con el préstamo de S/. 800. el cual cancelará en 4 meses comprará chompas, camisas y ropa de niños para estación de invierno, ella entrega a domicilio los pedidos de sus clientes. Marleny sueña con tener un gran capital con lo cual pueda hacer mayores inversiones y generarse mayores ingresos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER BUSINESSES SELLING CLOTHING AND COSMETICS.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir B. is a 47-year-old salesperson who owns a grocery store in the small village of Imishli. He is married and has three children. He is requesting a loan to diversify and expand the number of products he sells in the store.

loans.use: To diversify and expand the number of grocery products for resale

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha K. is a fish seller in Preak Konlong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sam Ol Teav, is a teacher who receives only a small salary to support his family. They have five children, three of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. Their neighbor wants to sell a piece of land at a reasonable price so Mrs. Chantha Coub and her husband want to buy it in order to resell later at a better price. Unfortunately, they do not have enough money so Mrs. Chantha Coub requests a loan for this purpose. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to resell later at a better price.

loans.name: Pek

texts.en: Mrs. Pek M. is a farmer in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. On her plantation, she faces a problem: she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy one more ox to plow the field with the old one. Her husband, Mr. Chhit Sophea, is a firewood seller who earns a small income to help support the family. Mrs. Pek M. is 22 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the field

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.ru:
Хашимова Зухра 1983 года рождения. Предпринимательством занимается пять лет и на данный момент торгует мужскими одеждами.  Местом ее деятельности является рынок «Шохмансур», магазин «Наргис» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте большой выбор мужских летних и демисезонных футболок и накидок из хлопчатобумажных и маячных материалов производство Китая и Турции. Она закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая и Турции и мечтает сама ездить за товарами в эти города. 
Зухра узнала о программе Кива от подруги которая тоже участвовала в этой программе и хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zukhra K. was born in 1983. She has been an entrepreneur for five years and currently trades in men’s clothing. She works out of a shop named Nargis at the Shokhmansur market in the city of Dushanbe. Her inventory includes a large variety of men’s summer and cool-weather t-shirts, as well as cotton and knitted jerseys manufactured in China and Turkey. She buys her wares from suppliers in China and Turkey and dreams of traveling to their cities to make purchases. Zukhra found out about the Kiva program from friends who had also participated and she wishes to take out a loan in the amount of $1175 (4000 somoni) to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing, t-shirts, and sweaters

loans.name: Anbenakan (We Are In Agreement) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe anbenakan est un regroupement de huit femmes de la grande famille élargie des bûcherons du village de Kimparana préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Toutes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants.
Appartenant à une ethnie du Mali qui s’occupe de la confection de calebasses, des ustensiles, la fabrication des cantines et des boites à bijoux en calebasses. Cette activité a été apprise auprès des parents pendant l’enfance. En plus de cette activité, elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires.
Afin d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé les quatre premiers prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire), le groupe est à son cinquième prêt et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, la matière première entrant dans l’exercice de leur activité principale à savoir les cuirs, les ficelles, les gourdes, les calebasses, les feuilles de rôniers etc.
Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des paysans en feuilles de rônier, en calebasses et en gourdes et en cuirs et ficelle auprès des commerçants du marché.
Les travaux sont exécutés à la maison pour fabriquer des calebasses, des cantines et boites à bijoux. Par contre elles se déplacent de familles en familles pour réparer ces dits objets. La clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes et des fans des objets d’art traditionnels du Mali.
Avec les revenus qu’elles généreront, elles comptent rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Anbenakan consists of 8 women from the big extended family of woodcutters of the village of Kimparana, Prefecture of San (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). All are married, have an average age of 44 and on average 6 children.

They belong to an ethnic group which works with gourds, making utensils, trunks, and jewelry boxes from the calabash (bottle gourd). This technique is passed on from parents to their offspring in childhood. Besides this business, these women sell condiments.

So as to expand the size of their businesses, they decided to all join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso more than 2 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their first four group loans (solidarity loans), this group is ready for their 5th loan and hopes to use it to buy raw materials for their main business, i.e., leather, string, gourds, calabashes and palm fronds.

They buy their palm fronds from peasants and calabashes, gourds, leather, and string from merchants at the market.

The handiwork is done at home to make drinking gourds, trunks, and jewelry boxes. They then go from family to family to gather these objects. Their clientele is composed essentially of women and people who are keen on these traditional Malian handicrafts.

With their earnings, they expect to make payments on the loan and help support their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying raw materials (leather, palm fronds, calabashes etc.)

loans.name: Miriam Danixa

texts.es:
La señora Miriam tiene 38 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y vive en la calle Sepúlveda 300, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero por su situación económica no continuó estudiando. Se casó a los 19 años y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales son estudiantes.
Miriam vende carne de pollo en un puesto del mercado La Amistad.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas compró carne de gallina y empezó también a vender dicha carne.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en productos naturales para la salud. 
Miriam sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Ms Miriam is 38 years old and belongs to the community bank Luis Alberto Sánchez II. She lives on Sepúlveda 300, in the district of Moche, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her elementary schooling but because of her economic situation, was unable to continue her studies. She married at 19 years of age and has 5 children who are in school. Miriam sells chicken meat in a stand in the La Amistad market. With her first loan of S/. 300, which she repaid in 4 months, she bought chicken meat and began selling it. With this loan of S/. 500, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase natural health products. Miriam dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural health products

loans.name: Luis Eusebio

texts.es: El Sr. Luís tiene 43 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital llamado 380, en la capital de Managua casado, sus hijos ya están mayores y son profesionales. Los planes que tiene para su familia es asegúrales un patrimonio mejor para su esposa y  hijos. Don Luís se desempeña como taxista desde hace siete  años, anteriormente trabaja como ejecutivo de venta y posteriormente adquirió un crédito para comprar su propio auto y trabajarlo. Sus planes en el ámbito económico es aumentar sus ingresos  comprando una nueva unidad de taxi dándolo a trabajar, en estos momentos necesita comprar llantas para el vehiculo y darle mantenimiento para poder ofrecer un buen servicio  a sus clientes. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra que su unidad de taxi  siga ofreciendo ingresos y un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros. Para nuestra empresa  es importante el desarrollo de nuestros clientes.
texts.en:
Luís is 43 years old, lives in a neighbourhood called 380 in the capital Managua. Married, his children are grown and are professionals. His plans for his family are to ensure a better inheritance for his wife and children. Luís has worked as a taxi driver for the past seven years; before that he worked as a salesman and prior to that he borrowed in order to buy his own car and work with it. His financial plans are to increase his income by buying another taxi and putting it to work. He will need to buy tires for the vehicle and perform maintenance on it in order to give his clients good service. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, his taxi business continues to make good revenues and offer ever better service to his passengers. For us, the development of our clients is most important.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for the maintenance of a vehicle

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Yen C. is a group leader of five residents who all live in Peam Tonlea village in the Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs.Yen C. and her husband, Mr. Sum Kuoy, are farmers who own three hectares of land and cultivate rice for a living. The couple now faces a problem because their field is quite far from an irrigation system. They do not have enough money to buy fuel for their pump to water the field, so Mrs.Yen C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel for this purpose.

Mrs.Yen C. is 44-years-old and the mother of four children. Three children are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fuel for a pump in order to irrigate the rice field.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is 50 years old, divorced, and a mother of four children. Two of her children are in school through the help of government free compulsory education. She lives with her children in their family house in Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Felicia works tirelessly to provide for the needs of her children as a single mother. Her husband abandoned his responsibility, leaving everything on her. The family responsibilities rest on her indeed; she provides food on the table, pays the utility bills, etc.

Felicia was in tears and at the verge of giving up when we spoke to her concerning her current situation. She is an artisan and manufacturer of mortar. One may wonder what we use it for in Ghana. It serves only one purpose here.

Mortar is used to pound fufu; it serves as the bowl in which the cassava and plantain are poured in to be pound with a pistol. There is a particular tree in the forest that can be used to design or manufacture the mortar. Felicia goes to the forest and places the timber logs in order to be used for the mortar. It is said that the Ashanties use mortar more than the other tribes in Ghana. 

For the past two years now, Felicia has been doing this to take care of her home. It has become a challenge as she finds it difficult to get wood for the mortar as a result of a government warning on the frequent cutting of timber in our forest reserves. She is requesting the loan to buy wood to manufacture the mortar. With her larger customer base, Felicia believes she can make lots of profit from the business growth to help her kids in school. Felicia belongs to a village bank called ‘Onuado’ which means brotherly love. She also hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her family.

loans.use: To buy timber logs needed to make mortar

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.en:
Anatolyi is married with a toddler son. His family lives in the small town of Veliky Luchki. He owns a bakery. His business has been running for 6 years. Demand for bread has always been high, which is why Anatoly’s business has flourished. Presently, he has about 40,000 UAH in working capital. His profit amounts to 5,000 UAH.  

Anatolyi has requested a loan of 8,000 UAH to purchase ingredients for his bakery. The ability to buy more inventory at low prices will give him the opportunity to increase his profits and continue developing a successful enterprise while improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee cuenta con 33 años de edad, está felizmente casada y es madre de dos hijos que viven en su casa. Los padres de Haydee toda su vida se dedicaron a diversos cultivos, tanto de papa, arveja, y demás hortalizas; y en los primeros años de su matrimonio continuaba con estas labores, pero ha ella no le gustaba mucho la agricultura, por lo que cuando nació su hija, hace 5 años, motivó a su esposo para abrir una bodega, entonces él se hizo cargo de los cultivos, y ella al cuidado de sus hijos y a atender su tienda. Desde esa época le presta todo su tiempo y dedicación a su bodega, que al transcurrir los años ha ido captando clientela, y esto la motiva a seguir invirtiendo y trabajando en ella. Haydee está muy contenta con su negocio, ya que cuando la cosecha falla, o el precio del mercado no es tan bueno; su bodega es quien cubre los gastos básicos de la familia. Haydee es la presidenta de su banco comunal, es la encargada de convocar a las reuniones a los demás integrantes en casos de sesiones extraordinarias y estar pendiente del buen desenvolvimiento del grupo. Este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad en los pagos. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega, para de ese modo captar más clientes que le permitan acumular ganancias para la mejora de su economía.
texts.en:
Haydee is 33 years old and happily married. She has two children who live at home. Haydee's parents have always been farmers, raising potatoes, peas, and other crops. In the early years of her marriage Haydee continued raising these crops, but she doesn't particularly enjoy farming. When her daughter was born five years ago, Haydee convinced her husband to open a bodega. He did, agreeing to take charge of the crops while Haydee cares for the children and tends to the store. Since that time, Haydee has spent all of her time and effort on the store, which has grown a client base over the years. This motivates Haydee to continue investing and working on it. She is very happy with her business, because now when the crop fails or market prices are down her store is able to cover the family's basic expenses. Haydee is president of her community bank, in charge of organizing member meetings in extreme cases and staying in tune with the involvement of the group. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she has always demonstrated responsibility in her repayments. The money that she's asking for will go toward increasing the merchandise in her store so that she can capture more clients and earn more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.ru: Абдуразок 1964  года рождения женат ,имеет  4 детей. Работает в трактористом в колхозе. Но вместо заработной платы иногда выдают масло, муку и рис.  По этому он  также зарабатывает себе на жизнь продажей  скота или сельским хозяйственной культурой. Дома есть небольшой колодец, в колодце он установил насос для полива огорода и поить коров. Доволен кредитом и условиями Микроинвест.  Благодарен Микроинвест и КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdurazok was born in 1964, he is married and has 4 children. He works as a tractor driver at the collective farm. However, instead of a salary sometimes he is given oil, flour and rice. Because of this he also earns money by selling livestock and by agriculture. At home he has a small well, where he installed a small pump in order to water the garden and give water to the cattle. He is happy with the loan and terms from MicroInvest. He is gratefull to MicroInvest and Kiva for their support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
AIDA H. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dalilas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Sucre N°  1014 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 37 años de edad, 03 menores hijos y su esposo se desempeña actualmente como chofer de auto colectivo (Transportista).

Desde hace ya 01 año que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300 Nuevos Soles con lo cual compró ropa, ahora amplió el negocio a la venta de peluches

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de peluches y ropa de temporada al por mayor directamente de Lima (ciudad) para estas fiestas patronales de  San Juan donde aumenta la demanda de estos productos.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos y está conforme con el trabajo que viene realizando en la región, es una ayuda para las mujeres que quieren seguir adelante, apoyando al ingreso económico de las familias.
texts.en:
Aida H. P. belongs to the “Las Dalilas” community bank. She lives at Jr. Sucre N° 1014 in the Callería district. She is 37, and she has 3 minor children. Her husband is a collective taxi driver. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought clothes. Now she is expanding her business and selling stuffed animals. With this loan of 1,200 PEN she will buy stuffed animals. She will also buy wholesale seasonal clothes from Lima for the patron saint’s day in San Juan, where there is an increased demand for these products. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, and she is satisfied with their work in the region. It is a help to women who want to get ahead by supporting the economic income of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stuffed animals and articles of clothing

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna U. is 40 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a carpenter and they have four children. 

Due to financial insufficiency she decided to engage in dried-fish vending. Her business is a big help financially, specifically in their daily basic needs and school allowances.

Mrs. U. is now on her 4th loan, obtaining PHP8,000. Her loan is intended for additional capital for dried fish vending. Her regular customers are her friends, neighbors, and relatives.

She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs, having a stall in the public market and being able to send their children to school and having them attend a degree course.

loans.use: As additional capital for dried-fish vending

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
The group, United Women, was formed through the gathering of several neighbors from the district Ypati from the city of Villa Elisa.  The participants formed a committee in order to apply for a group loan and to satisfy the needs for capital that every one of them had for their respective businesses.  All of the participants of the group depend on their businesses and with time have been growing and improving little by little, thanks to the teamwork and the unity among the participants. 

1	Demetria C. - Coal sales 
2	Ceferina M. - Grocery store  
3	Antonia Lopez - Vegetable sales
4	Ramona C. - Convenience store 
5	Petrona C. - Grocery store 
6	Basilia M. - Cosmetic sales 
7	Elida Benitez - Dressmaker 
8	Ester A. - Handicrafts 
9	Zunilda H. - Ice cream sales 
10	Higinia A. - Recycling 
11	Karina A. M. - Plastics sales 
12	Maria Josefina G. - Cosmetic sales
