Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, son principale activité se limite à la production et la vente de la farine de manioc et la culture du mais. Elle réalise ses activités pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais son niveau de de production ne lui permet pas de réaliser un rendement meilleur afin de lui permettre de couvrir toutes les charges afférentes à l’éducation de ses enfants et  surtout les filles en age de scolarisation. Au regard de ce qui précède, elle souhaite avoir un financement lui permettant d’acheter du manioc à grande échelle, conséquence d’une production importante afin d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akoélé D. was born on December 31, 1970 in Dalavé. Married and the mother of three children, her principal money-earning activity is limited to the production and sale of manioc flour and growing corn. She works at these businesses to support her family. However, her production level does not allow her to earn enough to cover all the different needs of her family in regard to the education of her children, and above all the girls of school age. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy bulk quantities of manioc, so as to produce manioc flour in larger quantity and be able to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: production and sale of manioc flour and growing corn

loans.name: Lamosa

texts.en: Lamosa M., 40, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the Handicrafts business. She sells to the general public and tourists two days per week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala.  SPBD loans are Lamosa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Lamosa's loan will be spent on her children's school fees and home improvement.

loans.use: School fees, iron roofing, cement and timber.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
“Work hard to have a good harvest”; this is the principle of life of Jocelyn Q., a 40-year-old resident of Bangar, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya.  She is married to Joseph and they have three children, all students. The eldest is in his second year of college, the second is a fourth-year high school student and the youngest is already in pre-school. The couple helps each other manage their farming business, which is the source of income for their family.  

Aside from farming, Jocelyn also sells the vegetables that they harvest.  She accompanies her husband in planting rice and vegetables on their farm.  With her desire to increase their harvest, she is applying for loan of PHP 8,000 for maintaining their farm.  She believes that the amount will be very useful for the growth of their business.

loans.use: Farm Maintenance

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: La señora Ángela Maria García R. , tiene la edad de 35 años , habita en las pilas Oriental , ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya , junto a su esposo el cual , trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo 4 hijos , los cuales le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas en sus tiempos libre , ya que estos jóvenes estudian , los panes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , desde hace 13 años trabaja como agricultura , ella inicio esta actividad con la ayuda de su papá , la mayor dificulta que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la sequilla que le afecta bastante . Con el financiamiento obtenido, a va comprar los insumos que requieren los cultivos y poder tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ángela Maria García R., 35, lives in Las Pilas Oriental in the city of Masaya. She lives with her husband who works to help her pay their household expenses. They have four children who go to school. The children help with the farming work in their free time. The plan for their family is to improve living conditions. The biggest difficulty they have is the lack of financing. She has worked as a farmer for thirteen years. She started this work with her father’s help. The biggest difficulty is the lack of financing and the drought, which greatly affects her. With the loan she will buy the necessary supplies for her crops to be able to have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Kouma

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité la vente de produits alimentaires, elle est très dynamique, elle est souvent rare de voir les hommes   faire ce genre de commerce. Elle  conquiert  tous les jours de nouveaux clients. Elle  veut agrandir son commerce en y associant la vente de céréales afin de réaliser plus de recettes. Elle sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs d’haricots, 10 sacs de mil, 5 paniers moyens de piments verts, 1 grand panier de tomates et divers produits alimentaires.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants
texts.en:
This lady sells groceries; she is very energetic and gains new customers daily. She wants to expand her business and add to sale of cereals so as to make more money. She is therefore asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 10 sacks of dried beans, 10 sacks of millet, 5 medium-sized baskets of green peppers, 1 big basket of tomatoes, and other grocery items.

She is married and the mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals and other grocery items for resale

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia F. sells jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, rings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells in the market square in her community. Emilia hawks her goods and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Emilia is 24 years old, married and has two children--one girl and one boy, who are both in primary school. Emilia’s husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her goal is to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Allen

texts.es:
Allen vive en la calle  3 de Mayo de la zona  Villa Nuevo Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz

Vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija, en casa de los padres de su esposa.
 
El trabaja en su automóvil, como chofer propietario de servicio publico, en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la reparación del motor,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo normales. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Allen lives on the street 3 de Mayo (“Third of May”) in the Villa Nuevo Potosí neighborhood in the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and young daughter in his in-laws’ house. He uses his own vehicle in his work as a public transportation driver, on one city's central bus lines. He will use the loan for the repair of his engine. The constant use of his car causes mechanical failures and prevent him from being able to complete his normal work shift. This is his second loan with Impro; the completed evaluation qualifies him to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his taxi engine

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina M. H. de 53 años de edad  reside en el municipio Apopa del departamento de San Salvador. Marcelina  vive con su hija que es empleada y su nieta de 8 años que se encuentra estudiando la primaria. Marcelina posee su negocio dentro de su casa donde por las mañana hace ventas de pupusas y por la tarde vende almuerzos con variedad de platillos hechos en casa, el negocio de Marcelina también ofrece variedad de frutas todo el tiempo, el crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad es para la invertir en la compra de materia prima de esta manera aumentara la producción de sus platillos ayudando a obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcelina M. H., 53, lives in the Apopa municipality in the San Salvador department. Marcelina lives with her daughter, a maid, and her eight year old granddaughter who goes to elementary school. Marcelina has a business in her house where she sells pupusas (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) in the mornings. In the afternoon she sells lunches, a variety of dishes, made in her home. Marcelina’s business also offers a variety of fruits all of the time. The loan she is asking for is to invest in raw materials to increase the production of her dishes, which will help her produce greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is 35 years old and has four children. She makes a living running a small stand in the Gikomba market in Nairobi where she sells tomatoes and onions. Caren has run this business for the past three years, and before that worked as an exporter at the airport.  She has requested her first loan of $275 to expand her stock of items to sell. Caren hopes to one day buy and develop a plot of land on which she can build rental units. On a personal level, she would also like to one day own her own home. She describes herself as a diligent worker and as someone who enjoys the company of other people.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. It recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 37 years old. Arlene is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Arlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Arlene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flora María O. C. es una joven señora de 26 años de edad, quien vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son  la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería

Desde muy joven doña Flor se ha dedicado a la agricultura específicamente a la siembra de arroz, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo tiene un terreno en el cual ha sembrado arroz anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente. Comenta también que se siente muy orgullosa de si misma ya que ha podido ver como su proyecto ha crecido gracias a la dedicación y esfuerzo que ha tenido.

En estos momentos lo que solicita doña Flor es un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del terreno, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del arroz y lograr una buena cosecha.

Doña Flor forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su tercer crédito y dice que con el espera seguir creciendo como microempresaria y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Mantenimiento y compra de insumos para siembra de arroz.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna es una persona cordial y trabajadora, de 37 años de edad, tiene tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos, trabaja junto a su mamá pues se encarga de enviarle el pedido de pollos a un caserío llamado Roaboya que se encuentra ubicado a doce horas en bote del puerto de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus esposo que es supervisor de una empresa maderera. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” desde hace dos años. Empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles, el cual invirtió en productos  de belleza.

Con este préstamo de 1500 soles, invertirá en la compra de pollos vivos para enviar al caserío. La meta de Mirna es tener un local estable para poner un restaurante y seguir aportando para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirna is a cordial, hardworking woman of 37 who has three young children. She sells chickens and works with her mother. Mirna is charged with delivering the chicken orders to a small town called Roaboya located twelve hours by boat from the port city of Pucallpa. She is able to rely on support from her husband who is a supervisor in a timber business. Mirna has been a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” for two years and started out with a loan of 300 soles, which she invested in beauty products. She plans to purchase live chickens to send to the small town with this loan of 1500 soles. Mirna’s goal is to have a stable place where she can open a restaurant and continue contributing to her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chikens to send to small town.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy tiene un vehiculo y trabaja como chofer de radio taxi. Es el único que solventa los gastos de su familia ya que su esposa es ama de casa.
Vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus suegros.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (mantenimiento completo de su vehículo y arreglos de interiores, tapizado)
Es Tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, es un cliente puntual en el pago de su crédito y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Willy has a vehicle and works as a taxi driver. He is the only one that covers the costs of his family since his wife is a housewife. He lives in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz, in the home of his in-laws. The loan is to be invested in his business (complete maintenance of his vehicle and repairs to the interior and upholstery). This is the third time that he requests a loan from Impro. He is punctual with his payments and has a great desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his taxi, interior and upholstery repairs.

loans.name: San Martin De Porres Group

texts.es:
SAN MARTIN DE PORRES

En este grupo participan ocho personas, los cuales a través de sus negocios han buscado la manera de de progresar con el fin de dar a su familia una mejor calida de vida, tal es el caso de:
Magali R. I. tiene 39 años de edad, actualmente ocupa el cargo de tesorera en la esta alcancía comunal “San Martín de Porres”. A pesar que su esposo es el que afronta con la mayor parte de los gastos familiares, Magali decidió vender menú hace tres años con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo. Los platos de menús los ofrecía a los trabajadores de la municipalidad y UGEL, los ingresos de estas ventas fueron incrementando lo cual necesitó un mayor capital para la inversión de un saco de arroz, saco de azúcar y utensilios; es así que pronto participa de los créditos de EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD.
Utilizó las ganancias de su negocio en la preparación académica a su hijo mayor, quien hoy curso la carrera de diseño arquitectónico industrial en una universidad del estado, así mismo para sus materiales de estudio y pasajes. 
Magali hizo algunos trabajos de manualidades el año pasado para ello estudió en el CEO “San Juan Bautista”, tuvo que dejar de vender comida porque bajó las ventas.
Requiere del préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer muñequitos y adornos navideños: cintas decorativas, guirnaldas, adornos, cola de rata de vaR. colores, silicona, caritas de papa Noel y mama Noela, y napa que es el relleno para los muñequitos. Son muy lindos sus trabajos como se puede apreciar en la foto que trajo la atención a sus amistades y conocidos los cual le han hecho pedidos.
texts.en:
SAN MARTIN DE PORRES This group is made up of eight persons who, through their various business activities, have sought to progress in order to provide their families with a better quality of life. This is the case of: Magali R. I., 39, who is currently the treasurer of the “San Martín de Porres” communal bank. Although her husband is the main provider, Magali decided to prepare catered meals to help her husband. She offered her meals to city workers and to UGEL (local school). Profits from these meals grew and she needed to invest in supplies like a sack of rice, a sack of sugar and utensils. Thus, she began her participation in EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD's loan program. She used the profits from her business for her eldest son's educational expenses (materials and travel costs) since he is studying industrial/architectural design at a state university. Magali took some crafts workshops at CEO “San Juan Bautista” last year and created some items. She had to stop selling meals because sales declined. She requests this loan to buy supplies to make Christmas decorations and dolls. These supplies would include such things as: decorative ribbons, wreaths, decorations, "cola de rata" (rat's tail, a type of colored ribbon) in various colors, silicone, Santa and Mrs. Claus faces, and "napa" (stuffing for the dolls). Her work is very charming as can be seen by the photo and it attracts the attention of friends and family who have placed orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies to make Christmas dolls.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia DORIS pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo que estudia en el colegio.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our client, Doris, is a member of the Siempre Adelante Communal Bank. She is originally from her hometown of Cusco.

Doris is a 31-year-old woman with a live-in partner and a school age son.

She alternates her household chores with attending to her wholesale and retail fruit business in the Virgen Asunta Market in the city of Cusco.

Doris needs a loan in order to increase her business capital.

Our client is very grateful for the opportunity she has been given by this institute. Moreover, she promises to fulfill her repayment obligations according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for fruit business

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana tiene 43 años de edad, es casada vive con su hijos en su casa de sus padres. Ella tiene amplia experiencia en el negocio de alquiler de mototaxis, su esposo de Ana se encuentra en el extranjero el cual le envía remesas para los gastos de la manutención y de educación de sus hijos, la cual le permitio comprar una mototaxi con ahorros producto de las remesas, ahora posee 3 unidades. Ana no tiene su vivienda ya que se destruyo con el terremoto  por ese motivo es que se encuentra viviendo en casa de sus padres.Ana destina todos los ingresos tanto de alquiler de sus mototaxis y remesas para la educación de sus hijas las cuales se encuentran en la universidad y el menor en primaria, Ana sueña con ver graduarse a sus hijas y así también su menor hijo y poder construir su casa y así poder brindarle seguridad y bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and married; she lives with her children in her parents' house. She has extensive experience in the business of renting moto-taxis (motorcycles with an attached cab for passengers). Ana's husband is currently abroad, and he sends remittances to pay the expenses of maintaining and educating his children. Thanks to the savings from these funds, Ana was able to buy a moto-taxi, and she now has 3 vehicles. She is not able to live in her own house, since it was destroyed by an earthquake, and that is why she is currently living in her parents' home. Ana dedicates all of her available income, both from the remittances and the rental of her moto-taxis, to her children's education; her daughters are university students, and her youngest son is in primary school. Ana dreams of seeing her daughters and her youngest son graduate, and she also dreams of being able to rebuild her house and thus provide security and well-being to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her home

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S. is a low-income farmer living in the rural area of Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She is married with three children; one is married and a garment worker and other two are single and attend school.  Her husband always assists her.  Mom needs a loan to purchase farming supplies, such as fertilizer, insecticide and seeds to make a crop.  She owns a few looms to weave silk skirts for extra income.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Khoudia Fall

texts.en:
Ms. Khoudia Fall S. is a certified horticultural technician, but has been managing her brother's carpentry business for four years.  The workshop is located in the Medina Fall neighborhood of Thies, a city about 70 km from the capital, Dakar.  The workshop employs a carpenter, a machinist to operate the heavier saws and five apprentices.  They make both ready-to-use furniture for clients, but also do work for other carpenters in the neighborhood who do not have electric saws.  Ms. S. explains it takes about two weeks to complete a bedroom set (bed, night tables and armoire).  Problems with electricity blackouts are a daily headache, but still business is decent.

With the loan of 200,000 FCFA Ms. S. will purchase materials (wood, paneling, glue, etc.) to have on hand for their work.  This is Ms. S.'s first credit, though she has been a member of the bank since 2005.

loans.use: Purchasing wood, paneling and glue

loans.name: Akhliddin

texts.ru: Назаров Ахлиддин проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, не имеет детей. Назаров Ахлиддин имеет высшее образование по специальности "Педагог". Животноводством занимается более 4 лет. Назаров Ахлиддин откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Ahliddin N. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 30 years old, married and has no children. Ahliddin has a higher education and is a teacher. He has been involved in animal husbandry for 4 years. Ahliddin raises and sells livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Закуп крупно- рогатого скота

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Martha es casada, tiene 44 años y 10 hijos, Martha junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración D. tejidos artesanales, como pasadizos, fajas, bolsas, sus ventas los realiza a las diferentes tiendas y también venD. en la ciudad D. Lima.
Martha necesita un préstamo D. 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lana.
Martha sueña con tener una tienda artesanal en su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Juanito community bank. She is 44 years old, married and has 10 children. Martha makes a living, along with her husband, making and selling hand-maD. textiles: rugs, sashes, bags, etc. She sells the products she makes in Lima and various local stores. Martha needs a 400-soles loan to buy wool. Her dreams are that she can one day have a store of her own in her house and that her children adopt professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for crafts business.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Eam K., age 51, is married and resides with her husband in Kompung Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in the business of producing roofs made from palm leaves. She earns approximately US$ 2 per day income. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. She has been doing this business since 2000. Her husband grows rice on his plot of farmland, earning an income of US$ 2 per day. Their standard of living has improved since K. started this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. K. is requesting a loan of USD 150 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo A. is a married woman who supports her family with her general store and rice mill businesses. She lives in Brgy. Puey, Sagay City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their child.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her rice mill and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Amparo is now borrowing Php 15,000 so that she can buy additional equipment for the operation of the rice mill and for the general store. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 10,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Amparo aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional equipment for rice mill and additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Ms. Edith P., 26 years of age, is single and is a resident of Barangay I, Tangub City. She is very supportive of her family and her nephews and nieces.

To earn her living, Edith decided to engage in business and opened up an eatery, sari-sari (variety) store and mini rice mill for rice grains and cocoa. She’s been in this kind of business for almost ten years. Now she is earning an average gross income of P1,500 a day from her eatery, P150 net from her sari-sari store, and an average net income of P300 a day from her rice and cocoa milling.

Upon hearing the good news of Paglaum MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006, Edith joined the cooperative last year.

With a good credit record, Edith is given the privilege of obtaining P15,000 as her 2nd loan to add to the capital of her eatery and sari-sari store business. The future income from this loan will be used to meet her basic daily needs, loan repayments and support for her family circle.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her eatery and sari-sari store business

loans.name: Mrs. Nhanh Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group consists of fourteen people who live in live in Trapeang Lean village in Takeo province. Mrs. Nhanh S. has been selected by the others as the president of their village bank. They each will use this loan in different ways that support their business to improve their living conditions. Mrs. Nhanh S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice for supporting her family living. She works hard in her field, but does not earn very much income this way. She wanted to start a new business, but did not have enough money to do it. As a result, Mrs. Nhanh S. decided to seek for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding.
Mrs. Nhanh S.'s husband is a construction worker. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others attend a local public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora  María Eugenia F. es socia del banco  Vegaspamba ubicado en la parroquia Jadán  aquí su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos, su gente es muy amable y tienen la costumbre de brindar  la tradicional chicha de jora sobre todo durante sus festividades así como también el fiambre(comida), para las mingas, trabajos voluntarios y solidarios de la comunidad se convoca mediante la quipa (caracol del mar) también se puede  observar que la gente mantiene su vestimenta tradicional de lana, sombrero, lliglla (chalina), pantalones y polleras.

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años, de estado civil casada y fruto de su unión conyugal concibió  cuatro  hijos de 16, 14, 12, 9 años, su primer hijo trabaja como latonero, el dinero de su trabajo es para sus gastos  personales y para sus estudios en un colegio a distancia, su segundo hijo le ayuda en los quehaceres del  hogar y  sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo trabaja en la construcción, la casa que posee es pequeña  hecha de tablas.

 María Eugenia elabora  sogas de cabuya   desde  muy corta edad, éste arte aprendió de su madre y ahora se ha convertido en  un método de vida, trabaja en sus tiempos libres ya que también debe atender los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidar de sus hijos más pequeños, se encuentra muy contenta de estar con un grupo de mujeres que siempre buscan la mejor manera de salir adelante con sus familias,  este es  su octavo ciclo y con el dinero de su crédito comprará artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, artículos de limpieza y cuidado personal, entre otros víveres, así como también para cubrir algunos gastos escolares de sus hijos y, una parte para adquirir cabuya para elaborar las sogas.

Su sueño es llegar a tener una casa de losa.
texts.en:
María Eugenia F. is a member of the Vegaspamba community bank in the parish of Jadán, where the people make a living in agriculture and raise farm animals such as chickens and pigs. The people are very friendly and have the custom of toasting with traditional maize liquor during festivals where they also maintain their traditional dress with wool garments and sombreros. María is 38 years old, married and has four children, ages 16, 14, 12 and 9. Her first son works at a body shop, and the money he makes he uses for personal expenses and for his education at a distant school. Her second son helps with household chores, and her two youngest children go to a community school. Her husband works in construction. They live in a small home made of planks. María has made ropes since she was very young. She learned the craft from her mother and it has now become a way of life. She works in her free time since she has to tend to the household chores and care for her youngest children. She is very content to belong to a community bank with women who are always looking for a better way to make headway for their families. This is her eighth loan, and with the money she plans to purchase primary-need items such as rice, sugar, oil, salt, cleaning and personal products, among other provisions. She will also use it to cover some of the costs of her children's education, and another part to acquire supplies to make her ropes. Her dream is to have a house made of stone.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions, pay for children's education and buy supplies to make ropes

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.ru: Муродалиев Юсуф проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование средне - специальное "Водитель". Работает по профессии в УЖД (управлении железной дороги). Кроме того более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Yusuf M. lives in the town of Kulob. He is 41 years old. He is married and has four children. He has specialized secondary education in driving (vehicle operator). He works in the rail road administration. He also does animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. He mainly feeds and sells cattle. His wife also helps him with this. He is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 46 años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que con su poca experiencia le han enseñado a mejorar el interactuar con sus clientes. Ella inicio por sus hijos ya que quería brindarles estudios ya que ella no pudo finalizarlos, pero esto no la desanima ya que actualmente tiene un medio de vida. Este crédito será utilizado para la compra de cremas, colonias, pintura de labios y tratamientos para el cabello. Ella sueña con aumentar su negocio y establecerlo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 46 years old, and sells cosmetics and clothing. She has had this business for more than 2 years; with a little experience she has learned to interact better with her customers. She started working for her children, since she wanted to provide them with an education. She was never able to finish her own education, but this does not discourage her, since she now has a means of earning a livelihood. This loan will be used to buy creams, colognes, lipstick and hair treatments. She dreams of increasing her business and setting it up in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Angela Gardenia

texts.es:
Ángela de 49 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran  (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es madre soltera con dos hijos. Ella tiene un salón de belleza.     

Para lograr tener el salón de belleza tuvo que estudiar en un instituto y trabajar como empleada en un gabinete para obtener experiencia. Ahora ella tiene un salón de belleza pequeño y trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas productos de belleza para sus clientes ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cremas, shampoo para cabellos y cosméticos. En el futuro quiere comprar su casa propia y tener sucursales de su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Angela is 49 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban perimeter that was originally irregular, with various hills, rivulets and lakes that remain as ecological remnants in dissolution). She is a single mother with 2 children and has a beauty salon. To get her beauty salon, she had to study in an institute and work as an employ in another business to obtain experience. Now she has a small beauty salon and works from 9:00am until 8:00pm every day. To obtain more beauty products for her clients, Angela requests a loan to buy creams for hair and cosmetic purposes and also shampoo. In the future she wishes to buy her own house and to open branches of her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING  FACIAL AND HAIR CREAMS AND SHAMPOO FOR HER BEAUTY SALON

loans.name: Maridéath

texts.fr: A. Maridéath est née en 1976 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à LANIYAN Inoussa, un tailleur, Maridéath est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Maridéath et sa famille vivent au quartier Agbokou à Porto-Novo, depuis douze ans. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Maridéath a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Maridéath vend des vêtements et des sous-vêtements au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. De façon secondaire, Maridéath vend également des vernis à ongles  et divers autres produits. Maridéath s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Maridéath a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé et qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'accroître davantage son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Maridéath sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième concours financier.
texts.en:
A. Maridéath was born in 1976 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. Married to LANIYAN Inoussa, a tailor, Maridéath is the mother of four children, all in school. Maridéath and her family have been living in the Agbokou neighborhood in Porto-Novo for 12 years. The couple share the various duties in supporting their family. Maridéath left her studies in secondary school. To support herself, Maridéath sells clothing and underclothes in the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. Secondarily, Maridéath also sells nail polish and various other items. She buys her merchandise in Dantokpa, international market of Bénin, and also in Nigeria, a neighboring country. Maridéath has already received two loans from ALIDé which have been correctly reimbursed. Wishing to grow her business and further increase her turnover, Maridéath is presently requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing, underclothing, and nail polish for resale

loans.name: Ángela Consuelo

texts.es:
Ángela Consuelo C. S. tiene 36 años.  Es casada vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 10 hijos, Juana (21), Geovany (19), Angela (16), Maria (16), Mirian (15), Jesús (12), Adrian (10), Jhonatan (8), Jenny (6) Evelin (5) y Brenda (3).

Ángela  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Ángela  se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther y Naranjito.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción para que los ingresos aumenten y comprar un terreno. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas de la localidad en el mes de noviembre.
texts.en:
Angela Consuelo Chiimbo S. is 36 years old. She is married and lives in the parish of Estero Salado in the Ecuadorean canton of Chillanes. She has ten children: Juana, 21; Geovany, 19; Angela, 16; Maria, 16; Mirian, 15; Jesus, 12; Adrian, 10; Jhonatan, 8; Jenny, 6; Evelin, 5; and Brenda, 3. Angela is a member of the Fronteras Unidas rural outreach program in Estero Salado, some two hours from the agency office in the town of Chillanes. The group has 19 members. Many of the people in the area make a living from farming. Angela is among those who farm for a living. She grows cacao. She buys in Matilde Esther and sells in Matilde Esther and Naranjito. Angela is applying for a loan so she can plant more cacao and, in turn, increase her income. She knows the loan is a chance to improve her standard of living. Her greatest wish is to increase her cacao crop and, in turn, her income so that can buy more land. The biggest challenge she faces is at the harvest when the roads are damaged by heavy rains. Angela enjoys the local festivals that are held in November.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Angel Brady

texts.es:
Angel tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de un familiar ubicada en el distrito de Chpén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda su servicio por los diversos sectores de su distrito desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta muy avanzada la tarde, gracias a los ingresos que percie de esta actividad solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a sus familiares.

El continuo uso que le otorga al vehículo y el estado accidentado de las calles de la ciudad donde vive han hecho que su unidad móvil sufra algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan arreglar los daños, dar mantenimiento e implementar su herramienta de trabajo con mas accesorios.

Angel es una joven tranquilo y responsable, en la zona donde vive las personas que lo conocen le consideran alguien de confianza y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Angel is 21 years old and single. He lives with a relative in the district of Chepén, an agricultural zone and a regular trade route located in the province of the same name. It lies in the region of La Libertad, one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Angel works providing cargo and passenger transportation services on a moto-taxi (a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin to provide transportation services). He provides his service across the various areas of his district, starting very early in the morning and finishing very late in the evening. Thanks to his income from this work, he is able to cover his personal expenses and help his family members. The continuous use of his vehicle, and the poor condition of the roads in the city where he lives, have led to some damage to his mobile unit which requires urgent repair so that his moto-taxi will operate properly. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, which will allow him to repair the damage, carry out maintenance, and equip his working vehicle with more accessories. Angel is a well-mannered and responsible young man. In the area where he lives, the people who know him consider him someone they can trust and someone who is always willing to provide help when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing and maintaining his moto-taxi

loans.name: Tau Meni

texts.en: Tau Meni M. is 62 and married with seven children. She owns a business venture to sell ice-cakes (flavored ice in Styrofoam cups). Tau has four years of experience in this business. Tau needs a loan of 1,500 Samoan talas to buy sugar, Styrofoam cups and codial (flavoring). She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or about $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family. In 2007, Tau joined SPBD. This is her fifth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy sugar, Styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Pompeya

texts.es:
Pompeya es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada son los prestamos fáciles que le ayudan en el crecimiento D. su negocio.
Pompeya es casada tiene 9 hijos y vive con solo 1 hijo que ya es profesional, Pompeya tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su esposo. Además Pompeya tiene un puesto en el mercado Nazarenas en donD. venD. artículos plásticos, actividad que realiza por las mañanas.
Pompeya solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Pompeya sueña con mejorar su negocio y tener capital propio para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Pompeya has been a member of the Los Laureles communal bank for a year. What she most enjoys are the easy loans that help her business grow. Pompeya is married and has 9 children. She lives with just one of her children who is a professional. Pompeya has a grocery store in her home where she stocks groceries, vegetables and meat. She is open for business daily with help from her husband. In addition, Pompeya has a stand in the Nazarenas market where she sells plastic items during the morning. Pompeya is asking for 1000 soles to buy rice and sugar. Pompeya dreams with improving her business and with having her own capital to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mr. Chum S., 59, has been working in the construction sector for years. He goes to work from construction site to construction site around his community, earning $3 per day. He also helps his wife plant crops when he is free from his job. The couple has three children: one is already married and lives separately and the other two are single and live at home. The coming rainy season is good for growing; however, Chum S. doesn't have supplies for his field. He is requesting a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticide, a pump and seeds for planting. Chum S. will use the remaining cash to repair his broken cow stall.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticide, a pump and seeds for planting

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga A. is 50 years old and married to Ruben, a fisherman. They were blessed with only one child who is now 22 years old, but because of their meager income, they were not able to send their only child to college. Her son has his own family now and has grown to become a fisherman like his father. 

When she joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.(ASHI), a partner MFI (microfinance institute) of Kiva in the Philippines, way back in 2005 they already have gear to be used for fishing, which is their primary source of income. However, since her son is already engaged in fishing, the couple decided to perk up their fishing business, so they decided to look for capital and joined ASHI. All her previous loans were utilized in fishing and the profits were used in her hog-fattening business. 

Now they are again applying for a loan to invest in putting up a fish cage/pond. They will buy raw materials, such as fishing net, bamboo poles and ropes, and pay for the labor and buy fish fingerlings. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will support her all the way until she reaches her goal. She wanted to help her grandchildren in their schooling and provide them with a better life.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction of a fish pond, to pay for labor and to buy fish fingerlings

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina D. C. is a married woman who lives in Sa-ac 1, Buaya, Cordova, Cebu. She earns a living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, Jose D. C., who is 47 years old, works as a Trisikad driver. They have 5 children who are aged 5 to 22: 1 already has a family, 1 works to help support the family and 2 children are currently going to school. 

Cristina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cristina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,500 helped to lift the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000. She intends to use this to purchase more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs. Cristina D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kassiaki

texts.fr: kassiaki est un homme de 35 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants, il est un coiffeur et a ouvert un salon qu'il exploite pour son propre compte, pour attirer de nouveaux clients, il veut réaménager son salon, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter un antenne, 2 rallonges, 2 serrures et divers. il a une expérience de 5 ans dans cette activité.
texts.en: Kassiaki is a 35-year-old man who is married and a father of two children.  He is a barber and has opened his own shop.  To attract new customers, he wants to fix up his shop.  He is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying an antenna, two extension cords, two locks, and other items. He has five years of experience in this business.

loans.use: Buying an antenna, extension cords, locks, and other items for fixing up his barber shop

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: Monsieur Daouda N. est âgé de 30ans. Il habite à Yoff. Il évolue dans le secteur de la pêche depuis 1996. C’est après avoir abandonné l’école qu’il a opté pour cette activité. Sa passion est d’aller en haute mer, attraper beaucoup de poissons qu’il va vendre aux mareyeurs. Il est marié,  soutien de famille et père  d’un enfant de 9 mois. Monsieur N. est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2007. Il a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destiné  à l’achat d’un appareil GPS  pour mieux gérer  et sécuriser son activité. L’amélioration de ses revenus lui permettra d’améliorer sa situation sociale ainsi que celle de sa famille. Son rêve est d’avoir la possibilité d’épargner et d’acquérir un terrain avec les revenus de son activité.
texts.en: Mr Daouda N. is 30 years old. He lives in Yoff.He has been working in the fishing business since 1996.It was after abandoning school that he chose this occupation. His passion is to go out to the open sea to catch plenty of fish that he then sells to the wholesale fish merchants. He is married, the bread winner of the family and has a son of 9 months old. Mr N. has been a member of the Yoff fund since July 2007.He has already repaid 2 previous loans to the organisation. He requests a credit of 300000 frs intended for the purchase of a GPS appliance to improve the management and safety of his activity. The increase in his income will allow him to improve his social situation and that of his family. His dream is to have the possibility of saving up and buying some land with the profits from his business.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing materials

loans.name: Melvien

texts.en:
Melvien E. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old. Melvien is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Melvien owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling cosmetics from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Melvien has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melvien joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Melvien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Melvien is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Melvien from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for sale

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Hortencia es una persona casada, y tiene 2 hijas que viven con ella, son menores de edad, donde viven ellas es un callejón que se encuentra ubicado a las afueras de la ciudad, en el ejido de Villa de Fuente, y como está muy retirado, ella y su esposo pensaron en cercar el frente de la casa, para evitar la entrada de animales que mas que molestar, se meten al jardín a hacer sus necesidades, ella dice que ya se canso de ver que los animales se meten y la opción es poner una cerca al frente de su casa que es donde les hace falta, ellos creen que al llevar a cabo este proyecto se evitaran la entrada de los animales y se mantendrá más limpio el jardín.
Se tomó la foto del esposo de la Sra Hortencia debido a que ella trabaja todo el día y ha sido imposible poder contactarla en su domicilio.
texts.en: Hortencia is married and has two dependent daughters who live with her.  They live in a dead-end street on the outskirts of the city, on the cooperative land of Villa de Fuente.  As their home is in a very remote location, Hortencia and her husband would like to fence in the front of their yard to avoid animals coming in.  More than just being annoying, the animals come into the garden and do their business on the yard.  Hortencia says that she is tired of seeing the animals coming in and would like to install a fence in front of her home which is where it is needed.  Hortencia and her husband believe that in carrying out this project, they will stop the animals coming in and keep their yard cleaner.

loans.use: To install a metal fence in front of her home

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Eliana; ella tiene 26 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de pan ,la socia elabora todo tipo de pan para luego venderlo en forma ambulatoria a sus clientes en la plaza de Urcos y  de esta forma poder sacar a su familia adelante ya que es la única actividad que realiza por el momento.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar pan como azúcar, harina,manteca entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “QORI ORCCO”. The bank is located in Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco state.

The member is Mrs. Luz Eliana;  she is 26 years old, married, and has 2 children. The member alternates her daily chores with her business selling bread. She makes all kinds of bread to then sell as a street vendor to her customers in the Urcos plaza and in this way she is able to support her family, and this is the only work she has at the moment.

The member seeks a loan to buy ingredients to make bread such as sugar, flour, butter, and more.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make bread such as sugar, flour, butter, and more

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 38 years old. Samuel is single. To make a living, Samuel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Samuel has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Samuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Samuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his  family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds & seedlings

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio V., 44 years old, lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He has 20 years' experience as a farmer. He hopes to increase his harvest so that he can buy the basic needs of the family.
 
He would like to apply for a loan at CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. In this way, he believes he will be able to expand the size of his harvest.

His reason why he chose CEVI is that he likes the program's micro-insurance coverage. 

Julio is a father with five children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. prepares piwa (a local dish made from corn) at Dompoase near Elmina in Cape Coast.  This dish is typically served with cooked beans. She is married to a farmer and together they take care of their 6 dependents. She has not been in this trade for long. With her earnings, she assists her husband in paying school fees and utility bills. She will add her loan to her capital to expand her business. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit in her business.

loans.use: To provide working capital

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Segundo es un joven emprendedor integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “LAS ESTRELLITAS D. SAN ANTONIO” Se dedica conjuntamente con su conviviente a la venta D. productos D. plásticos como tinas, baldes y además artículos D. locería como platos, floreros. Como es necesario tener ingresos para mantener a sus 3 niños paralelamente trabaja como cocinero o mozo en diversos restaurantes, su sueño es llegar a ampliar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda, actualmente asume los gastos del hogar con su esposa. Este prestamos será invertido en la compra D. locería  en general y plásticos como: bidones, baldes y tinas. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a seis socios D. esta alcancía comunal y una D. las socias acompañada D. su niña. La señora Sánchez B. Martha Magda llegó tarD. al desembolso por motivos D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Segundo is an enterprising young man who is a member of the "Las Estrellitas D. San Antonio" (The Little Stars of San Antonio) community bank.  He and his common-law wife work selling plastic products such as tubs and buckets, and pottery items such as plates and vases.  As it is necessary to make income in order to support his three children, he also works as a cook or waiter in several restaurants.  His dream is to expand his business and improve his home.  He is currently responsible for his household expenses together with his partner.

Segundo will invest this loan in buying pottery items in general and plastic products such as cans, buckets and tubs.  In the photo we can see six members of the community bank and one of the members is accompanied by her daughter.  Mrs Martha Magda Sánchez B. arrived late to the disbursement of funds for work reasons.

loans.use: To buy pottery items in general and plastic products such as buckets, cans and tubs
